translated: And although they are completely liberated through wisdom, the Bodhisattvas, the chief of the noble ones, act for the sake of others out of compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen po la sogs pa zhes pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad mi gnyis pa'i tshul la ches zab pa'i blo gros gang la yod pa dang / gzhan gyi don du thams cad mkhyen pa la yongs su gsol zhing 'dri ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen po la sogs pa zhes pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad mi gnyis pa'i tshul la ches zab pa'i blo gros gang la yod pa dang / gzhan gyi don du thams cad mkhyen pa la yongs su gsol zhing 'dri ba dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas, the great beings, and so on, refers to those who have the profound intelligence of the nondual mode of all the samadhis of appearance and no appearance, and who, for the sake of others, supplicate and ask questions of the omniscient one.

original: lan rgya che ba de ni de ltar blo gros che ba ste /
analyzed: lan rgya che ba de ni de ltar blo gros che ba ste /
translated: Those who have such great intelligence are the great beings.

original: btsun gtso de gang dag gis thog mar smos pa btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'khor du de bzhin du mchod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: btsun gtso de gang dag gis thog mar smos pa btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'khor du de bzhin du mchod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Those great beings who are mentioned first, the bodhisattvas, are to be worshipped in the retinue of the omniscient one in the same way.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis phyag gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zab pa mi gnyis par rtogs pa kun tu rig pa dang mnyam pas sangs rgyas kyis dbang bskur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi don byed nus pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis phyag gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zab pa mi gnyis par rtogs pa kun tu rig pa dang mnyam pas sangs rgyas kyis dbang bskur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyi don byed nus pa dang /
translated: The empowerment conferred by the empowerment of the hands of all buddhas is called the empowerment of the buddhas, which is the supreme, profound, nondual realization, the realization of the equality of all things, the omniscience of the buddhas, the ability to benefit all sentient beings,üîΩthe abandonment of all fears of existence, the attainment of relief, and likewise the declaration of the bodhisattvas by the exalted buddhas as irreversible.

original: srid pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / dbugs 'byin pa 'thob pa dang / de bzhin du btsun gtso sangs rgyas rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyir mi ldog bar gsungs pa ni mgo la phyag gis dbang bskur ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / dbugs 'byin pa 'thob pa dang / de bzhin du btsun gtso sangs rgyas rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyir mi ldog bar gsungs pa ni mgo la phyag gis dbang bskur ba'i tshul lo //
translated: The method of empowerment by the hand on the head is as follows.

original: bdag gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul yongs su shes pa'i don la mkhas zhes pa @4a * //
analyzed: bdag gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul yongs su shes pa'i don la mkhas zhes pa @4a * //
translated: The meaning of the expertise in the object of knowledge of the appearance of one‚Äôs mind is as follows.

original: la ; bdag gis sems rnam par shes par bya ba yul nyid du mkhas pa gang dag gis don yongs su shes pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: la ; bdag gis sems rnam par shes par bya ba yul nyid du mkhas pa gang dag gis don yongs su shes pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The wise who fully understand the object, the mind, and consciousness are said to be those who understand.

original: shes pa ma gtogs par phyi'i don med do zhes gang dag gis yongs su rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa ma gtogs par phyi'i don med do zhes gang dag gis yongs su rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they fully understand that there are no external objects apart from consciousness.

original: phyi'i don 'byung ba ni mdo sde 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyi'i don 'byung ba ni mdo sde 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
translated: The origin of external objects is explained in this very s≈´tra:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is destroyed down to the atom,

original: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
translated: and the atom is destroyed down to the part.

original: zhes pa'o // gzugs sbom po phyogs kyi char dbye na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal bzhin te stong pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gzugs sbom po phyogs kyi char dbye na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal bzhin te stong pa yin no //
translated: When gross form is divided into parts, like a house, an army, or a forest, it is empty.

original: rdul phra mo yang phyogs kyi char dbye na stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdul phra mo yang phyogs kyi char dbye na stong pa nyid do //
translated: Even the subtle atom, when divided into parts, is emptiness.

original: 'o na ci zhig snang zhes thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig snang zhes thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa /
translated: Then, asking the Omniscient One, What appears? he was told in reply:

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even without external things,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: the mind appears as two aspects.

original: zhes so // sems can sna tshogs kyi sems sna tshogs dang / gzugs dang / tshul dang / 'dul ba rnam pa tha dad pa'i cha byad 'char ba zhes pa ni sems can sna tshogs kyi sems sna tshogs la gzugs kyi tshul rnams kyis 'dul ba'i cha byang 'chang ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de dag la de lta bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes so // sems can sna tshogs kyi sems sna tshogs dang / gzugs dang / tshul dang / 'dul ba rnam pa tha dad pa'i cha byad 'char ba zhes pa ni sems can sna tshogs kyi sems sna tshogs la gzugs kyi tshul rnams kyis 'dul ba'i cha byang 'chang ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de dag la de lta bu zhes bya ste /
translated: The various minds of various sentient beings, and the various forms, manners, and modes of discipline that appear are those who have the nature of holding the modes of forms for the discipline of the various minds of various sentient beings.

original: gzugs brnyan gang dag gis sems can thul bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i cha byad 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gang dag gis sems can thul bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i cha byad 'dzin par byed do //
translated: They take on the modes of those forms by which sentient beings will be disciplined.

original: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud par rtogs pa zhes pa ni mdo sde 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud par rtogs pa zhes pa ni mdo sde 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
translated: The realization of the comprehension of the five dharmas, the nature, consciousness, and the two kinds of no-self is found in this very Sutra.

original: theg pa chen po'i don thams cad bsdu ba ni //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don thams cad bsdu ba ni //
translated: The summary of all the meanings of the Mahayana is

original: chos lnga rnams dang rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad rnams dang // bdag med gnyis kyi nang du ni //
analyzed: chos lnga rnams dang rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad rnams dang // bdag med gnyis kyi nang du ni //
translated: The five dharmas, the three natures, the eight consciousnesses, and the two kinds of selflessness

original: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
translated: are included in the Mahayana.

original: chos lnga la ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de dag ni kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub par bsdu ste /
analyzed: chos lnga la ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de dag ni kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub par bsdu ste /
translated: The five dharmas are name, sign, conceptualization, correct knowing, and suchness. They are included in the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: ming ni kun tu brtags par ro //
analyzed: ming ni kun tu brtags par ro //
translated: Name is included in the imagined.

original: mtshan ma dang / rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang / rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du'o //
translated: Sign and conceptualization are included in the dependent.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub par bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub par bsdu'o //
translated: Correct knowing and suchness are included in the perfected.

original: rang bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The nature is the dharmadhatu.

original: sred pa dang thar pa'i thun mong gi chud pa la bya bar @4b rtogs so //
analyzed: sred pa dang thar pa'i thun mong gi chud pa la bya bar @4b rtogs so //
translated: It is realized to be the common locus of craving and liberation.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad ni mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad ni mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the six consciousnesses of eye, etc., the afflictive mentation, and the fundamental consciousness.

original: bdag med pa gnyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang yod pa de dag thams cad ni skad cig pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa de dag thams cad ni skad cig pa yin te /
translated: All that exists is momentary,

original: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu bzhin no //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu bzhin no //
translated: like the sound of a finger snap or a waterfall.

original: rtag pa ma skyes pas na yod par mi bzung ste /
analyzed: rtag pa ma skyes pas na yod par mi bzung ste /
translated: Since what is permanent is not produced, it should not be held to exist,

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin pas na gang zag la bdag med do //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin pas na gang zag la bdag med do //
translated: like the son of a barren woman. Therefore, there is no self of persons.

original: chos la bdag med pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos sbom pa dang phra ba rnams shes rab kyis gzhigs pa ma khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos sbom pa dang phra ba rnams shes rab kyis gzhigs pa ma khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the selflessness of phenomena, gross and subtle phenomena such as form are destroyed by wisdom, like a clay pot, an army, or a forest, and become empty.

original: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the same text:

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, abode, and appearances

original: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //
translated: are the all-base, which arises in all ways.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu dge bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu dge bzhin du //
translated: Just as the eight and nine are virtuous,

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: so it is with the ocean and its waves.

original: gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom pa dang / phra ba shes rab kyis gzhigs te mi dmigs nas stong par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom pa dang / phra ba shes rab kyis gzhigs te mi dmigs nas stong par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the object of cognition, whether gross or subtle, is analyzed by wisdom and not found, and so becomes empty,

original: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / smra ba dang / smra bar bya ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa la sogs pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa med pas na mi gnyis par khong du chud cing rtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / smra ba dang / smra bar bya ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa la sogs pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa med pas na mi gnyis par khong du chud cing rtogs pa rnams so //
translated: then there is no dualistic conceptualization of the grasper and the grasped, the speaker and the spoken, the action and the agent, the produced and the producer, the thing and the non-thing, and so on. Those who understand and realize this non-duality

original: gzung ba med pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa med par 'jug ste /
translated: enter into the absence of grasping due to the absence of the grasped.

original: ji ltar byams pa'i dgongs pa 'byed pa'i lugs las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar byams pa'i dgongs pa 'byed pa'i lugs las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the system of Maitreya's intention,

original: bdag dang sems can don rnams shes //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can don rnams shes //
translated: Knowing the meaning of self and sentient beings,

original: rnam rig snang ba rab skye ba //
analyzed: rnam rig snang ba rab skye ba //
translated: the appearance of consciousness arises.

original: de yi don ni med pa ste //
analyzed: de yi don ni med pa ste //
translated: The meaning of that is non-existent,

original: de med pas na de yang med //
analyzed: de med pas na de yang med //
translated: and due to its non-existence, that also does not exist.

original: byed pa po dang bya ba dang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bya ba dang 'brel pa med do //
translated: There is no connection between the agent and the action.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis pa med pa ste /
translated: When there is one instant, at that time there is no second instant.

original: dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa dag kyang 'brel ba med pas na du ma bskyed par phan gdags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa dag kyang 'brel ba med pas na du ma bskyed par phan gdags pa bzhin no //
translated: Since things and non-things are also unconnected, it is like benefiting what is not produced.

original: blo gros chen po rim du byung ba mi 'thad pa dang / cig char byung ba yang mi 'thad do //üîΩrgyus mtshan nyid ma thob pas na phan 'dogs @5a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen po rim du byung ba mi 'thad pa dang / cig char byung ba yang mi 'thad do // rgyus mtshan nyid ma thob pas na phan 'dogs @5a * //
translated: MahƒÅmati, sequential arising is untenable, and simultaneous arising is also untenable.

original: pa dang / phan gdags pa med de /
analyzed: pa dang / phan gdags pa med de /
translated: Since the cause does not obtain the characteristics, there is no benefit or being benefited.

original: gnyis kas kyang bdag 'byung ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kas kyang bdag 'byung ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both obtain the arising of self.

original: des na skye bar bya ba skyed par byed pa la sogs pa chos gzhan mi byed do //
analyzed: des na skye bar bya ba skyed par byed pa la sogs pa chos gzhan mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, the producer does not perform other phenomena such as producing what is to be produced.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: de ste skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: de ste skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were conditioned,

original: mtshan nyid gsum pa der rigs te //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum pa der rigs te //
translated: it would be reasonable to have three characteristics.

original: zhes pa'o // skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa mtshan nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa mtshan nyid gsum mo //
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing are the three characteristics.

original: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: Or is arising unconditioned?

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
translated: How could it be a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon?

original: skye ba skye ba ji lta ba //
analyzed: skye ba skye ba ji lta ba //
translated: How could arising arise?

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin te //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin te //
translated: Not by itself, nor by another,

original: 'gag pa la yang 'gag pa ni //
analyzed: 'gag pa la yang 'gag pa ni //
translated: Nor does cessation

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: Cease either by itself or by another.

original: des na skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gud na med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: des na skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gud na med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since the phenomena of arising, etc., do not exist separately, dependent origination is not tenable.üîΩThe self is the agent of cyclic existence because of the adherence to the agent.

original: byed pa po la mngon par chags pas 'khor bar bdag / byed pa po dang bya ba la mngon par chags pa med pa ni de ldog ste /
analyzed: byed pa po la mngon par chags pas 'khor bar bdag / byed pa po dang bya ba la mngon par chags pa med pa ni de ldog ste /
translated: The reversal of cyclic existence is due to the nonadherence to the agent and to action,

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the thorough knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena and of the person.

original: mi gnyis pa'i byang chub snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam pa gnyis pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan thams cad mi snang ngo //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i byang chub snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam pa gnyis pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan thams cad mi snang ngo //
translated: In the nondual enlightenment, the nonappearance concentration, all images of the two kinds of discriminations do not appear.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa la mthong yang shes rab kyis mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa la mthong yang shes rab kyis mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the appearance, although one sees, one does not see with wisdom.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsgom pa na gzugs brnyan la sogs bar snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsgom pa na gzugs brnyan la sogs bar snang ba nyid do //
translated: Just as in the noble Perfection of Wisdom, when one meditates on impermanence, suffering, impurity, and so on, the images and so on appear.

original: rgya mtsho'i klu'i rgyal po'i gnas nas zhag bdun lon te byung nas zhes pa ni mi las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i klu'i rgyal po'i gnas nas zhag bdun lon te byung nas zhes pa ni mi las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul te /
translated: Having come out from the abode of the ocean nƒÅga king after seven days means the supernormal power of transcending human existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba gsum mgu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba gsum mgu bar byed pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One delights the three worlds.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad ces pa ni gnyis kyi mi gnyis pa'i chos zab mo sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas kyang der bshad de //
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad ces pa ni gnyis kyi mi gnyis pa'i chos zab mo sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas kyang der bshad de //
translated: The smile means the profound nondual Dharma that was explained there by the previous TathƒÅgatas.

original: rmi lam du snang ba bzhin du yun ring bor thun mong du snang ste /
analyzed: rmi lam du snang ba bzhin du yun ring bor thun mong du snang ste /
translated: Like appearances in a dream, they appear commonly for a long time.

original: phyi'i don ri'am rgya mtsho mching nam zhes bya ba gang yang med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i don ri'am rgya mtsho mching nam zhes bya ba gang yang med pa'o //
translated: There are no external objects at all, such as mountains, oceans, or space.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'dzum pa ni rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis su 'khrul ba bzhin du gang gis 'jig rten dpyad pa mtshungs par 'jug par brtag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'dzum pa ni rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis su 'khrul ba bzhin du gang gis 'jig rten dpyad pa mtshungs par 'jug par brtag go //
translated: The Blessed One's smile should be examined as engaging in the analysis of the world in the same way that one with blurred vision mistakes two moons for one.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis @5b rig pa'i ye shes dang / rtog ge'i lta ba dang / mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa'i yul de dag gis bsgoms pa'i chos bstan zhes pa ni gzung ba dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis @5b rig pa'i ye shes dang / rtog ge'i lta ba dang / mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa'i yul de dag gis bsgoms pa'i chos bstan zhes pa ni gzung ba dang /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma through the noble individual's self-realized wisdom, the view of logic, the tƒ´rthikas, the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the noble lands, is said to be the teaching of the Dharma through meditation.

original: 'dzin pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa dang / smra ba dang / smra ba ma yin pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa dang / smra ba dang / smra ba ma yin pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is free from the aspects of the two types of conceptual thoughts, such as apprehended and apprehender, entity and non-entity, speech and non-speech, action and agent, produced and producer, existence and non-existence, and so forth. It is the noble individual's self-realized wisdom, the characteristic of non-duality.

original: mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa /
translated: It is supremely profound.

original: gnyis kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty of duality.

original: rtog ge'i lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yang tshad ma dang / gzhal bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos 'byed cing snang ba'i tshul du bstan no //
analyzed: rtog ge'i lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yang tshad ma dang / gzhal bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos 'byed cing snang ba'i tshul du bstan no //
translated: The characteristics of the views of logicians are taught in the manner of a basis for the analysis and appearance of the dependently arisen and the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: ji ltar dge slong dag gzugs spyi rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin btsun pa 'di mi rtag pa lags so zhes so //
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong dag gzugs spyi rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin btsun pa 'di mi rtag pa lags so zhes so //

analyzed: gang mi rtag pa yin pa de sdug bsngal ba'o / 'di ci bdag gam / 'di bdag gi bdag gam /

original: bdag gi 'di'am /
analyzed: bdag gi 'di'am /
translated: ‚ÄúIs this the self of mine or not?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIs this mine or not?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIs this the self or not?‚Äù

analyzed: dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin te /

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs dang ldan pas cho 'phrul gyis ma gu bar mdzad pa la mchod cing bsnyen bkur dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir me tog gi gzhal med khang nas babs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung du rim gro dang bcas par phyag 'tshal to //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs dang ldan pas cho 'phrul gyis ma gu bar mdzad pa la mchod cing bsnyen bkur dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir me tog gi gzhal med khang nas babs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung du rim gro dang bcas par phyag 'tshal to //
translated: He is free from the passion of supreme joy, and he is omniscient. He is the lord of yoga, and he has various forms. He is the one who has performed miracles in order to make offerings and to serve, and in order to listen to the Dharma. He has descended from the celestial mansion of flowers and has bowed down at the feet of the Tathagata with respect.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rgya mtsho @6b mching nam gyi rlabs la gzigs nas /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems pa'i sa bcu pa thob pa na dbang phyug chen por 'gyur te /

original: des na 'bod 'grogs kyis dbang phyug chen po la mnyes par byed pa la nyes pa med do //üîΩci de 'dod chags dang bral ba la dbang thob pas 'dod pa'i rtse bas rtse'am /

translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the bodhisattvas, who are great lords, delighting in the pleasures of desire by means of their mastery.

original: 'on te 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig gam /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig gam /
translated: Do they delight in the pleasures of desire because they have attained mastery over the passionless state, or do they delight in the pleasures of desire because they have not abandoned passion?

original: shin tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di yin te /
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di yin te /
translated: This is a very pure stage of great delight.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so //
translated: It is the stage of the bodhisattvas.

original: kha cig la ni rjes su chags pa dang / kha cig la ni chags pa med par zhes rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams la gsungs pa'i zur sa bcu pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig la ni rjes su chags pa dang / kha cig la ni chags pa med par zhes rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams la gsungs pa'i zur sa bcu pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Some of them are attached, some are not attached. This is the implication of the statement of the lords of yoga.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu por dbang phyug chen por 'gyur bas na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin thob par yang brtag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu por dbang phyug chen por 'gyur bas na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin thob par yang brtag go //
translated: One should consider that the bodhisattva, having become Mahe≈õvara on the ten stages, has attained the concentration on emptiness.

original: dbang phyug chen pos smras pa'i rnal 'byor las 'byung ba /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen pos smras pa'i rnal 'byor las 'byung ba /
translated: The Yoga that arises from the speech of Mahe≈õvara

original: dngos po med las thar par smras //
analyzed: dngos po med las thar par smras //
translated: says that liberation is from non-entity.

original: 'ching ba dngos por rtog pa las //
analyzed: 'ching ba dngos por rtog pa las //
translated: Bondage is from the conception of entity.

original: de bas dngos po yongs spangs te //
analyzed: de bas dngos po yongs spangs te //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned entity,

original: stong pa'i dngos por gnas par bya //
analyzed: stong pa'i dngos por gnas par bya //
translated: one should abide in the entity of emptiness.

original: ci gtsang gnas rigs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dbang phyug tu bzung bar brtag gam /
analyzed: ci gtsang gnas rigs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dbang phyug tu bzung bar brtag gam /
translated: Should one consider that the one free from attachment to the pure class of beings is taken as Mahe≈õvara?

original: de ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.üîΩ

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes so //
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes so //
translated: That is concentration and wisdom.

original: che ba nyid ma yin par ba la mi kas rang bzor smras pa ni yid ches me rung ste /
analyzed: che ba nyid ma yin par ba la mi kas rang bzor smras pa ni yid ches me rung ste /
translated: The speech of the non-great one, the one who is not a great one, is not reliable.

original: spra bo che rnams dum bur brlags pas brgya byin lha'i dbang po'i smon lam gyis gson por gyur la //
analyzed: spra bo che rnams dum bur brlags pas brgya byin lha'i dbang po'i smon lam gyis gson por gyur la //
translated: The great demons were destroyed by the pieces, and by the prayer of ≈öakra, lord of the gods, they came back to life.

original: gnod sbyin dang srin po rnams smras ma thag tu 'chi bar 'gyur zhes pa de lta na ni dbang po la thog mar ci'i phyir dmod mos ma bsad brgya byin yang ji ltar de dag gis bcings @7b te 'ongs /
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang srin po rnams smras ma thag tu 'chi bar 'gyur zhes pa de lta na ni dbang po la thog mar ci'i phyir dmod mos ma bsad brgya byin yang ji ltar de dag gis bcings @7b te 'ongs /
translated: If it is said that yakshas and rakshasas die as soon as they are mentioned, then why did Indra not kill them with a curse at the outset? How did they bind him and bring him here?

original: sa de ni 'bod 'grogs kyis bstod pa de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sa de ni 'bod 'grogs kyis bstod pa de bshad par bya ste /
translated: This is the praise of the Buddha by Brahma, which should be explained.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin tshul nyid chos kyi gter //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin tshul nyid chos kyi gter //
translated: The nature of mind is the nature of phenomena, a treasure of Dharma.

original: bdag med lta dang rnam bral dri ma med //üîΩso so rang rig byed pa ston pa yi //
analyzed: bdag med lta dang rnam bral dri ma med // so so rang rig byed pa ston pa yi //
translated: Free from the view of selflessness, it is stainless.üîΩThe protector of the Dharma way, please teach here

original: chos tshul mgon pos 'dir yang bshad du gsol //
analyzed: chos tshul mgon pos 'dir yang bshad du gsol //
translated: what is to be known by each individual.

original: zhes pa la sems ma gtogs bar gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i chos med pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sems ma gtogs bar gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i chos med pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the Blessed One taught that apart from the mind, there are no external phenomena such as form.

original: gzugs na rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs na rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: In the form realm, when atoms are analyzed,

original: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
translated: the parts of atoms do not exist.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩWhat appears?

original: 'on ci zhig snang zhes pa dang / phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: 'on ci zhig snang zhes pa dang / phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: and Even without external entities,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: The mind appears in two aspects.

original: zhes pa'o // lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, possessions, and the appearance of the place

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //üîΩrnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste // rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: are the universal ground, the universal occurrence.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: The eight and the nine are like the waves of the ocean.

original: chos kyi gter gyi sgras 'bod 'grogs kyis sngon thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos thos pa'i rjes su songs bas kun gzhir brtags pa'i don du snang ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi gter gyi sgras 'bod 'grogs kyis sngon thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos thos pa'i rjes su songs bas kun gzhir brtags pa'i don du snang ngo //
translated: The universal ground is the appearance of the meaning of the universal ground, which is called the treasure of the Dharma, because it is the companion that calls out to the treasure of the Dharma.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas lta ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas lta ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from views because it realizes the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po'i lta ba spangs pas na de nyid dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po'i lta ba spangs pas na de nyid dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it abandons the views of permanence, a self, and a creator.

original: 'khrul pa rnams kyi gang gi sdug bsngal la rjes su 'brel bar 'jug pa de dang de ni bdag tu chags pa las te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnams kyi gang gi sdug bsngal la rjes su 'brel bar 'jug pa de dang de ni bdag tu chags pa las te /
translated: The suffering of those who are deluded is connected to that which is engaged. That is from attachment to a self.

original: mar me la sogs par phye ma leb bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me la sogs par phye ma leb bzhin no //
translated: It is like a moth in a butter lamp.

original: 'khor bar yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ba ni sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ba ni sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And in cyclic existence, there is the engagement of birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation. This is called the connection with suffering.

original: 'on te log pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par yang sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel bar 'jug pa dang de ni bdag tu chags pa las /
analyzed: 'on te log pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par yang sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel bar 'jug pa dang de ni bdag tu chags pa las /
translated: Even if one is not possessed of a distorted consciousness, the connection with suffering is engaged through attachment to a self.

original: de lta na yang ye shes kyi khyad par skyes pa rnams la gang ba dang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i yul spong du zin kyang de nyid du ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang ye shes kyi khyad par skyes pa rnams la gang ba dang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i yul spong du zin kyang de nyid du ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: And even if one has generated the special wisdom, one will fall into the abyss and so forth, even though one has abandoned the objects of the abyss and so forth.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: This is the measure of the harm of the adverse side.

original: de nas bdag tu chags pa las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //üîΩbdag med pa yongs su @8a * //
analyzed: de nas bdag tu chags pa las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo // bdag med pa yongs su @8a * //
translated: Then, from attachment to a self, the suffering of cyclic existence arises.

original: rtogs pa las thar te /
analyzed: rtogs pa las thar te /
translated: From the complete understanding of selflessness, there is liberation.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / mgu ba la sogs pa gzhan sus kyang byin pa'am /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / mgu ba la sogs pa gzhan sus kyang byin pa'am /
translated: Nor is liberation attained by the power of miracles, or by pleasing others, or by any other means.

original: phrag pa med do //
analyzed: phrag pa med do //
translated: There is no one to carry one‚Äôs burden.

original: bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rin po che dang / gser 'chang ba dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa bza' ba dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / g-yang sa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rin po che dang / gser 'chang ba dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa bza' ba dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / g-yang sa la sogs pa dang /
translated: Nor is liberation attained by good fortune, or by good or bad luck, or by holding jewels, gold, fruit, roots, and so on, or by eating, or by bathing, or by fire offerings, or by falling off cliffs, or

original: thal bas bsku ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang / dri ma dang / ral pa la sogs pa 'dzin pas kyang thar pa ma yin /
analyzed: thal bas bsku ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang / dri ma dang / ral pa la sogs pa 'dzin pas kyang thar pa ma yin /
translated: by smearing oneself with ashes, or by pulling out one‚Äôs hair, or by holding dirt, or by wearing matted hair, or by any other such means.

original: ba lang dang / ri dags dang / rma bya'i brtul zhugs la sogs pas kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang dang / ri dags dang / rma bya'i brtul zhugs la sogs pas kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor is it by the practice of cows, deer, peacocks, and so on.

original: bdag med pa yongs su rtogs pas lta ba thams cad spangs te thar bar 'gyur ro zhes 'bod 'grogs kyis bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa yongs su rtogs pas lta ba thams cad spangs te thar bar 'gyur ro zhes 'bod 'grogs kyis bsam pa'o //
translated: Liberation is attained by abandoning all views through the realization of selflessness.‚Äù

original: so so rang rig ces pa ni yang dag par rig pa mngon sum du ste /
analyzed: so so rang rig ces pa ni yang dag par rig pa mngon sum du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIndividual self-awareness‚Äù means direct perception of the correct view.

original: mig gi shes pa nges par zhugs pa dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi shes pa nges par zhugs pa dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: The eye consciousness is definitely engaged, like the correct knowledge of the exhalation of breath.

original: ston pa ni mi gnyis pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa ni mi gnyis pa ston pa ste /
translated: The teaching is the teaching of nonduality.

original: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa la sogs pa spyi rnam par chos bshad pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa la sogs pa spyi rnam par chos bshad pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is the engagement in the general characteristics of impermanence, selflessness, impurity, emptiness, and so on.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rang gi rig pa smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rang gi rig pa smra bar mi nus so //
translated: One who possesses such characteristics cannot speak of one's own awareness.

original: ji ltar dig na gang smras pa ;
analyzed: ji ltar dig na gang smras pa ;
translated: How is it that one speaks?

original: / don dang sgra yi khyad par la //
analyzed: / don dang sgra yi khyad par la //
translated: The object and the particular sound

original: smra bya smra ba 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: smra bya smra ba 'dod ma yin //
translated: are not what is intended to be spoken.

original: de sngon mthong ba ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de sngon mthong ba ma yin phyir //
translated: Because it was not seen before,

original: spyir ni nye bar brjod par bya //
analyzed: spyir ni nye bar brjod par bya //
translated: it is generally expressed.

original: chos kyi tshul ni gnyis kyi mi gnyis pa yin yang gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i chos kyi tshul lo //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul ni gnyis kyi mi gnyis pa yin yang gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i chos kyi tshul lo //
translated: The way of the Dharma is nondual, yet it is the way of the Dharma of duality and nonduality.

original: de la gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of the two are the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, dependent origination, thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, ten powers, four fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: mi gnyis pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / skyed pa dang / bskyed par bya ba dang / bya ba dang / byed ba po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / skyed pa dang / bskyed par bya ba dang / bya ba dang / byed ba po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The nature of non-duality is free from the conceptualization of subject and object, expression and what is expressed, production and what is produced, action and agent, entity and non-entity.

original: dge ba'i chos kyis yang dag bsags pa'i sku //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyis yang dag bsags pa'i sku //
translated: The body well-accumulated with virtuous dharmas,

original: bde gshegs 'phrul pas sprul pa ston pa ste //
analyzed: bde gshegs 'phrul pas sprul pa ston pa ste //
translated: The Sugata's emanations display emanations,

original: so sor rang rig rtog @8b pa'i chos dgyes pa //
analyzed: so sor rang rig rtog @8b pa'i chos dgyes pa //
translated: The dharma of individual self-awareness and realization,

original: thub pa des ni lang kar gshegs pa'i dus //
analyzed: thub pa des ni lang kar gshegs pa'i dus //
translated: The Sage taught this in the Lankavatara.

original: dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvirtuous qualities‚Äù refers to the characteristics of the perfections such as generosity.

original: de dag gis gang gi sku yang dag par bsags pa de la bstod cing phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de dag gis gang gi sku yang dag par bsags pa de la bstod cing phyag 'tshal te /
translated: They praise and bow to him who has perfectly accumulated those qualities.

original: phan 'dogs par gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: They request him to benefit.

original: snga ma ni las kyi tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma ni las kyi tshig go //
translated: The former is the word of action.

original: phyi ma ni 'bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: phyi ma ni 'bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The latter is the word of invocation.

original: 'phrul pas sprul pa ston pa ste //
analyzed: 'phrul pas sprul pa ston pa ste //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdisplaying emanations through magical power‚Äù refers to

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: the following.

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'da' ba med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'da' ba med //
translated: The buddhas do not pass into nirvana.

original: chos kyang nub par 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: chos kyang nub par 'gyur ba min //
translated: The Dharma does not disappear.

original: sems can yongs su smin bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings,

original: de dag mya ngan 'da' ba ston //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag mya ngan 'da' ba ston // zhes pa ste /
translated: they display nirvana.

original: 'phrul pas sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis de dag gi ston ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'phrul pas sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis de dag gi ston ces bya'o //
translated: The emanations of the buddhas display nirvana.

original: 'byung bar ston pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'byung bar ston pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdisplaying emergence‚Äù refers to the following.

original: gnas de nyid du sangs rgyas 'byung //
analyzed: gnas de nyid du sangs rgyas 'byung //
translated: The buddhas emerge in that very place.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa'i bstan pa 'bar //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa'i bstan pa 'bar //
translated: The teachings of the knower of the world blaze.

original: ye shes mi ldan de mi mthong //
analyzed: ye shes mi ldan de mi mthong //
translated: Those who lack wisdom do not see it.

original: gang gis spyod dag ma sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis spyod dag ma sbyangs pa'o //
translated: It is not purified by the one who practices it.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The relative truth is the other-dependent pattern, which has the aspect of duality.

original: mi gnyis pa'i tshul ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i tshul ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The ultimate truth is the pattern of nonduality.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas bcom ldan 'das che bar 'bod 'grogs kyis bsgrags so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas bcom ldan 'das che bar 'bod 'grogs kyis bsgrags so //
translated: The Blessed One is proclaimed to be great by those who are called the Great Ones, because he distinguishes the samƒÅdhi of the absence of appearance from the samƒÅdhi of the appearance of omniscience.

original: bdag nyid kyis rig pa gzhan la smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis rig pa gzhan la smra bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot speak to others about what one knows by oneself.

original: 'o na rnal 'byor pa dag gis thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa ji ltar gzhan la smra bar byed /
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor pa dag gis thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa ji ltar gzhan la smra bar byed /
translated: Well then, how can yogins speak to others about what they have heard, understood, and cognized?

original: de bden te spyi'i rnam par chos bshad pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bden te spyi'i rnam par chos bshad pa 'byung ngo //
translated: That is true, but they teach the Dharma in general terms.

original: gzhan dag gi yang gang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa rang gi rig par gyur pa de ci gzhan dag la rang bzhin du ston nus sam /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yang gang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa rang gi rig par gyur pa de ci gzhan dag la rang bzhin du ston nus sam /
translated: And can one who has known the intrinsic identity of something teach it to others?

original: gtan tshigs su bha dra ha ra'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhag pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su bha dra ha ra'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhag pa /
translated: To prove this, a verse of BhadrahƒÅrƒ´ is cited:

original: me dang 'brel pas bdag tshig ces //
analyzed: me dang 'brel pas bdag tshig ces //
translated: ‚ÄúI am burned by fire.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: sems pa gzhan du gyur pa ste //
analyzed: sems pa gzhan du gyur pa ste //
translated: ‚ÄúI am burned by fire‚Äù is a transformation of mind.

original: tshig pa'i sgras ni tshig pa'i don //
analyzed: tshig pa'i sgras ni tshig pa'i don //
translated: The word ‚Äúburned‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúburned,‚Äù

original: shes par 'gyur ba gzhan du'o //
analyzed: shes par 'gyur ba gzhan du'o //
translated: but it is understood in another way.

original: dharma k'irti'i gtan tshigs las //
analyzed: dharma k'irti'i gtan tshigs las //
translated: In the Logic of Dharmakƒ´rti,

original: brtag pa sgra yis rjod par byed //
analyzed: brtag pa sgra yis rjod par byed //
translated: it is said that ‚Äúthe word expresses the object of investigation.‚Äù

original: de ni dpyod phyir 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: de ni dpyod phyir 'dod pa ste //
translated: That is asserted because it is analyzed.

original: de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med //
translated: At that time, there is no intrinsic identity.

original: des na de ni brtags pa med //
analyzed: des na de ni brtags pa med //
translated: Therefore, that is not an investigation.

original: bde la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: bde la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: The nature of pleasure and so on

original: gzhan du mi rten 'brel mi nus //
analyzed: gzhan du mi rten 'brel mi nus //
translated: cannot be related to something else.üîΩTherefore, those are not

original: @9a * // de phyir de dag rang gi pa //
analyzed: @9a * // de phyir de dag rang gi pa //
translated: related to their own expressions.üîΩIn reality, the nature of the object

original: mngon par brjod dang 'brel ba med //üîΩyang dag don du don bdag nyid //üîΩsbyor zhing tha dad med pa ste //
analyzed: mngon par brjod dang 'brel ba med // yang dag don du don bdag nyid // sbyor zhing tha dad med pa ste //
translated: is not related to the object of expression.

original: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma zhes //
analyzed: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúForm is one or many‚Äù

original: de dag blo yi 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de dag blo yi 'khrul pa'o //
translated: is a delusion of the mind.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yang snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma lus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i byang chub dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yang snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma lus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i byang chub dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The Omniscient One, moreover, is endowed with appearances and is the lord of the yoga of all meditative stabilizations with and without appearances. He is the ultimate truth of non-dual enlightenment, free from the conceptualization of things and non-things.

original: don dam pa'i thugs rjes snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go zhes so ;
analyzed: don dam pa'i thugs rjes snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go zhes so ;
translated: With ultimate compassion, he enters into meditative equipoise on the meditative stabilization endowed with appearances.

original: / lang ka 'di sngon gyi rgyal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon thams cad mkhyen pa las 'bod 'grogs chos mnyan pa na /
analyzed: / lang ka 'di sngon gyi rgyal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon thams cad mkhyen pa las 'bod 'grogs chos mnyan pa na /
translated: The passage beginning Lanka, the former Victorious Ones and so forth refers to the time when the Omniscient One was listening to the Dharma in the company of the former Victorious Ones.

original: btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'dus pa ni gzugs mang po 'chang ba bzhugs zhes te /
analyzed: btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'dus pa ni gzugs mang po 'chang ba bzhugs zhes te /
translated: The passage the assembly of the foremost of the venerable Bodhisattvas refers to the many forms of the Bodhisattvas.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyis te /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyis te /
translated: the forms of gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, gandharvas, asuras, garu·∏ças, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and so on.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams dad cing 'dul par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gzugs rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyis byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams dad cing 'dul par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gzugs rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyis byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: The lords of yoga bless these forms in whatever way will inspire faith and guide sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe na sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa gzugs mang po 'chang ba'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gnod sbyin gnas pas na de'i tshe mi gnyis pa'i chos kyi yul 'tshal bas na bshad du gsol zhes 'bod 'grogs kyis sngar bstod cing gsol ba
analyzed: gang gi tshe na sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa gzugs mang po 'chang ba'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gnod sbyin gnas pas na de'i tshe mi gnyis pa'i chos kyi yul 'tshal bas na bshad du gsol zhes 'bod 'grogs kyis sngar bstod cing gsol ba
translated: When the lord of yoga, who has served many buddhas and who bears many forms, is dwelling in the abode of the yak·π£as, then, because he knows the domain of the Dharma of non-duality, he should be addressed and praised with the following invocation:

original: gdab par bsam par brtag go //
analyzed: gdab par bsam par brtag go //
translated: Please explain!

original: bcom ldan 'das ni dgung bdun te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog tu yongs su dag la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni dgung bdun te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog tu yongs su dag la /
translated: The Blessed One, for seven days... and so on refers to the highest purity.

original: 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po'i sems can mtha' dag gi don sgrub bar byed pa mi las 'das pa'i brtson 'grus dang rnal 'byor gyi dbang po bsgrags pa ste sdud pa'i tshig go //üîΩgrong rdal 'di na su gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol ba ste /üîΩde las bshad pa'i tshul @9b las rnam grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ngo bo gnyis su mngon par chags pa rnams la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs par ston par 'jug pa rim gyis bstan pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po'i sems can mtha' dag gi don sgrub bar byed pa mi las 'das pa'i brtson 'grus dang rnal 'byor gyi dbang po bsgrags pa ste sdud pa'i tshig go // grong rdal 'di na su gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol ba ste / de las bshad pa'i tshul @9b las rnam grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ngo bo gnyis su mngon par chags pa rnams la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs par ston par 'jug pa rim gyis bstan pa smras pa yin no //
translated: The one who is free from attachment, the Omniscient One, who accomplishes the aims of all beings by means of various forms, the one who is endowed with the yoga of the Lord of Yogins, the one who is beyond human effort, the one who is proclaimed as the Lord of Yogins‚Äîthese are the summarizing words.üîΩWho dwells in this town? and so on are the words of invitation.üîΩFrom that, the method of explanation is the one liberated from... and so on.üîΩFor those who are attached to the aggregates of form and so on in a dualistic way, the impermanence, selflessness, impurity, suffering, and so on are gradually explained. This is what is said.
