original: stong pa gnyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo zab mo'i tshul la bzhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: stong pa gnyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo zab mo'i tshul la bzhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of those who abide in the profound mode of the gate of liberation, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo sde ni zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa dbu ma'i tshul zab mo ste /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo sde ni zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa dbu ma'i tshul zab mo ste /
translated: The La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra is the profound mode of the middle consciousness.

original: sangs rgyas snga mas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas snga mas gsungs pa'o //
translated: It was taught by the previous buddhas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas bshad du gsol //üîΩzhes 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol ba btab ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas bshad du gsol // zhes 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol ba btab ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: Please explain it, O Omniscient One!üîΩThis means that they supplicate with a call, saying, If the yak·π£as listen to the Dharma from the previous omniscient ones, what else is there to listen to?

original: de ste sngon gyi thams cad mkhyen pa rnams las gnod sbyin dag gis chos thos na mnyan par bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod ces gleng du dogs nas 'bod 'grogs kyis de spang bar smras pa /
analyzed: de ste sngon gyi thams cad mkhyen pa rnams las gnod sbyin dag gis chos thos na mnyan par bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod ces gleng du dogs nas 'bod 'grogs kyis de spang bar smras pa /
translated: Fearing that they will say this, they call out to abandon that, saying:

original: rnal 'byor nyes dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: rnal 'byor nyes dang rnam bral ba //
translated: Free from the faults of yoga...

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: sngon gyi thams cad mkhyen pa las chos thos nas mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang bar yongs su shes pas rtags pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi thams cad mkhyen pa las chos thos nas mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang bar yongs su shes pas rtags pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang /
translated: Having heard the Dharma from the Omniscient One of the past, they fully understand impermanence, selflessness, suffering, and impurity.üîΩThey are free from the fault of manifest pride in liberation through the yoga of grasping at signs, self, agent, bathing, fire offerings,

original: g-yang sa dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rin po che dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor gyis thar pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skyon dang bral ba'i gang zag dang / chos la bdag med pa sems pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yang sa dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rin po che dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor gyis thar pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skyon dang bral ba'i gang zag dang / chos la bdag med pa sems pa rnams so //
translated: ravines, auspiciousness, inauspiciousness, jewels, roots, and so forth, and they contemplate the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gnod sbyin dag ni 'di na mchis //
analyzed: gnod sbyin dag ni 'di na mchis //
translated: Yakshas dwell here.

original: zhes pa ni sngon gyi thams cad mkhyen pas bsngags pa mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi skyon dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon gyi thams cad mkhyen pas bsngags pa mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi skyon dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: This praises the Omniscient One of the past, free from the faults of the yoga of non-Buddhists.

original: de dag la gong ma'i yang gong ma'i chos bshad pas sa gzhan rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag la gong ma'i yang gong ma'i chos bshad pas sa gzhan rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: By explaining the Dharma that is higher than the highest to them, they realize other grounds.

original: yang dag par 'jug par byed do zhes pa'o //üîΩtheg chen tshul la dad pa yis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la theg pa chen po ni chen po rnams kyi theg pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par 'jug par byed do zhes pa'o // theg chen tshul la dad pa yis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la theg pa chen po ni chen po rnams kyi theg pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the correct engagement.üîΩFaith in the method of the Great Vehicle, etc.

original: yang na bsam pa che ba ste /üîΩsems @10a * //
analyzed: yang na bsam pa che ba ste / sems @10a * //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the vehicle of the great beings, or it is great because of its vast thought,

original: can thams cad sgrol bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: can thams cad sgrol bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is engaged in the liberation of all sentient beings.

original: tshogs che ba'i phyir te sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gyis che ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs che ba'i phyir te sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gyis che ba nyid do //
translated: It is great because of its great collection, because of its greatness due to the distinctions of the stages and perfections.

original: bskal pa du mar byang chub kyi spyod pa dka' bar spyad pas mi skyo bar ni dus che ba'o //
analyzed: bskal pa du mar byang chub kyi spyod pa dka' bar spyad pas mi skyo bar ni dus che ba'o //
translated: It is great in time because it is not discouraged by the long duration of the bodhisattva deeds over many eons.

original: 'bras bu che ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don mdzad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi yan lag gis brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don mdzad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi yan lag gis brgyan pa ste /
translated: It is great in result, because it is adorned with the branches of the qualities of dispassion, knowledge of all aspects, performance of the welfare of all beings, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so on.

original: de dag rnam pa de lta bu'i theg pa chen pos rang zhugs nas gzhan dag kyang 'jug par bgyid ces te /
analyzed: de dag rnam pa de lta bu'i theg pa chen pos rang zhugs nas gzhan dag kyang 'jug par bgyid ces te /
translated: They, having entered the Great Vehicle in that way, cause others to enter it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid dag gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'i don du 'bod 'grogs kyis bsam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid dag gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'i don du 'bod 'grogs kyis bsam pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas themselves appear in various forms as Yakshas, etc.

original: srid gsum dbang po zhes bya ba ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad kyi dbang po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid gsum dbang po zhes bya ba ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad kyi dbang po'i phyir ro //
translated: The Lord of the three worlds is the Lord, because he is the ruler of all sentient beings.

original: me tog gi gzhal med khang du bzhugs nas mchod pa bzhes te chos bshad pa mdzad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: me tog gi gzhal med khang du bzhugs nas mchod pa bzhes te chos bshad pa mdzad do zhes pa'o //
translated: Having dwelt in the palace of flowers, he accepts the worship and expounds the Dharma.

original: 'bod 'grogs kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' chen po btsun gtso blo gros chen po la bstong  nas thams cad mkhyen pa la mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang bral ba theg pa chen po'i chos zab mo mchog tu yongs su dag pa sems can thams cad la phan par zhugs pa zhus shig pa ste /
analyzed: 'bod 'grogs kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' chen po btsun gtso blo gros chen po la bstong  nas thams cad mkhyen pa la mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang bral ba theg pa chen po'i chos zab mo mchog tu yongs su dag pa sems can thams cad la phan par zhugs pa zhus shig pa ste /
translated: Also, the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Great Chief of the Cry having bowed to the great sage, asked, Please teach the omniscience which is free from the doctrines of the tirthikas, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas, the supreme, pure, profound doctrine of the Mahayana, which is engaged in the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: rang rgyal nyan thos rnams dang ni //
analyzed: rang rgyal nyan thos rnams dang ni //
translated: The sravakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: mu stegs nyes las rnam par grol //
analyzed: mu stegs nyes las rnam par grol //
translated: are liberated from the faults of the tirthikas.

original: so so rang rig chos nyid gtsang //
analyzed: so so rang rig chos nyid gtsang //
translated: The purity of the reality of individual self-awareness

original: sangs rgyas sa ni thob byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa ni thob byed pa'o //
translated: is what causes the attainment of the buddha stage.

original: zhes bya ba de la rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos kyi gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su rtogs kyang phyi'i don med par phyi'i don la mngon bar chags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos kyi gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su rtogs kyang phyi'i don med par phyi'i don la mngon bar chags pa'o //
translated: Here, although the persons who are pratyekabuddhas and sravakas realize selflessness, they are attached to external objects, which do not exist, as external objects.

original: mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po dang / dam pa sbyin pa dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / gdab dang / g-yang sa dang / gar byed pa dang / glu len pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cha lugs 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po dang / dam pa sbyin pa dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / gdab dang / g-yang sa dang / gar byed pa dang / glu len pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cha lugs 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas are those who are attached to permanence, the self, the senses, the highest, giving, bathing, fire sacrifices, casting, cliffs, dancing, singing, and various costumes.

original: rin po che dang / rtsa ba 'dzin cing bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa za bas thar pa las 'khrul pa @10b rnams so //
analyzed: rin po che dang / rtsa ba 'dzin cing bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa za bas thar pa las 'khrul pa @10b rnams so //
translated: They are deluded about liberation because they eat auspicious and inauspicious things, hold on to roots, and hold on to jewels.

original: 'khrul pa de rnam pa gnyis bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa de rnam pa gnyis bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate those two types of delusion,

original: mchog tu yongs su dag pa dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa gnyis rtogs par byed pa theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa ni sangs rgyas sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu yongs su dag pa dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa gnyis rtogs par byed pa theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa ni sangs rgyas sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the MahƒÅyƒÅna Dharma, which causes the realization of the two concepts of the supreme, completely pure entity and non-entity, is what accomplishes buddhahood.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis der sprul te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis der sprul te //
translated: The Blessed One emanated there.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas kyi rtse mo 'dzin sprul pa mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas kyi rtse mo 'dzin sprul pa mdzad do //
translated: The Omniscient One, the Lord, the Holder of the Peak of the Mine of Various Jewels, manifests emanations.

original: 'bod 'grogs kyis kyang mchog tu yongs su dag pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rim la ya du ma la bzhugs pa gzugs sna tshogs mnga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das de la mchod pa'i phyir lus tha mar sprul pa byed do //
analyzed: 'bod 'grogs kyis kyang mchog tu yongs su dag pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rim la ya du ma la bzhugs pa gzugs sna tshogs mnga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das de la mchod pa'i phyir lus tha mar sprul pa byed do //
translated: And the one who is called the Lord, who is endowed with various forms, who is seated in the various stages of the highest pure yoga, who is the one who is to be worshipped, he manifests emanations in the end of his body.

original: stong phrag brgya pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde rnam pa brgya stong du klag ste /
analyzed: stong phrag brgya pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde rnam pa brgya stong du klag ste /
translated: The Sutra of the Hundred Thousand is the Sutra which is read in a hundred thousand sections.

original: stong pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro //
translated: In the words of the emptiness, etc., it is just as in the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: yang na stong phrag brgya ni gang gi ljags las don mtha' med par sems can la snang ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gi sgras don du mar chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na stong phrag brgya ni gang gi ljags las don mtha' med par sems can la snang ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gi sgras don du mar chud par byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, the hundred thousand is that from which the speech of the Omniscient One, which is the sound of the Dharma, is understood in many ways by sentient beings, through the end of the tongue.

original: thams cad 'khor ni ma bri bar //
analyzed: thams cad 'khor ni ma bri bar //
translated: The retinue is not diminished.

original: re re la yang shin tu snang //
analyzed: re re la yang shin tu snang //
translated: Each of them is very clearly seen.

original: zhes pa ni rin po che 'byung gnas kyi ri thams cad du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gnas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang / de dag na bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po la rin po che 'byung gnas kyi ri la snang ba ni nam mkha'i skar ma mang po chu'i snod kyi nang du snang ba bzhin du gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rin po che 'byung gnas kyi ri thams cad du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gnas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang / de dag na bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po la rin po che 'byung gnas kyi ri la snang ba ni nam mkha'i skar ma mang po chu'i snod kyi nang du snang ba bzhin du gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis so //
translated: In all the mountains of jewels, the buddha fields of the ten directions and all the omniscient lords of yoga residing in them appear to the yogi, like many stars in the sky reflected in a vessel of water.

original: ston pa dang ni rgyal sras rnams //
analyzed: ston pa dang ni rgyal sras rnams //
translated: The teacher and the buddhas

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ston pa dang gang dag 'khor der 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i mig yor dang / sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa'i rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul bzhin du bstan nas mi snang bar gyur pa ni 'bod 'grogs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i yul las 'das nas mi rtag pa dang /üîΩbdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba yongs su shes par mdzad pa'i don dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @11a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ston pa dang gang dag 'khor der 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i mig yor dang / sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa'i rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul bzhin du bstan nas mi snang bar gyur pa ni 'bod 'grogs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i yul las 'das nas mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba yongs su shes par mdzad pa'i don dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @11a * //
translated: The teacher and the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas who were assembled in the retinue, having taught in that way, through the liberation of a reflection, an illusion, a dream, and a magical display, disappeared. This is because they transcended the objects of consciousness, such as calling out and accompanying, and in order to understand impermanence,

original: pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo zab mo'i yul gyi rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnod sbyin 'bod 'grogs bdag gi lus //
analyzed: pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo zab mo'i yul gyi rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnod sbyin 'bod 'grogs bdag gi lus //
translated: selflessness, suffering, and impurity, and in order to cultivate the yoga of the profound object of the gate of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.üîΩThe yak·π£a Acalana said to the BhagavƒÅn, BhagavƒÅn, I will protect the one who upholds this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: khyim na gnas par mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i dbang pos byin gyis brlabs pas 'bod 'grogs kyis thams cad rten cing 'grel par 'byung ba thog ma dang tha mar stong pa nyid dang / dbus su nyid kyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyim na gnas par mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i dbang pos byin gyis brlabs pas 'bod 'grogs kyis thams cad rten cing 'grel par 'byung ba thog ma dang tha mar stong pa nyid dang / dbus su nyid kyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa ste /
translated: The verse that begins When he sees the householder and so on refers to the yogi's blessing, whereby all things are realized to be dependently originated, empty in the beginning and end, and empty in the middle by the wisdom of calling and accompanying.

original: sems 'khrugs nas 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems 'khrugs nas 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul snang ba bzhin no //
translated: The disturbance of the mind, the appearance of various beings, is like the appearance of a dream or an illusion.

original: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal pa la sogs pa lta bu'i 'khrugs pa bzlog pa ni gang gi tshe 'bod 'grogs kyi shes rab kyis gzugs sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa de'i tshe gnyis zhi zhing bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal pa la sogs pa lta bu'i 'khrugs pa bzlog pa ni gang gi tshe 'bod 'grogs kyi shes rab kyis gzugs sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa de'i tshe gnyis zhi zhing bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa dang /
translated: The reversal of the disturbance, such as dizziness and fainting, is when the wisdom of calling and accompanying does not observe coarse or subtle forms. At that time, the two are pacified, and there is no thought, no appearance, and no mind.

original: dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid yang dag pa'i rig pa de ltar khong du chud par mdzad pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyis so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid yang dag pa'i rig pa de ltar khong du chud par mdzad pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyis so //
translated: The wisdom and means are the realization of that suchness of ultimate truth, which is nondual and free from the concepts of entity and nonentity.

original: de de ltar shes rab kyis chos nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i mi rtog pa dang stong pa nyid du rtogs nas 'bod 'grogs kyis rgyu dang rkyen mang po rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / dri za'i 'gro ba byar dang /
analyzed: de de ltar shes rab kyis chos nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i mi rtog pa dang stong pa nyid du rtogs nas 'bod 'grogs kyis rgyu dang rkyen mang po rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / dri za'i 'gro ba byar dang /
translated: Having realized the nonconceptual suchness of phenomena through wisdom in that way, through the power of means, he causes the realization of the meaning of impermanence and emptiness through many causes and conditions, such as dreams, illusions, fire wheels, gandharva cities,

original: smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / mo gzhon gyi rmi lam du bu mthong bar byed pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi don gyi khyad par rtogs par byed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / mo gzhon gyi rmi lam du bu mthong bar byed pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi don gyi khyad par rtogs par byed pa'i don du'o //
translated: clouds, water bubbles, mirages, reflections of the moon in water, and a young woman seeing a son in a dream.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa dper bzhag pa thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa dper bzhag pa thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / stong pa nyid du'o //
translated: All examples, such as dreams and illusions, are for the realization of the meaning of impermanence and emptiness.

original: yang thams cad la thog ma dang tha ma'i stong pa nyid dang / dbus su dngos po gnyis med pa'i stong pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: yang thams cad la thog ma dang tha ma'i stong pa nyid dang / dbus su dngos po gnyis med pa'i stong pa nyid du'o //
translated: Furthermore, all things are empty of a beginning and an end, and in the middle they are empty in being devoid of the duality of a real basis.

original: phyi'i don du gzung ba dang / 'dzin par nges par byed pa rnam pa gnyis par byed pa thams cad la skye ba med par ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don du gzung ba dang / 'dzin par nges par byed pa rnam pa gnyis par byed pa thams cad la skye ba med par ro //
translated: All things are unborn in the sense that they are empty of the duality of subject and object, which is imagined in the case of external objects and in the case of consciousness, which is imagined as the basis of the subject-object dichotomy.

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang las de dag ni snang ba'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang las de dag ni snang ba'i chos nyid de /
translated: These things appear through the power of error.

original: shes rab kyis de dag mi dmigs so zhes so //üîΩlta ba med cing lta ba'ang med //
analyzed: shes rab kyis de dag mi dmigs so zhes so // lta ba med cing lta ba'ang med //
translated: They are not perceived by wisdom.üîΩThere is no view, nor even a viewer;

original: smra med smra bar bya med na //
analyzed: smra med smra bar bya med na //
translated: There is no meditation, nor even a meditator;

original: gzhan du rnam par rtog pa 'di //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par rtog pa 'di //
translated: Elsewhere, this conceptualization

original: sangs rgyas dang na chos ltar gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang na chos ltar gnas //
translated: Rests in the Buddha and the Dharma.

original: @11b zhes bya ba la lta ba ni phyi'i don med pas na med do //
analyzed: @11b zhes bya ba la lta ba ni phyi'i don med pas na med do //
translated: There is no view, because there are no external objects.

original: lta ba yang de nyid kyi phyir med de /
analyzed: lta ba yang de nyid kyi phyir med de /
translated: Nor even a viewer, for the same reason.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis sems 'khrugs pas snang ba'i chos nyid la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis sems 'khrugs pas snang ba'i chos nyid la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The mind is disturbed by the power of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mental continua, and it perceives the reality of things that appear.

original: shes rab kyis mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis mi dmigs so //
translated: But it is not perceived by wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni da rod tsam du snang ba'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni da rod tsam du snang ba'i chos nyid de /
translated: The Blessed One is the reality that appears as mere form.

original: 'bod 'grogs kyis sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: 'bod 'grogs kyis sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the liberation of illusion through the invocation of the mantra.

original: ji ltar mthong bzhin du lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed par bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la mthong bar byed pa gang dag gis chos nyid la de ltar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong bzhin du lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed par bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la mthong bar byed pa gang dag gis chos nyid la de ltar mthong ba'o //
translated: As it is seen, so it is viewed and so forth refers to the knowledge of the Omniscient One who is situated in the differentiation of the meditative concentration with appearance and without appearance. It is the seeing of reality in that way by those who are to be guided.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba rtog pa dag pa gang gi tshe na mthong bar gyur ba de'i tshe mchog tu yongs su dag pa bden pa
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba rtog pa dag pa gang gi tshe na mthong bar gyur ba de'i tshe mchog tu yongs su dag pa bden pa
translated: When there is no engagement of conceptual thought, and so forth refers to the purity of conceptual thought, which is free from the conceptual thought of entity and non-entity. When that is seen, then there is the supreme, completely pure, true

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: nature of the realization. That is the seeing of the Tathagata.

original: gang gi tshe na rnam par rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na rnam par rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: When does conceptual thought engage?

original: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i ngo bor phyi'i don la mngon par chags pa de'i tshe gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid du stang ba de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong yang chos kyi skur mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i ngo bor phyi'i don la mngon par chags pa de'i tshe gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid du stang ba de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong yang chos kyi skur mi mthong ba'o //
translated: When one is attached to external objects as the nature of the apprehender and the apprehended, then one sees the Buddha BhagavƒÅn as the nature of the form body, but one does not see the dharmakƒÅya.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa dang / mi 'jug pa las mthong ba dang mi mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa dang / mi 'jug pa las mthong ba dang mi mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn says that seeing and not seeing are due to the engagement and non-engagement of conceptualization.

original: lang ka'i bdag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs pa ma gtogs par phyi'i don ni med par ni 'di dag thams cad snang ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs pa ma gtogs par phyi'i don ni med par ni 'di dag thams cad snang ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The Lord of La·πÖkƒÅ, etc. means that apart from realization, external objects do not exist, because all these appearances are the nature of phenomena.

original: sems 'khrugs pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du mig yor du snang ba ste /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du mig yor du snang ba ste /
translated: Like the appearance of a mirage due to the power of a disturbed mind, fainting, etc.,

original: gang gi tshe shes bar bya ba sbom pa dang / phra ba shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes bar bya ba sbom pa dang / phra ba shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: when the coarse and subtle objects of knowledge are not observed by wisdom, then it is the yoga of non-observation.

original: de ltar 'bod 'grogs kyis mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi 'og tu rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba la gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar 'bod 'grogs kyis mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi 'og tu rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba la gnas te /
translated: Thus, having gone to the end of the yoga of non-observation through calling and accompanying, he abides in the movement of discursive thought.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la thog ma dang tha ma'i stong pa nyid gnyis mi dmigs par mthong zhing dbus su gnyis kyis ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod cing sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i chos nyid du rjes su byed do //üîΩsngon gyi dge ba'i @12a * //üîΩrtsa bas bskul ba ni 'bod 'grogs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa la mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos nyan pa dang byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i bsod nams dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis thabs du ma'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bskul ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la thog ma dang tha ma'i stong pa nyid gnyis mi dmigs par mthong zhing dbus su gnyis kyis ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod cing sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i chos nyid du rjes su byed do // sngon gyi dge ba'i @12a * // rtsa bas bskul ba ni 'bod 'grogs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa la mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos nyan pa dang byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i bsod nams dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis thabs du ma'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bskul ba'o //
translated: He sees the beginning and end of dependently arisen formations as the non-observation of the two emptinesses, and in the middle he practices the emptiness of the essence of the two, and conforms to the reality that is like an illusion.üîΩThe exhortation by former roots of virtue is the merit of making offerings and service to the Omniscient One through calling and accompanying, listening to the Dharma, and the manifest activity of cultivating the mind of enlightenment, and the exhortation by the blessings of the Blessed One through various means.

original: gtsug lag thams cad la mkhas pa'i blo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag thams cad la mkhas pa'i blo zhes pa ni /
translated: The mind skilled in all treatises is the mind that is skilled in the treatises of grammar, logic, arts and crafts, and the inner science of the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gtsug lag thams cad la 'bod 'grogs mkhas par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gtsug lag thams cad la 'bod 'grogs mkhas par smras pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in the worldly and transcendent, in the dual and nondual, and so on, and is an expert in all the scriptures.

original: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de ni rnal 'byor de gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de ni rnal 'byor de gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: He has the wisdom of hearing, reflection, and meditation, and is a conceptualizer of the samƒÅdhi of the two yogas and the nondual.üîΩ‚ÄúNot dependent on others‚Äù means that by fully knowing the selflessness of phenomena and persons, one abandons the views of permanence, self, faculties, and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúNot dependent on others‚Äù means that by fully knowing the selflessness of phenomena and persons, one abandons the views of permanence, self, faculties, and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúNot dependent on others‚Äù means that by fully knowing the selflessness of phenomena and persons, one abandons the views of permanence, self, faculties, and so on.
