original: bdag dang bdag gir rtag par mngon bar chags pas bslad pa rnams la sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba ni mer phye ma leb bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir rtag par mngon bar chags pas bslad pa rnams la sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba ni mer phye ma leb bzhin no //
translated: For those who are deluded by the constant attachment to the self and to what belongs to the self, it is like a burning coal.

original: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis yongs su shes pa las bdag tu chags pa ldog pa las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzlog ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis yongs su shes pa las bdag tu chags pa ldog pa las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzlog ste /
translated: The suffering of cyclic existence is averted by the cessation of attachment to the self through the complete understanding of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: mkhas pa ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The wise one is the one who has complete understanding by himself.

original: rtog ger mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni khong du ma chud pa'i don la ci 'di lta yin nam ma yin zhes rgyu la sbyong pa ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog ger mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni khong du ma chud pa'i don la ci 'di lta yin nam ma yin zhes rgyu la sbyong pa ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not looking to logic means that the investigation of the meaning that is not understood, thinking Is it like this or is it like that? is called logic.

original: srid pa dang thar pa 'byed pa'i rgyu yongs su shes pa gdon mi za ba da la yod pas de la chos la the tshom med do //
analyzed: srid pa dang thar pa 'byed pa'i rgyu yongs su shes pa gdon mi za ba da la yod pas de la chos la the tshom med do //
translated: Since the cause for the distinction between existence and liberation is definitely the complete understanding of the latter, there is no doubt about the Dharma.

original: bdag la sogs par lta ba dang bral bas gong nas gong du sa thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba la mkhas pas ni de la sa'i dbang por grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag la sogs par lta ba dang bral bas gong nas gong du sa thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba la mkhas pas ni de la sa'i dbang por grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since he is free from the views of the self and so forth, he is skilled in realizing the characteristics of all the stages in their entirety. Therefore, he is established as the lord of the stages.

original: sa thams cad yongs su sbyong ba la mkhas pa gong ma'i yang gong mar sa thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba la @12b mkhas pa /
analyzed: sa thams cad yongs su sbyong ba la mkhas pa gong ma'i yang gong mar sa thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba la @12b mkhas pa /
translated: They are skilled in purifying all the levels, and they are skilled in realizing the defining characteristics of all the levels, which are higher and higher.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid khyad par du rtogs par byed pa gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mkhas shing /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid khyad par du rtogs par byed pa gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mkhas shing /
translated: They are skilled in the samƒÅdhis that are both dual and nondual, and they are skilled in realizing the specific characteristics of the levels.

original: sa thams cad kyi gong ma'i yang gong ma'i yon tan byang chub kyi tshogs bsod nams dang / ye shes dang ldan pa la gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen por sangs rgyas thob pa'i phyir 'bod 'grogs la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: sa thams cad kyi gong ma'i yang gong ma'i yon tan byang chub kyi tshogs bsod nams dang / ye shes dang ldan pa la gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen por sangs rgyas thob pa'i phyir 'bod 'grogs la smra bar bya ste /
translated: They are endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the qualities that are higher and higher than all the levels. They are great lords of the yoga of various forms. They are called ‚Äúthose who have attained buddhahood.‚Äù

original: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas par bya ba chud pas na che ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas par bya ba chud pas na che ba'o //
translated: They are great because they are skilled in wisdom and method.

original: sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dben pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dben pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDelighting in the isolation of the mind, mentality, and consciousness‚Äù is mentioned in this s≈´tra.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: The mind is the all-base consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: The mind itself is the mental faculty.

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That which apprehends the objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
translated: is called consciousness.

original: sems ma gtogs par yul dang rnam par shes pa'i snang ba med de /
analyzed: sems ma gtogs par yul dang rnam par shes pa'i snang ba med de /
translated: Apart from the mind, there are no objects or consciousnesses that appear.

original: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams snang yang de na yul med la /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams snang yang de na yul med la /
translated: Just as in a dream, forms and so on, objects and consciousnesses, appear, but there are no objects there,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang med do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang med do //
translated: and there is no eye consciousness and so on.

original: des na sems mnyam par ma 'dus pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i stobs las 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ste /
analyzed: des na sems mnyam par ma 'dus pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i stobs las 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ste /
translated: Therefore, because the mind is not in equipoise, through the power of ignorance and karma, the various kinds of beings appear.üîΩThe division of gross and subtle forms by wisdom

original: sbom po dang phra ba'i gzugs shes rab kyis char rnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: sbom po dang phra ba'i gzugs shes rab kyis char rnam par dbye ba ni /
translated: is the discernment of the aspects of the object.

original: gang gi tshe na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not observe them, one is liberated.

original: rgyud gsum chad par lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis pa med pas na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi skad cig pa gsum du 'du zhing 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: rgyud gsum chad par lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis pa med pas na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi skad cig pa gsum du 'du zhing 'brel ba med do //
translated: The view of the three times as discontinuous is as follows: When there is one moment, there is no second moment, so the three moments of past, future, and present are not connected.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu de yod pas 'di yod do zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar rab tu nges shing las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba rnam par gzhag pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu de yod pas 'di yod do zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar rab tu nges shing las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba rnam par gzhag pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is only in terms of the prior existence of this that that exists that dependent origination is ascertained, and the connection between actions and results is established.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni 'bod 'grogs la chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni 'bod 'grogs la chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod de /
translated: Suchness is the thorough knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons in the scriptures and reasonings.

original: des na mu stegs can gyi lta ba'i nyes pa las rnam par grol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na mu stegs can gyi lta ba'i nyes pa las rnam par grol zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one is liberated from the faults of the views of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: mu stegs can thams cad kyi rgyu dang bral ba'i blor gyur pa zhes te /
analyzed: mu stegs can thams cad kyi rgyu dang bral ba'i blor gyur pa zhes te /
translated: The mind becomes free from the causes of all tƒ´rthikas.

original: gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa mu @13a * //
analyzed: gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa mu @13a * //
translated: The desire realm gods, the great gods, BrahmƒÅ, and so on are not the cause of liberation.

original: stegs can gyis rgyur kun tu rtog pa ni gang dang gang khyad par can gyi dbyibs yod pa de blo can gyi skyes bus byas pa yin te /
analyzed: stegs can gyis rgyur kun tu rtog pa ni gang dang gang khyad par can gyi dbyibs yod pa de blo can gyi skyes bus byas pa yin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine that the cause is a puru·π£a, a conscious being, because a particular shape exists.

original: bum pa dang / phru ba la sogs pa bzhin du lus dang / byed pa dang / gnas la sogs pa khyad bar can gyi dbyibs so //
analyzed: bum pa dang / phru ba la sogs pa bzhin du lus dang / byed pa dang / gnas la sogs pa khyad bar can gyi dbyibs so //
translated: The conscious being creates the body, the action, the place, etc., because a particular shape exists, like a pot, a pan, etc.

original: chu'i stobs la sogs pas bye ma la sogs pa dbyibs su snang ba blo can gyis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chu'i stobs la sogs pas bye ma la sogs pa dbyibs su snang ba blo can gyis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: The conscious being does not create the shape that appears in the sand, etc., because of the power of the water, etc.

original: dus kha cig tu 'dus pa'i mthus padma la sogs pa'i myu gu 'byung ba der blo can byed pa po'i las mi snang ngo //
analyzed: dus kha cig tu 'dus pa'i mthus padma la sogs pa'i myu gu 'byung ba der blo can byed pa po'i las mi snang ngo //
translated: The conscious being is not seen as the agent of the action in the production of the sprout of the lotus, etc., because of the power of the collection at a certain time.

original: ji ltar dharma k'irti sa smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dharma k'irti sa smras pa /
translated: As Dharmakƒ´rti says:

original: mthun dang mi mthun dag gis ni //
analyzed: mthun dang mi mthun dag gis ni //
translated: By the power of the concordant and the discordant,

original: gang dag gang las nyer skye ba //
analyzed: gang dag gang las nyer skye ba //
translated: what is produced from what?

original: gal te de las rgyu gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te de las rgyu gzhan na //
translated: If there is another cause than that,

original: de ltar 'gyur bas mtha' med do //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bas mtha' med do //
translated: it would be like that, and there would be an infinite regress.

original: des na gnyis dang mi gnyis par smra bas kun tu brtags pa'i rgyu ma stegs can gyi 'khrul pa'i mtshan 'bod 'grogs la med de /
analyzed: des na gnyis dang mi gnyis par smra bas kun tu brtags pa'i rgyu ma stegs can gyi 'khrul pa'i mtshan 'bod 'grogs la med de /
translated: Therefore, the one who speaks of neither duality nor nonduality does not associate with the false designations of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa shes pas sdug bsngal bzlog so zhes shes so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa shes pas sdug bsngal bzlog so zhes shes so //
translated: It is known that the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra is averted by the knowledge of selflessness, which is the opposite of attachment to permanence and self.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sangs rgyas kyis la nang du snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sangs rgyas kyis la nang du snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The TathƒÅgatagarbha is the Buddha‚Äôs inner samƒÅdhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni sems can thams cad do //
translated: The tathƒÅgatagarbha is all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du nang gi mi gnyis gnyis par rtogs pa'i chos ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi mi gnyis gnyis par rtogs pa'i chos ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: In the same way, the Dharma of realizing the nonduality within is the Buddha‚Äôs ground.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid dang mnyam pas na me spyir gnas pa bzhin du snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid dang mnyam pas na me spyir gnas pa bzhin du snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Because it is equal to the nondual reality, it is like a fire burning evenly.

original: sgra thos pa ni 'bod 'grogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: sgra thos pa ni 'bod 'grogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sgra'o //
translated: Hearing the sound is the sound of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: gang gi blo las blo gnas bden tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi blo las blo gnas bden tshig sbyar ro //
translated: The one whose mind is in the mind is the one who applies the words of truth.

original: gang la rnal 'byor de lta bu yod pa des thos so zhes tshig 'byed par bsgyur ro //
analyzed: gang la rnal 'byor de lta bu yod pa des thos so zhes tshig 'byed par bsgyur ro //
translated: The one who has such a yoga, he hears.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Excellent, excellent! is the TathƒÅgatas' you should see the TathƒÅgatas like this, etc.

original: rtogs par mnyam pa nyid dang / dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par mnyam pa nyid dang / dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong ba yin no //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas are seen as having the equality of realization, as having abandoned the discrimination of thing and non-thing, and as having the nature of ultimate reality.

original: rnam pa gzhan du bltas na chad pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te yang sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ma yin @13b par gyur na de'i tshe dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du bltas na chad pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te yang sems ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ma yin @13b par gyur na de'i tshe dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees them in another way, one will fall into nihilism.  If the mind were not the cause of defilement and purification, then the performance of virtue and vice would be nihilistic.

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba rnams kyi gnas ni sems te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba rnams kyi gnas ni sems te /
translated: The mind is the basis of the connection between action and result.

original: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As the Compendium of Reality (de-kho-na-nyid bsdus-pa) says:

original: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The mind is naturally clear light.

original: gang ji ltar yongs su sbyong ba de de ltar yang dag par grub pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang ji ltar yongs su sbyong ba de de ltar yang dag par grub pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is just as it is purified.

original: dge ba dang mi dge bar sems kyis mngon par 'du byed pa ji srid du yod pa de srid du gnyis kyi rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge bar sems kyis mngon par 'du byed pa ji srid du yod pa de srid du gnyis kyi rnam pa nyid do //
translated: As long as there is the formation of the mind into virtue and non-virtue, there is the appearance of duality.

original: shes rab kyis sbom pa dang phra ba'i cha mi dmigs pa na don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i byang chub rtogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis sbom pa dang phra ba'i cha mi dmigs pa na don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i byang chub rtogs zhes bya'o //
translated: When the coarse and subtle aspects are not perceived by wisdom, then the ultimate truth, non-dual awakening, is realized.

original: de bzhin du yang sa'i dbang po rnams kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po nang du spyod pas chos thams cad rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang sa'i dbang po rnams kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po nang du spyod pas chos thams cad rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the lords of the earth (i.e., the kings) should cause the lords of yoga to meditate on all phenomena by means of inner practice,

original: phyi rol gyi don du lta ba la mngon bar chags pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du lta ba la mngon bar chags pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by means of attachment to the view of external objects.

original: khyod kyi nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / tshig gi don gyi spyod yul du ltung ba'i lta ba dang ting nge 'dzin du ma yin /
analyzed: khyod kyi nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / tshig gi don gyi spyod yul du ltung ba'i lta ba dang ting nge 'dzin du ma yin /
translated: It is not the realization of your ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tƒ´rthikas, nor is it the view and samƒÅdhi that fall into the domain of the meaning of words.

original: gtam dang sgrung la dga' bar ma yin pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: gtam dang sgrung la dga' bar ma yin pa zhes pa la /
translated: It is not delighting in stories and tales.

original: mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang dbang po dang / mchog sbyin pa dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / kha 'tsho ba dang / cha lugs sna tshogs dang / gar dang / glu dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang dbang po dang / mchog sbyin pa dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / kha 'tsho ba dang / cha lugs sna tshogs dang / gar dang / glu dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: Tƒ´rthikas imagine liberation through permanence, self, sense faculties, supreme offerings, bathing, fire offerings, livelihood, various costumes, dance, song, auspiciousness, inauspiciousness,

original: rin po che dang / me tog la sogs pa 'dzin cing btul zhugs la sogs pas thar pa kun tu rtog go //
analyzed: rin po che dang / me tog la sogs pa 'dzin cing btul zhugs la sogs pas thar pa kun tu rtog go //
translated: holding jewels, flowers, and so on, and through asceticism, and so on.

original: rtag tu bdag tu chags pas 'khrugs pas 'khor bar ltung ba ni phyi ma leb bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag tu bdag tu chags pas 'khrugs pas 'khor bar ltung ba ni phyi ma leb bzhin no //
translated: Since they are always disturbed by attachment to self, they fall into sa·πÉsƒÅra, as in the following verse.

original: sems can rnams kyi bdag tu chags pa log pa na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bdag tu chags pa log pa na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the attachment to self of sentient beings is reversed, they are completely liberated from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de bas na mu stegs can gyis bdag med pa mi shes pas rnam par rtog pa du mas 'khor zhing thar pa'i rgyu mi rig go //
analyzed: de bas na mu stegs can gyis bdag med pa mi shes pas rnam par rtog pa du mas 'khor zhing thar pa'i rgyu mi rig go //
translated: Therefore, since the tƒ´rthikas do not understand selflessness, they cycle in many conceptual thoughts and do not know the cause of liberation.

original: 'bod 'grogs la ni nyan thos las tha dad pa theg pa chen po'i chos bshad pa de lta bur bshad do //
analyzed: 'bod 'grogs la ni nyan thos las tha dad pa theg pa chen po'i chos bshad pa de lta bur bshad do //
translated: In the Friendly Letter, the MahƒÅyƒÅna Dharma is explained as being different from the Dharma of the hearers.

original: nyan thos rnams ni phyi'i don la mngon bar chags pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni phyi'i don la mngon bar chags pa ste /
translated: The hearers are attached to external objects.

original: theg pa chen po la chos dang gang zag la bdag med cing bla na med pa'i ye shes thams cad @14a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la chos dang gang zag la bdag med cing bla na med pa'i ye shes thams cad @14a * //
translated: In the MahƒÅyƒÅna, the selflessness of phenomena and persons and the unsurpassed wisdom that knows everything

original: mkhyen pa ni sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: will benefit all sentient beings.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with the yoga of the great yoga‚Äù refers to the samƒÅdhi of the omniscient ones that is both and not both.

original: pha rol rgol ba rab tu 'joms ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi 'khrul pa lta ba thams cad sel zhing mun pa 'joms pa rnams te /
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba rab tu 'joms ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi 'khrul pa lta ba thams cad sel zhing mun pa 'joms pa rnams te /
translated: The phrase completely overcoming opposing forces refers to the fact that this perfection eliminates all the false views of the tƒ´rthikas and destroys their darkness.

original: bdag med par smra ba po rnams kyi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po la sogs par lta ba dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang / cha lugs rnam pa sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: bdag med par smra ba po rnams kyi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po la sogs par lta ba dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang / cha lugs rnam pa sna tshogs dang /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas argue that the proponents of selflessness are attached to the views of permanence, self, and the like, and to the performance of rites, fire sacrifices, auspicious rites, inauspicious rites, and various kinds of dress.

original: rin po che dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa 'chang bas thar pa'o zhes rgol ba rnams kyi smra ba 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa 'chang bas thar pa'o zhes rgol ba rnams kyi smra ba 'joms pa'o //
translated: They hold jewels, roots, and so on, and claim that these are the means of attaining liberation.

original: lta ba ngan pa sel ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag tu lta ba 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa sel ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag tu lta ba 'jig par byed do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom eliminates their false views, for it destroys the views of permanence and self.

original: bdag tu lta ba rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas pa la ni blo zhib cing rnam par shes pa shin tu 'gyur ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas pa la ni blo zhib cing rnam par shes pa shin tu 'gyur ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The phrase skill in the reversal of the view of self refers to the fact that the bodhisattva is skilled in the subtle and discriminating knowledge that is necessary to reverse the view of self.

original: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas sems kyi rgyud nyid la bdag go zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas sems kyi rgyud nyid la bdag go zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: By means of wisdom and skill in means, one speaks of a self in the continuum of mind itself.

original: shes rab phra mos dpyod cing shes par bya ba sbom pa dang phra ba rnam par gzhigs nas gang gi tshe mtshan ma la cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na sems bzlog pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab phra mos dpyod cing shes par bya ba sbom pa dang phra ba rnam par gzhigs nas gang gi tshe mtshan ma la cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na sems bzlog pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When, by means of subtle wisdom, one analyzes and understands the coarse and subtle distinctions, and does not observe any characteristics at all, at that time one becomes skilled in reversing the mind.

original: theg pa chen po la spyod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang snying rje la sbyor bas theg pa chen po don bzhin pa spyod pa dang / de dag dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don spyod do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la spyod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang snying rje la sbyor bas theg pa chen po don bzhin pa spyod pa dang / de dag dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don spyod do //
translated: Those who practice the Great Vehicle means that by applying wisdom and compassion, one practices the Great Vehicle as it should be practiced, and by distinguishing between concentration with and without reference points, one practices for the benefit of oneself and others.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pa ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pa ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Distinguishing between concentration with appearances and without appearances is called realization.

original: des na lang ka'i bdag po 'di ni rtogs pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na lang ka'i bdag po 'di ni rtogs pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, O Lord of Lanka, this is called realization.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log thams cad ci rnam par tog pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log thams cad ci rnam par tog pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it completely eliminates all errors with regard to things as permanent, a self, pleasure, and pure.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa mnyam pas mngon par mnyam par rtog pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa mnyam pas mngon par mnyam par rtog pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom: ‚ÄúBy the equality of things and non-things, one should realize the equality of all things.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag gi so sor rang gis la 'jug pa @14b khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis brtson par gyis shig ces bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyong ba dang / sa la 'jug pa dang / sa 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag gi so sor rang gis la 'jug pa @14b khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis brtson par gyis shig ces bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyong ba dang / sa la 'jug pa dang / sa 'thob pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúYou should strive to understand the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs own entry into the realization of individual knowledge‚Äù means the purification of the stage, the entry into the stage, and the attainment of the stage.

original: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la mngon par bsgrubs pas gong ma'i yang gong ma chud par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho na bsgrub pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la mngon par bsgrubs pas gong ma'i yang gong ma chud par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho na bsgrub pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is for the sake of attaining omniscience, for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings, and for the sake of accomplishing only the lord of yogins.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo'i spyod yul ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo'i spyod yul ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the domain of conduct that is followed by ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tƒ´rthikas.

original: ji ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa dang snang ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa dang / 'byung ba dang / yon tan dang / rdzas la yang dag par rjes su spyod pa byis pa mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyis rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa dang snang ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa dang / 'byung ba dang / yon tan dang / rdzas la yang dag par rjes su spyod pa byis pa mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyis rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi rtogs pa dang /
translated: The conduct of the yogins who are childish tƒ´rthikas is to engage in the characteristics of grasping the self, attachment to appearances, the elements, qualities, and substances.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen du lta ba la mngon par chags pa la mngon par zhen pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba'i rnam par phyi'i don la zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen du lta ba la mngon par chags pa la mngon par zhen pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba'i rnam par phyi'i don la zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are attached to the view of the reality of the external object, are attached to the view of the reality of the cause of ignorance. They are attached to the view of impermanence, suffering, non-self, and impurity.

original: de la mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang pos byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de la mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang pos byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas imagine that the self is permanent, a doer, and an experiencer.

original: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid du kun du rtog par byed do //
analyzed: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid du kun du rtog par byed do //
translated: They imagine that it is related to substance, quality, action, universals, and particulars.

original: phyi'i sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams la yon tan dang / las rnams gnas so zhes rdzas ni dgu ste /
analyzed: phyi'i sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams la yon tan dang / las rnams gnas so zhes rdzas ni dgu ste /
translated: The nine substances are the elements, earth, etc., and the qualities and actions reside in them.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid ces so //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid ces so //
translated: Earth, water, fire, air, space, time, direction, self, and mind.

original: de dag kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: They are permanent and impermanent.

original: rdul phra mo'i rdzas rnams ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra mo'i rdzas rnams ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The subtle particles are permanent.

original: de dag gis brtsams pa yan lag can gyi rdzas sbom po ni mi rtag pa'o //üîΩyon tan rnams ni gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / tha dad pa dang / sbyor ba dang / bral ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / blo rnams dang /
analyzed: de dag gis brtsams pa yan lag can gyi rdzas sbom po ni mi rtag pa'o // yon tan rnams ni gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / tshad dang / grangs dang / tha dad pa dang / sbyor ba dang / bral ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / blo rnams dang /
translated: The gross substances, which are composed of them, are impermanent.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / nan tan yang ngo //üîΩyang zhes bya ba'i sgras gsher ba dang / lci ba dang / snum @15a * //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / nan tan yang ngo // yang zhes bya ba'i sgras gsher ba dang / lci ba dang / snum @15a * //
translated: The qualities are: color, taste, smell, touch, number, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, priority, posteriority, intellect, pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, and effort.

original: pa dang / 'du byed dang / ma mthong ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgra rnams te /
analyzed: pa dang / 'du byed dang / ma mthong ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgra rnams te /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates fluidity, weight, faculty of separating, faculty of synthesis, non-perception, perception, and sound.

original: yon tan rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the twenty-four qualities.

original: las la yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: las la yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of action:

original: len pa dang / 'dor ba dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / 'gro ba ni las so //
analyzed: len pa dang / 'dor ba dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / 'gro ba ni las so //
translated: grasping, releasing, extending, contracting, and moving.

original: spyi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of universals:

original: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'o //
translated: The best and the not best.

original: mchog ni tshig gi don gsum yod par byed pas na yod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni tshig gi don gsum yod par byed pas na yod do zhes pa'o //
translated: The best is the existence of the three meanings of the word, so it is said to exist.

original: spyi mchog ma yin pa yang ba lang nyid dang / rta nyid dang / bum pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi mchog ma yin pa yang ba lang nyid dang / rta nyid dang / bum pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The not best generality is cow-ness, horse-ness, pot-ness, and so on.

original: khyad par rnams ni khyad par gyis blo bskyed pa rnams te /
analyzed: khyad par rnams ni khyad par gyis blo bskyed pa rnams te /
translated: The particulars are those that generate the understanding of particularities.

original: nye bar btags pa dang / nye bar ma btags pa rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa dang / nye bar ma btags pa rnams so //
translated: They are the designated and the non-designated.

original: nye bar btags pa ni rigs dang / yon tan dang / byed pas byas pa ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa ni rigs dang / yon tan dang / byed pas byas pa ni btags pa'o //
translated: The designated is that which is made by the particularities of type, quality, and action.

original: nye bar ma btags pa ni pha ma'i khyad par te /
analyzed: nye bar ma btags pa ni pha ma'i khyad par te /
translated: The non-designated is the particularity of father and mother.

original: ji ltar sa'i rdul rnams dang / sa ma yin pa'i rdul rnams las brtsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar sa'i rdul rnams dang / sa ma yin pa'i rdul rnams las brtsams te /
translated: For example, beginning with the particles of earth and the particles of non-earth,

original: rigs dang yon tan du sbyor yang khyad par gyi khyad par du 'byed ces so //
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan du sbyor yang khyad par gyi khyad par du 'byed ces so //
translated: even if one connects them with type and quality, it is said that the particularity is distinguished.

original: 'brel pa ni 'dir blo 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni 'dir blo 'brel ba ste /
translated: The relation here is the relation of the understanding.

original: rdzas la rdzas dang / yon tan la yon tan dang / las la las zhes so //
analyzed: rdzas la rdzas dang / yon tan la yon tan dang / las la las zhes so //
translated: It is substance with substance, quality with quality, and action with action.

original: khyad par can gyi rgyud kyi dra ba yongs su shes pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rgyud kyi dra ba yongs su shes pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes kha cig go //
translated: One is liberated by knowing the net of the special Tantra.

original: grangs can rnams kyi bya ba ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga yongs su shes pas grol la zhes te /
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyi bya ba ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga yongs su shes pas grol la zhes te /
translated: The Sankhyas say that one is liberated by knowing the twenty-five principles.

original: skyes bu yon tan las lhag ma rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhir byed pa yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu yon tan las lhag ma rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhir byed pa yongs su shes pas so //
translated: One is liberated by knowing the twenty-four aspects of the soul which are superior to the qualities.

original: yod pa dang / rdul dang / mun pa dang / yon tan rnams mnyam par gnas pa ni gtso bo zhes so //
analyzed: yod pa dang / rdul dang / mun pa dang / yon tan rnams mnyam par gnas pa ni gtso bo zhes so //
translated: Existence, atom, darkness, and the qualities are in equilibrium in the principal.

original: de las chen po zhes te /
analyzed: de las chen po zhes te /
translated: From that, the great one.

original: de ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
translated: That is a synonym for intelligence.

original: chen po las ngar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chen po las ngar byed pa'o //
translated: From the great one, the I-principle.

original: ngar skyed pa las de tsam lnga ste /
analyzed: ngar skyed pa las de tsam lnga ste /
translated: From the I-principle, the five subtle elements.

original: sgra la sogs pa yul lnga'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa yul lnga'o //
translated: The five objects such as sound.

original: de tsam lnga rnams las 'byung ba lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga ste /
analyzed: de tsam lnga rnams las 'byung ba lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga ste /
translated: From the five subtle elements, the five gross elements and the five sense faculties.

original: rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna rnams so //
analyzed: rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna rnams so //
translated: The ear, skin, eye, tongue, and nose.

original: lus kyi dbang po lnga ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po lnga ste /
translated: The five action faculties.

original: tshigs dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / gsang khung dang / mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: tshigs dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / gsang khung dang / mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: the joints, the hands, the feet, the anus, and the characteristics of the male and female organs.

original: yid ni kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The mind is conceptualization.

original: sems can ni skyes bu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can ni skyes bu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Sentient beings are the nature of a person.

original: kho na shes pa nyi shu lnga //
analyzed: kho na shes pa nyi shu lnga //
translated: The twenty-five principles are the object of knowledge.

original: gnas ni gang la gar dga' rung //
analyzed: gnas ni gang la gar dga' rung //
translated: The place is wherever one likes.

original: mgo bregs @15b ral pa phud bu can //
analyzed: mgo bregs @15b ral pa phud bu can //
translated: Having shaved the head and beard,

original: grol bar 'gyur la der dogs med //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur la der dogs med //
translated: one is liberated, and there is no doubt about that.

original: ces grangs can rnams kyis thar par rtog go //
analyzed: ces grangs can rnams kyis thar par rtog go //
translated: Thus, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine liberation.

original: de ste nyon mongs pa yongs su zad pa ma gtogs pa rang bzhin dang / skyes bu'i khyad par khong du chud pa las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ste nyon mongs pa yongs su zad pa ma gtogs pa rang bzhin dang / skyes bu'i khyad par khong du chud pa las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: If liberation were to occur from understanding the nature and the particularities of a person, apart from the complete exhaustion of the afflictions,

original: de lta na ni bya dang / rtsig pa dang / snam bu dang / bum pa'i sogs pa'i khyad par khong du chud pas thar bar cis na mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni bya dang / rtsig pa dang / snam bu dang / bum pa'i sogs pa'i khyad par khong du chud pas thar bar cis na mi 'gyur /
translated: then why would liberation not occur from understanding the particularities of birds, walls, cloth, pots, and so on?

original: srid pa yongs su ma zad kyi bar du khyad par can rnams kyi rdzas dang / yon tan la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su shes la thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa yongs su ma zad kyi bar du khyad par can rnams kyi rdzas dang / yon tan la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su shes la thar par 'gyur te /
translated: Until the end of existence, they know the particulars of the substances, qualities, etc. of the special ones, and they attain liberation.

original: de lta bur zin na ni bye phung gi bye ma'i 'brum bu rnams kyi grangs khong du chud pas cis na yang thar par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bur zin na ni bye phung gi bye ma'i 'brum bu rnams kyi grangs khong du chud pas cis na yang thar par mi 'gyur /
translated: If they were to know in that way, then why would they not attain liberation by knowing the number of grains of sand in the Ganges?

original: de de bzhin du mu stegs can ksha pa na ka rnams kyi lta ba ni yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de bzhin du mu stegs can ksha pa na ka rnams kyi lta ba ni yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the view of the tƒ´rthikas, the Ka≈õmƒ´rans, would be that it would exist, it would not exist, it would both exist and not exist.

original: yod par 'gyur ba ni spyi'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ba ni spyi'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: It would exist in the nature of the general.

original: med par 'gyur ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid du'o //
translated: It would not exist in the nature of the particular.

original: yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du ste /
analyzed: yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du ste /
translated: It would both exist and not exist in the nature of the general and the particular.

original: de dag na smra bar bya ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de dag na smra bar bya ba'i phyogs so //
translated: That is their position to be refuted.

original: smra bar mi bya ba'i phyogs la spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yang smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: smra bar mi bya ba'i phyogs la spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yang smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak of the universal as existing when the particular is not spoken of as existing.

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yong bar 'gyur ba spyi'i bdag nyid du yang smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yong bar 'gyur ba spyi'i bdag nyid du yang smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak of the particular as existing when the universal is not spoken of as existing.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak of the universal and the particular as existing simultaneously.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba cig car yang smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba cig car yang smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak of the universal and the particular as existing and not existing simultaneously.

original: de de ltar 'bod 'grogs la mu stegs can gyi gti mug gi dra ba bzlog pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas chos bshad do //
analyzed: de de ltar 'bod 'grogs la mu stegs can gyi gti mug gi dra ba bzlog pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas chos bshad do //
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One taught the Dharma to ƒÄrƒÅ·∏ça KƒÅlƒÅma in order to remove the net of delusion of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po dang / gcig po dang / gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dgag pa'i phyir yang 'bod 'grogs la chos bshad do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po dang / gcig po dang / gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dgag pa'i phyir yang 'bod 'grogs la chos bshad do //
translated: He also taught the Dharma to ƒÄrƒÅ·∏ça KƒÅlƒÅma in order to refute the cause of permanence, self, sense faculties, unity, duality, non-duality, and so on.

original: cha lugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi brtul zhugs dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rnam par rtog pas kun tu mi rtog pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par mi rtog pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par byed pa @16a * //
analyzed: cha lugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi brtul zhugs dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rnam par rtog pas kun tu mi rtog pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par mi rtog pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par byed pa @16a * //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to introduce them to the ultimate truth,

original: dang / mi gnyis pa khong du chud par byed pa'i chos ston to //üîΩgzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho nar bsgrub pa dang / gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa por lta ba rnam par gcad pa'i don du yang dag pa'i don chos dang /
analyzed: dang / mi gnyis pa khong du chud par byed pa'i chos ston to // gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho nar bsgrub pa dang / gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa por lta ba rnam par gcad pa'i don du yang dag pa'i don chos dang /
translated: and in order to make them understand nonduality.

original: gang zag la bdag med bzhi ba'i chos la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med bzhi ba'i chos la 'jug par byed de /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to introduce them to the four noble truths,üîΩand in order to make them understand the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: lang ka'i bdag po bdag gis so so rang gi rig pa rtogs par byed pa'i theg pa chen po khong du chud pa 'di ni gzugs sna tshogs rab tu thob par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs su gyur pa dang /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po bdag gis so so rang gi rig pa rtogs par byed pa'i theg pa chen po khong du chud pa 'di ni gzugs sna tshogs rab tu thob par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs su gyur pa dang /
translated: The passage that begins O Lord of Lanka, this understanding of the Mahayana that is to be realized by oneself is the attainment of various forms refers to the attainment of various kinds of forms.

original: gal te gzugs gcig rnam par bzlog kyang de bzhin du gzugs gzhan gyis gnas te 'jig par mi 'gyur ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas so //
analyzed: gal te gzugs gcig rnam par bzlog kyang de bzhin du gzugs gzhan gyis gnas te 'jig par mi 'gyur ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas so //
translated: If one form is eliminated, another form will remain, and it will not be destroyed. This is because one attains the samƒÅdhi of both light and non-light, and the non-dual samƒÅdhi.

original: theg pa chen po khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / mu stegs can ma gtogs par rnam pa de lta bu'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams
analyzed: theg pa chen po khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / mu stegs can ma gtogs par rnam pa de lta bu'i theg pa chen po nyid kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams
translated: The phrase those who have mastered the Mahayana refers to those who have attained the distinctive states of meditative absorption of the bodhisattvas, who are masters of yoga, and who have accomplished the perfection of both their own and others' goals by means of the Mahayana itself, which is of that same kind, excluding the Listeners and the extremists.

original: yin no // theg pa chen po nyid kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud par byed pas na theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor khong du chud pas khyad par du khong du chud par bya ba dang / mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sems can thams cad la phan thogs pa'i sa thob bo //
analyzed: yin no // theg pa chen po nyid kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud par byed pas na theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor khong du chud pas khyad par du khong du chud par bya ba dang / mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sems can thams cad la phan thogs pa'i sa thob bo //
translated: The phrase those who have mastered the Mahayana refers to those who have attained the state of being a master of yoga in the Mahayana, because they have mastered the realization of the no-self of both persons and phenomena by means of the Mahayana itself. They have attained the state of being a master of yoga in the Mahayana, because they have mastered the realization of the distinctive realizations, and because they have attained the state of being completely pure and free from attachment, omniscience, and the state of being a master of yoga, which is the state of benefiting all sentient beings.

original: khebs pa'i g-yogs ma rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rlabs zlog par byed pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pas 'khrugs pa'i mthus rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba ni mgo 'khor ba
analyzed: khebs pa'i g-yogs ma rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rlabs zlog par byed pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pas 'khrugs pa'i mthus rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba ni mgo 'khor ba
translated: The covering of the veil of ignorance is turned back by the waves of various consciousnesses.

original: dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The appearance of various consciousnesses through the power of agitation by the ignorance of non-equipoise is like dizziness, fainting, and so on.

original: dpyod pa'i shes rab mnyam par 'dud pa dang ldan pas shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra ba gzhigs par byed pa na de mi dmigs te stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i shes rab mnyam par 'dud pa dang ldan pas shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra ba gzhigs par byed pa na de mi dmigs te stong par mthong ngo //
translated: When the wisdom of analysis, endowed with equipoise, discerns the coarse and subtle objects of knowledge, it does not observe them, seeing them as empty.

original: de de ltar ma rig pas khebs pa'i g-yogs ma shes pas rtog pa na @16b yang bzlog ste /
analyzed: de de ltar ma rig pas khebs pa'i g-yogs ma shes pas rtog pa na @16b yang bzlog ste /
translated: When ignorance, the covering of the veil, is thus turned back by the understanding,

original: 'di mi gnyis pa don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par byed pa ni theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di mi gnyis pa don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par byed pa ni theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor ces bya ba ste /
translated: the realization of non-duality, the ultimate truth, is called the yoga of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas su lhung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas su lhung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is not a falling into the abode of the yoga of the tƒ´rthikas, and so on.

original: mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas ni 'khor bar ltung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas ni 'khor bar ltung bar byed pa ste /
translated: The yogin of the tƒ´rthikas is one who causes one to fall into sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: phyin ci log pa rnams kyi bdag tu chags pa mi ldog go //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa rnams kyi bdag tu chags pa mi ldog go //
translated: For those who are mistaken, attachment to a self is not reversed.

original: ji srid du bdag med pa yongs su shes par ma gyur pa de srid du thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du bdag med pa yongs su shes par ma gyur pa de srid du thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as one does not fully understand selflessness, one will not be liberated.

original: rlung dgag pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs dang / srid pa'i longs spyod ma thob po //
analyzed: rlung dgag pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs dang / srid pa'i longs spyod ma thob po //
translated: By the yoga of blocking the winds and so on, one does not attain the various forms and enjoyments of existence.

original: thal bas byug pa dang / dri ma 'chang ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang / ral ba bsdus pa'i zhags pa dang / cha byad sna tshogs dang / kha 'tsho ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang /
analyzed: thal bas byug pa dang / dri ma 'chang ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang / ral ba bsdus pa'i zhags pa dang / cha byad sna tshogs dang / kha 'tsho ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / 'khru ba dang / sbyin sreg dang /
translated: [The tƒ´rthikas] smear themselves with ashes, carry dirt, pull out their hair, bind their hair in a topknot, wear various costumes, beg for food, dance, sing, bathe, and perform fire offerings.

original: gad ba dang / g-yang sa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / nyi ma dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa rnam par rtog cing rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mgu bar byed pa dang / mchog slong ba la sogs par thar par mi 'gyur te /üîΩji srid du shes rab kyis mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid ma spyad pa de srid du rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pa mi bzlog go //üîΩmu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor du phyin ci log pa rnams ni 'khor ba nyid du ltung bar 'gyur te /üîΩshes rab kyi grol bas de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: gad ba dang / g-yang sa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / nyi ma dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa rnam par rtog cing rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mgu bar byed pa dang / mchog slong ba la sogs par thar par mi 'gyur te / ji srid du shes rab kyis mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid ma spyad pa de srid du rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pa mi bzlog go // mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor du phyin ci log pa rnams ni 'khor ba nyid du ltung bar 'gyur te / shes rab kyi grol bas de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: and the yogi/nƒ´ is not liberated from the conceptualizations of the good and bad qualities of the place of practice, such as the ground, the cave, the trees, the birds, the sun, the moon, the stars, the planets, the directions, the mountains, the ravines, the cliffs, the cold, the heat, the sun, the auspicious and the inauspicious, and so on, and from delighting the lord of yoga and from the request for the supreme and so on.üîΩAs long as one does not practice the reality of impermanence, suffering, impurity, and emptiness with wisdom, one does not overcome attachment to permanence and self.üîΩThe non-Buddhist yogis/nƒ´ who are mistaken about the path fall into sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩBecause of that, the Omniscient One taught the cause of liberation with wisdom.üîΩ

original: bdag tu chags pa yod na ji ltar du thar bar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa yod na ji ltar du thar bar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: If there is attachment to self, how can there be liberation?

original: gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par smra ba mu stegs can thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par chags pa la gnas pas bdag sdug bsngal las grol bar byed pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i bsam gtan du bdag bde bar gzhag par bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par smra ba mu stegs can thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par chags pa la gnas pas bdag sdug bsngal las grol bar byed pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i bsam gtan du bdag bde bar gzhag par bya'o zhes te /
translated: The second is the non-dualistic doctrine of the tƒ´rthikas, who are attached to the self. They think, ‚ÄúI will liberate the self from suffering and place the self in the bliss of the highest meditative concentration.‚Äù

original: bdag tu zhen pa de nyid mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu zhen pa de nyid mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: That very attachment to the self is not reversed.

original: bdag med par smra ba rnams kyis skad cig mar 'jig par yongs su @17a * //
analyzed: bdag med par smra ba rnams kyis skad cig mar 'jig par yongs su @17a * //
translated: Those who advocate selflessness completely understand that things are momentary and perishable.

original: shes pas bdag dang bdag gi sred pas gang yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: shes pas bdag dang bdag gi sred pas gang yang mi 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, they do not engage in any craving for self or for what belongs to the self.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gnyis kyi don la chags par lta bas mu stegs can rnams kyi las rnal 'byor 'di gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor 'di gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can rnams rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la de ltar
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gnyis kyi don la chags par lta bas mu stegs can rnams kyi las rnal 'byor 'di gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor 'di gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can rnams rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la de ltar
translated: The action of the tƒ´rthikas, who view the object of the two natures of consciousness as attachment, is different from this yoga.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa med par yang rab rib dang / rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin pa la 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i ngo bor gnyis kyi don du yongs su rtogs par byed pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing skad cig pa'i rgyud mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa med par yang rab rib dang / rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin pa la 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i ngo bor gnyis kyi don du yongs su rtogs par byed pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing skad cig pa'i rgyud mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Without the aspect of duality, like a consciousness in a dream or with eye disease, it is thoroughly cognized as the object of the duality of apprehender and apprehended.üîΩThe realization of the continuum of the momentary, naturally luminous, and nondual mind is free from the entity of the apprehended.

original: gzung ba'i dngos po dang bral ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa yang dag par rig pa tsam ni dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa med par zhugs pas myong ba bzhin du mu stegs can rnams kyis khong du chud par mi
analyzed: gzung ba'i dngos po dang bral ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa yang dag par rig pa tsam ni dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa med par zhugs pas myong ba bzhin du mu stegs can rnams kyis khong du chud par mi
translated: The nonconceptual consciousness of the sense faculties experiences the mere cognition that is free from the entity of the apprehended and is free from the concepts of entity and nonentity.üîΩHowever, the tƒ´rthikas do not understand that.

original: byed do // chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang gis rig pa yod pa dang / med par smrar med pa nyid du bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams /
analyzed: byed do // chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang gis rig pa yod pa dang / med par smrar med pa nyid du bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams /
translated: The followers of the Sugata understand that the ultimate truth, which is the realization of the selflessness of phenomena and of persons, is nondual, is one‚Äôs own awareness, and is inexpressible as existent or nonexistent.

original: don dam pa'i dngos por khong du chud par byed do //üîΩtshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa tshig gi don bcu drug rnams gtan la phab pa yongs su shes pas gdon mi za bar gnas khong du chud bar 'gyur ro zhes gang dag de skad smra ba de dag la yang tshad ma dang /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por khong du chud par byed do // tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa tshig gi don bcu drug rnams gtan la phab pa yongs su shes pas gdon mi za bar gnas khong du chud bar 'gyur ro zhes gang dag de skad smra ba de dag la yang tshad ma dang /
translated: and the ultimate reality.

original: gzhal bya ma gtogs par tshig gi don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya ma gtogs par tshig gi don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who say that one must necessarily understand the topics by understanding the sixteen topics such as the means of valid cognition and the objects of valid cognition, are also wrong, because apart from the means of valid cognition and the objects of valid cognition, there are no other topics.üîΩThe topics are: doubt, purpose, tenet, example, part, dialectic, ascertainment, disputation, quibble, sophistry, appearance of reason,

original: dogs pa dang / dgos pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / dpe dang / yan lag dang / rtog ge dang / nges pa dang / rtsod pa dang / zug zug tu smra ba dang / tho btsams pa dang / rgyur snang ba dang /
analyzed: dogs pa dang / dgos pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / dpe dang / yan lag dang / rtog ge dang / nges pa dang / rtsod pa dang / zug zug tu smra ba dang / tho btsams pa dang / rgyur snang ba dang /
translated: fault, similarity, and refutation.

original: klan ka dang / rigs 'dra ba dang / tshar gcad pa'i gnas rnams kyang shes pa dang / shes par bya ba ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: klan ka dang / rigs 'dra ba dang / tshar gcad pa'i gnas rnams kyang shes pa dang / shes par bya ba ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Apart from the known and the knower, there is no other topic.

original: shes pa ma gtogs par shes par bya ba mi srid ces bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa ma gtogs par shes par bya ba mi srid ces bya ste /
translated: Apart from the knower, the known is impossible.

original: rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du 'khrul ba'i mthus nyi shu lnga la sogs pa smra ba thams cad kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa snang ba ni bdag dang @17b bdag gir mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du 'khrul ba'i mthus nyi shu lnga la sogs pa smra ba thams cad kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa snang ba ni bdag dang @17b bdag gir mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Like a mirage, a reflection, a dream, an optical illusion, and so on, the twenty-five [principles] and so on appear in the aspect of duality by the power of error.  There is attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas ri bong gi rva bzhin du dngos por med do //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas ri bong gi rva bzhin du dngos por med do //
translated: Since the self is not produced, it does not exist as a real entity, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la phyi'i dngos po med du zin kyang 'on kyang de dag la gcig bur bdag dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa ma gtogs par dngos po gzhan med pas na grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang /
analyzed: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la phyi'i dngos po med du zin kyang 'on kyang de dag la gcig bur bdag dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa ma gtogs par dngos po gzhan med pas na grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang /
translated: For those who speak of nonduality, even if external things do not exist, still, since there is no other thing apart from the self, BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on, there is the fault that liberation, nonliberation,

original: phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: wealth, poverty, and so on are the same.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dpe mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis phyi'i don med kyang skad cig pa'i chud ba'i rgyud 'byed pas mar me tha dad pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis mnyam par mi 'dzin pa'i ma rig pa dang /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dpe mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis phyi'i don med kyang skad cig pa'i chud ba'i rgyud 'byed pas mar me tha dad pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis mnyam par mi 'dzin pa'i ma rig pa dang /
translated: The Sugata has said that the non-dual consciousness is the cause of the appearance of the various forms of the world, and that the world is not external objects.

original: las rnam par smin pa'i mthus sems can mang po rnams la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa tha dad par snang ngo //
analyzed: las rnam par smin pa'i mthus sems can mang po rnams la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa tha dad par snang ngo //
translated: Even though external objects do not exist, the stream of consciousness is divided into moments, and through the power of the maturation of karma, many sentient beings appear in various different forms.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom pa dang / phra ba yan lag du ma rnam par phye ste stong bar mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom pa dang / phra ba yan lag du ma rnam par phye ste stong bar mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, the coarse and subtle aspects of the object of consciousness are distinguished and seen to be empty,

original: bdag nyid mi gnyis pa'i chud pa yin pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal med par 'byed bar mu stegs can gyi kun tu rtog pa ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi gnyis pa'i chud pa yin pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal med par 'byed bar mu stegs can gyi kun tu rtog pa ltar ma yin no //
translated: then, because of the non-duality of consciousness, there is no distinction between samsara and nirvana, or between suffering and non-suffering, as the tirthikas imagine.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las gsungs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: mya ngan 'das par rnam rtog med //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par rnam rtog med //
translated: Nirvana is free of conceptualization.

original: 'khor ba bsal bar bya ba min //
analyzed: 'khor ba bsal bar bya ba min //
translated: Samsara is not to be rejected.

original: gang na 'khor ba'ang mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: gang na 'khor ba'ang mya ngan 'das //
translated: Where samsara is, there is nirvana.üîΩWhat is there to conceptualize?

original: de ni ci zhig rnam par rtog / len med pa ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: de ni ci zhig rnam par rtog / len med pa ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Nirvana is free of appropriation.

original: mya ngan 'das kyang nga yir 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das kyang nga yir 'gyur //
translated: Nirvana is not mine.

original: gang dag 'dzin pa de dag len //
analyzed: gang dag 'dzin pa de dag len //
translated: Those who grasp are appropriators.

original: de ni legs min 'dzin pa'o //üîΩmya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
analyzed: de ni legs min 'dzin pa'o // mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
translated: That is not a proper appropriation.üîΩWhat is the limit of nirvana?

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa //üîΩde dag gnyis kyi bar na yang //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa // de dag gnyis kyi bar na yang //
translated: What is the limit of samsara?üîΩThere is not the slightest difference

original: chung zad phra ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: chung zad phra ba yod ma yin //
translated: Between the two.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad nas mthong ba yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad nas mthong ba yang mi mthong ste /
translated: When examined with wisdom, even what is seen is not seen.

original: mkhas pa yang dag par grol ba rnams ni gzhan gyi don du gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor bar spyod do //
analyzed: mkhas pa yang dag par grol ba rnams ni gzhan gyi don du gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor bar spyod do //
translated: The wise, who are truly liberated, engage in samsara like a reflection or a gandharva city.

original: nyan thos dang mu stegs can rnams ma gtogs par theg pa chen por snang ba'i tshul bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bstsal te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang mu stegs can rnams ma gtogs par theg pa chen por snang ba'i tshul bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bstsal te /
translated: Except for the ≈õrƒÅvakas and tƒ´rthikas, he has granted the discernment of things and non-things in the way they appear in the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: mtha' gnyis dpyad pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par @18a * //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dpyad pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par @18a * //
translated: The investigation of the two extremes is the realization of the non-duality of ultimate truth.

original: rtogs pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad pa yin no zhes 'bod 'grogs la chos bshad do //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad pa yin no zhes 'bod 'grogs la chos bshad do //
translated: This is the end of the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra. Thus he teaches the Dharma to those who call out to him.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba ni blos rtogs pa mthong ba de nyid las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba ni blos rtogs pa mthong ba de nyid las /
translated: From seeing the TathƒÅgata means that from that very seeing through the intellect,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin zhes de ltar dgongs par brtag go //

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor can rnams kyi gtso bo thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol bar bya'o zhes 'bod 'grogs kyis bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor can rnams kyi gtso bo thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol bar bya'o zhes 'bod 'grogs kyis bsam pa'o //

analyzed: de la rnal 'byor mnga' bas na rnal 'byor can no //

original: rnal 'byor la mnga' mdzad pa ni rnal 'byor rnam pa de'i dbang du 'gyur ba'i phyir snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pa las gang gis thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba yin no //

analyzed: thos pa dang / sems pa'i shes rab kyis dpyod pas thog mar snang ba dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor rnams su 'gyur ro //

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis bshig cing spos pa dang phral ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bar du snang ba med pa'i rnal 'byor du rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang gi tshe snying rje'i bag chags kyis gleng ste gzhan gyi don byed pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: tha mar thams cad mkhyen cing gzugs rnam ba sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor dbang por gyur te /

original: sems can rnams ji ltar 'dul bar 'gyur ba bzhin du lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i gzugs rnams kyis de ltar chos ston par mdzad do //

translated: As it is said in this very s≈´tra:

translated: in order to avert the yoga of the tƒ´rthikas,üîΩshould be supplicated by the Blessed One.

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten @18b las 'das pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su snyoms par 'jug go zhes te ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /

analyzed: srid pa gsum po kha cig sprul kha cig snga nas sprul pa ste /

analyzed: de ni theg pa rnam ston pa //

original: de ni nga yi rang bzhin sa //
analyzed: de ni nga yi rang bzhin sa //

analyzed: dbang phyug chen po gnas kyi mchog /'og min shin tu rnam par mdzes //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: khams gsum rnam par sprul pa gang //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par sprul pa gang //

analyzed: 'phrul bas sprul ba dang bral zhes bya ba ni 'phrul ba sprul pa zhes bya'o //

original: nyon mongs pa'i shing zad par byed ces bya ba la /

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyis yongs su bskor //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyis yongs su bskor //

original: zhes bya ba ni snod chung du'i chu'i nang du grong dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / gzhal med khang dang / skar ma mang po rnams gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis phan tshun du thogs pa med par snang ba bzhin du 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams kyang nyag ma'i rtse mor snang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: don dam par na sems can nyid ma rig pas glongs te rnam pa gnyis su 'byung ngo //

analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba med par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de bas na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa yin te @19a * //
translated: Therefore, by knowing the samƒÅdhi with light and without light, one is omniscient.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnal 'byor la dbang mdzad cing gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang bo sems can thams cad la phan pa mdzad cing bzhugs kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /

original: rnam rog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
analyzed: rnam rog rnam shes bzlog pa na //

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //üîΩyod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o // yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //

original: de bas med par shes mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med par shes mi bya //

analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid kyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: As it is said in the Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ, ‚ÄúOne realizes the equality of things and non-things.‚Äù

analyzed: thugs rje can dang thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan rgya cher smras pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúCompassionate One,‚Äù ‚ÄúOmniscient One,‚Äù ‚ÄúAll-pervading One,‚Äù and so on, are the extensive praises of the qualities of the Blessed One.

original: thams cad du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i yon tan tshad mar gyur pas yang dag par bstod pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i yon tan tshad mar gyur pas yang dag par bstod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll-pervading‚Äù means that the true qualities are the measure of the true praise.

original: ye shes la gzugs med pas na yul rnam par cad pa med de /
analyzed: ye shes la gzugs med pas na yul rnam par cad pa med de /
translated: Since wisdom is formless, there is no object to be known.

original: de bas na /

analyzed: thams cad rnam rtog med cing snang ba med //

original: 'phros pa rnams kyis ma 'phros pa //

translated: ‚ÄúThis is the nectar of the Buddha‚Äôs teaching, the lords of the world.‚Äù

original: stong ba zhes par smra mi bya //

analyzed: mi stong par yang ma yin te //

analyzed: gnyis ka mi gnyis ma yin pa //

original: zhi la bzhi po ga la zhig / mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / nyan thos ni mi rtag pa dang / theg pa chen po'i tshul ni rtogs rgyun rtag pa dang / chad pa dang phral bas ton mongs pa zad pa'i thar pa'o //
analyzed: zhi la bzhi po ga la zhig / mu stegs can ni rtag pa dang / nyan thos ni mi rtag pa dang / theg pa chen po'i tshul ni rtogs rgyun rtag pa dang / chad pa dang phral bas ton mongs pa zad pa'i thar pa'o //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas are attached to permanence, the ≈õrƒÅvakas to impermanence, but the MahƒÅyƒÅna is free from the extremes of permanence and annihilation, and is liberation, the exhaustion of afflictions.

original: byed pa dang mtshan nyid rnam par log pa zhes bya ba ni gang na byed pa'am mtshan nyid rtag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang mtshan nyid rnam par log pa zhes bya ba ni gang na byed pa'am mtshan nyid rtag pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe reversal of activity and characteristics‚Äù means that which is without permanent activity or characteristics.

original: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis ba mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor phyi rol dang bdag tu lta bas skyon can du byas pas spangs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis ba mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor phyi rol dang bdag tu lta bas skyon can du byas pas spangs te /
translated: The second and non-second are rejected because they are flawed by the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô yoga, externalism, and the view of self.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa dang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par mi rtog pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa dang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par mi rtog pa /

original: mi @19b gnyis pa rtogs pa /

original: byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba /

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor sangs rgyas kyis 'thob par byed pa shes par 'dod do //

analyzed: de la yang mu stegs can rnams kyi byed pa dang / byed pa por mngon pa 'chags bas 'khor bar gdags so //
translated: In this regard, the Tƒ´rthikas imagine a creator and a created, and thus impute sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: 'du byed skad cig par yongs su shes pas bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed pa la mngon par chags par bzlog pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ldog ste /

translated: By fully understanding conditioned things as momentary, one turns away from attachment to self, creator, and creation, and thus turns away from the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas chags pa med par 'grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas chags pa med par 'grol bar 'gyur ro //

original: skad cig pa'i dngos po ni 'jig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i dngos po ni 'jig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin te /

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i dge 'dun chen po ba rnams kyis klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i dge 'dun chen po ba rnams kyis klog pa /
translated: As it is recited by the great noble Sa·πÖgha:

original: 'du byed rnams ni skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni skad cig ma //
