original: mi brtan byed pa gal zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de /
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa gal zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de /
translated: It is not stable, and it is not the agent.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: It is just that which is done.

original: de de ltar na byed pa po dang byed ba mngon par 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa mi rung /üîΩbyed pa po las tha dad byed pa'i byed pa med /
analyzed: de de ltar na byed pa po dang byed ba mngon par 'brel ba dngos por gyur pa mi rung / byed pa po las tha dad byed pa'i byed pa med /
translated: Thus, the agent and the action are not tenable as real entities that are connected.üîΩThe agent does not have an action that is different from it.

original: de dang bral ba'i byed pa po yang bsngo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i byed pa po yang bsngo bar mi bya'o //

original: de bas na bha dra ha ris byed pa bstan pa las smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na bha dra ha ris byed pa bstan pa las smras pa /

original: grub dang ma grub ji snyed pa //
analyzed: grub dang ma grub ji snyed pa //

original: bsgrub pa'i phyir ni bstan par bya //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i phyir ni bstan par bya //

original: rten ba'i rim gyi rang bzhin phyir //
analyzed: rten ba'i rim gyi rang bzhin phyir //

original: de ni byed par brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ni byed par brjod pa'o // zhes pa ste /
translated: it is said to be an action.

original: byed pa dpyad zin to //
analyzed: byed pa dpyad zin to //
translated: The analysis of the agent is finished.

original: da ni mtshan nyid dpyad par brtsam ste /
analyzed: da ni mtshan nyid dpyad par brtsam ste /
translated: Now the analysis of characteristics will be begun.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //üîΩmtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba // mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩIf the characterized and the characteristic

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: were different, the characteristic would be without a characterized.

original: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they were the same, those two would not be established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they were different, they would not be other.

original: ces pa'o // mtshan nyid la'ang mtshan nyid gzhan dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces pa'o // mtshan nyid la'ang mtshan nyid gzhan dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, a characteristic would need another characteristic.

original: bdag nyid ma grub pas gzhan gyis mtshan nyid du ji ltar na 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma grub pas gzhan gyis mtshan nyid du ji ltar na 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not established by itself, how could it be a characteristic of another?

original: byed pa dang mtshan gyi tha snyad kyang rnam pa gnyis kyi shes pa las 'byung gi / gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang gis rig cing rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa dang mtshan gyi tha snyad kyang rnam pa gnyis kyi shes pa las 'byung gi / gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang gis rig cing rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: The conventions of action and characteristic arise from the cognition of the two, but not from the nondual ultimate truth, which is known by oneself, nonconceptual, and without appearance.

original: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Diamond Cutter:

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de @20a * //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de @20a * //
translated: To the extent that there is perfection of characteristics,

original: tsam du brdzun no //
analyzed: tsam du brdzun no //
translated: to that extent there is falsity.

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes pa ste /
translated: To the extent that there is no perfection of characteristics, to that extent there is no falsity.

original: de bas na byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / mtshan mar bya ba dang / mngon par rjod pa dang / mngon par brjod par bya ba dang / chos dang / chos can du rnam par rtog par 'phros pa ni tha snyad du bya ba yin gyis /
analyzed: de bas na byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / mtshan mar bya ba dang / mngon par rjod pa dang / mngon par brjod par bya ba dang / chos dang / chos can du rnam par rtog par 'phros pa ni tha snyad du bya ba yin gyis /
translated: Therefore, the proliferation of conceptualization in terms of action, agent, object, expression, object of expression, phenomena, and the nature of phenomena is conventional,

original: don dam par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimate.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: 'phros pa las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
analyzed: 'phros pa las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
translated: Proliferation is transcended in the nondual

original: gang dag sangs rgyas 'phros par byed //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas 'phros par byed //
translated: For those who proliferate the Buddha,

original: de dag 'phros nyams glen pa rnams //
analyzed: de dag 'phros nyams glen pa rnams //
translated: Those proliferators are impaired and foolish,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: And do not see the TathƒÅgata.

original: zhes pa'o // gzhan gyi dbang 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong don dam pa'i bden ba mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa dbu ma'i rnal 'byor mu stegs pa dang nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor dang bral ba gang gis ye shes kyi khyad par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bla ma'i rtogs
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gzhan gyi dbang 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong don dam pa'i bden ba mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa dbu ma'i rnal 'byor mu stegs pa dang nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor dang bral ba gang gis ye shes kyi khyad par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bla ma'i rtogs
translated: The yogi of the middle way, who is free from the yogas of the tƒ´rthikas and ≈õrƒÅvakas, requests the guru to explain the special wisdom that is to be realized.

original: ba chud par bya bar gsol lo snyam pa ni /
analyzed: ba chud par bya bar gsol lo snyam pa ni /
translated: The request is as follows:

original: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
translated: Just as it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩThose of little intelligence see existence and

original: su dag dngos bo yod mthong dang // med par mthong ba blo chung rnams //
analyzed: su dag dngos bo yod mthong dang // med par mthong ba blo chung rnams //
translated: see nonexistence.

original: lta ba nyer zhi zhi ba ni //
analyzed: lta ba nyer zhi zhi ba ni //
translated: The pacification of views and peace

original: de dag rnams kyis mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis mi mthong ngo //
translated: is not seen by them.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:üîΩThe ultimate is the emptiness of the two, the apprehending of the dependent nature and the apprehended nature.

original: de don dam pa tshul la yongs su dri bar 'bod 'grogs kyis nan tan bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de don dam pa tshul la yongs su dri bar 'bod 'grogs kyis nan tan bskyed pa ni /
translated: The yogi of the middle way, who is free from the yogas of the tƒ´rthikas and ≈õrƒÅvakas, requests the guru to explain the special wisdom that is to be realized.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la dpyod pa bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pas gnas bde bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa'i ma thob par byed pa bdag gis chud pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes pa ste /üîΩ'phros pa las 'das pa dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa rnam par mi rtog ba don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa sangs rgyas kyis thob par byed pas mchog tu 'phags ba'i rnal 'byor de 'di gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang bo 'bod 'grogs kyis nyan cing
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la dpyod pa bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pas gnas bde bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa'i ma thob par byed pa bdag gis chud pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes pa ste / 'phros pa las 'das pa dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa rnam par mi rtog ba don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa sangs rgyas kyis thob par byed pas mchog tu 'phags ba'i rnal 'byor de 'di gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang bo 'bod 'grogs kyis nyan cing
translated: One should think, I will increase the attainment of the bliss of the Tathagata, the attainment of the bliss of the samadhi of the analysis of the non-conceptual, which is not attained by those who are not happy.üîΩ The yoga of the supreme exalted one, which is the attainment of the non-dual realization of ultimate truth, the non-conceptualization of entities and non-entities that transcends proliferation, is this.

original: shes par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one who wishes to hear and understand that yoga of the various aspects of form is called the one who is accompanied by the lord of yoga.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos la bzod pa thob par thugs su chud nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don du nges shing gang 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i ngo bo gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba thams cad rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan dang /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos la bzod pa thob par thugs su chud nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don du nges shing gang 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i ngo bo gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba thams cad rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan dang /
translated: Having understood the acceptance that dharmas are not produced, etc.

original: rmi lam dang / mig @20b 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du de dag ma skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig @20b 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du de dag ma skyes pa nyid do //
translated: All appearances in the aspect of the two, the apprehender and the apprehended, are like a mirage, a dream, a magical creation, etc.üîΩThey are not produced.

original: gzugs med par yang snang ba'i chos nyid kyis blo phyi'i don lta bur skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med par yang snang ba'i chos nyid kyis blo phyi'i don lta bur skyes pa yin te /
translated: The nature of phenomena is to appear even though they do not exist. The mind is produced as if it were an external object.

original: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par dbye ba na stong ba yin par shes nas chos mi skye bar bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par dbye ba na stong ba yin par shes nas chos mi skye bar bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one understands that it is empty, because it is divided into gross and subtle, one will accept that dharmas are not produced.

original: rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of essencelessness:

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las gsungs pa mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las gsungs pa mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: as stated in the Samdhinirmocana, the essencelessness of characteristic, the essencelessness of production, and the essencelessness of the ultimate.

original: phyi'i don dngos po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ji ltar brtags pa de ltar med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don dngos po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ji ltar brtags pa de ltar med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The characteristics of external things, such as permanence and impermanence, do not exist as they are imagined, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa ma skyes pa ste /
translated: The absence of a nature of arising is the non-arising of a consciousness with the aspect of duality.

original: rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: It is like forms in cataracts, reflections, dreams, and magical illusions and so on.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes yongs su grub pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes yongs su grub pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin med do //
translated: And in the perfected, ultimate wisdom, there is no nature of duality.

original: de de ltar chos la rnam pa gnyis med pa'i tshul gyis chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i yongs su shes pas 'bod 'grogs kyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de de ltar chos la rnam pa gnyis med pa'i tshul gyis chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i yongs su shes pas 'bod 'grogs kyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
translated: Thus, by means of the non-dual knowledge of phenomena, he attains the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena through the complete knowledge of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: bdag med pa gnyis kyang byed pa dang byed pa po mngon par 'brel ba med pa dang / 'dzin pa dang gzung ba dngos po gnyis kyi rnam par skye bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis kyang byed pa dang byed pa po mngon par 'brel ba med pa dang / 'dzin pa dang gzung ba dngos po gnyis kyi rnam par skye bar mi rung ste /
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are not related to an agent and an action, and it is not possible for them to arise in the form of the duality of the apprehending subject and the apprehended object.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig 'byung ba de'i tshe na gnyis pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig 'byung ba de'i tshe na gnyis pa med de /
translated: When one moment occurs, the second is not present,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of the past and the future.

original: ji ltar khyod rnam par rtog pa'i gnas shin tu gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas rgyur ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod rnam par rtog pa'i gnas shin tu gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas rgyur ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúhaving completely transformed the basis of conceptual thought,‚Äù the basis is the store consciousness.

original: sa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa dang 'jungs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: sa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa dang 'jungs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The counteragents to the spiritual levels are the faults of ignorance, miserliness, and so on.

original: rab tu 'byed pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: rab tu 'byed pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
translated: The ‚Äúdiscriminating mind‚Äù is wisdom.

original: so sor rang gi rig pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ni mi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rang gi rig pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ni mi gnyis pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the mode of individual intuitive knowledge is nonduality.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rdzogs longs spyod ba'i sku rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rdzogs longs spyod ba'i sku rnams kyis so //
translated: By means of concentration, the Buddhas, i.e., the Bodies of Bliss,

original: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: are tranquil, i.e., they pacify the defilements.

original: nyes pa las 'das pa ni nyes pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa las 'das pa ni nyes pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: They are beyond reproach, i.e., they are free from the reproach of the defilements.

original: gsum 'brel pa las dben pa zhes bya @21a * //
analyzed: gsum 'brel pa las dben pa zhes bya @21a * //
translated: They are isolated, i.e., they are isolated from the three.

original: ste ; snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: ste ; snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: They are only present when the preceding ones are present.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa la gnyis kyi rnam par las dang 'bras bur 'brel bar snang ngo //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa la gnyis kyi rnam par las dang 'bras bur 'brel bar snang ngo //
translated: In the case of the appearance, the connection between action and result appears in the form of a duality.

original: snang ba med pa la ni gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba'ang med do //
analyzed: snang ba med pa la ni gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba'ang med do //
translated: In the case of the non-appearance, even the appearance in the form of a duality does not exist.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi 'byed par snang ba'i rnam bar rtog ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi 'byed par snang ba'i rnam bar rtog ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no discursive thought which appears as the division of past, future, and present.

original: bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang / rig ba por 'gyur ba bdag nyid la byed pa med pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang / rig ba por 'gyur ba bdag nyid la byed pa med pas so //
translated: Because there is no activity on the part of the self, which is to be known and the knower.

original: yang dag par rig pa tsam zhig yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa tsam zhig yin mod kyi /
translated: It is only the mere knowledge.

original: 'on kyang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: But there is no conceptualization of things and non-things.

original: de skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med pas na bdag med ba gnyis la yang rnam par rtog pa rnams so sor mi snang ste /
analyzed: de skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med pas na bdag med ba gnyis la yang rnam par rtog pa rnams so sor mi snang ste /
translated: Since there is no other phenomenon such as arising, the two kinds of selflessness are not seen as separate.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were conditioned,

original: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rigs te //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rigs te //
translated: It would have the three characteristics.

original: 'on te skye ba 'dus byas min //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba 'dus byas min //
translated: But if arising is unconditioned,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //üîΩskye ba skye ba ji bzhin pa'i //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung // skye ba skye ba ji bzhin pa'i //
translated: How could it be a characteristic of the conditioned?

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyi ma yin te //üîΩ'gog pa la ni 'gog pa yang //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyi ma yin te // 'gog pa la ni 'gog pa yang //
translated: Arising is not of the nature of another arising,

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyi ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyi ma yin pa'o //
translated: Nor is cessation of the nature of another cessation.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Dependent origination is non-arising,

original: byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel nas skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel nas skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it arises in dependence on a cause and a producer.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i skad cig pa rnams la /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i skad cig pa rnams la /
translated: The moments that have the aspect of duality

original: skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa yin te /
translated: Do not have the nature of arising.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bod 'grogs kyis bdag med pa gnyis la yang skye ba med par bzod pa thugs su chud nas cho 'phrul gyis mgu bar mdzad do //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bod 'grogs kyis bdag med pa gnyis la yang skye ba med par bzod pa thugs su chud nas cho 'phrul gyis mgu bar mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Lord, having understood the non-arising of the two kinds of selflessness through the invocation, delighted them with the miracles.

original: 'phrul pas sprul ba rnams kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par sna tshogs su mos pa rnams la bsam pa chud par mdzad pa'i gnas kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'phrul pas sprul ba rnams kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par sna tshogs su mos pa rnams la bsam pa chud par mdzad pa'i gnas kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The teaching by the emanations of the emanated ones refers to the mandala of the abode that fulfills the intentions of those devoted to the various manifestations.

original: ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang lan gdab par mi gsungs so //
analyzed: ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang lan gdab par mi gsungs so //
translated: The essence refers to the fact that the Tathagatas do not speak, meaning they do not speak to refute or affirm.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas 'bod 'grogs mgu bar byas pa dang / phyag 'tshal zhing gsol ba la sogs pa ni sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang chos gnyis zhus pa'i lan bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du blan na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas 'bod 'grogs mgu bar byas pa dang / phyag 'tshal zhing gsol ba la sogs pa ni sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang chos gnyis zhus pa'i lan bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du blan na /
translated: The omniscient one delights them through invocation, and they pay homage, make requests, and so on, just as the previous Buddhas did, in the same way that they explained the answer to the request for the two Dharmas.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos dang chos ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa rnam @21b pa gnyis su ji ltar 'byed pa bkal stsal du gsol /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos dang chos ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa rnam @21b pa gnyis su ji ltar 'byed pa bkal stsal du gsol /
translated: In the same way, the BhagavƒÅn should explain how the Dharma and non-Dharma are divided into two types of conceptualization.

original: 'bod 'grogs kyis ci bsam zhe na /
analyzed: 'bod 'grogs kyis ci bsam zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the question?

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par rnam par rig par bya ba'i chos nyid la chos dang / chos ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par rtog pa rnams mi srid ces so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par rnam par rig par bya ba'i chos nyid la chos dang / chos ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par rtog pa rnams mi srid ces so //
translated: In the ultimate truth, which is non-dual and to be cognized, it is impossible to have the two types of conceptualization of Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: gnyis kyi chos nyid la chos dang / chos ma yin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes par rtogs pa ni 'phrul bas sprul pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis kyi chos nyid la chos dang / chos ma yin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes par rtogs pa ni 'phrul bas sprul pa bstan to //
translated: In the two-fold reality, the realization of consciousness in the form of the two, Dharma and non-Dharma, is taught by the emanation.

original: sa bcur dbang bskur ba der /
analyzed: sa bcur dbang bskur ba der /
translated: In the empowerment on the ten grounds,

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang por gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang por gyur te /
translated: one becomes a lord of yogins.

original: snang ba bzhin du chos kyi tshul rjes su mthun par don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par rtogs pa la bzhugs pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyi tshig gi spyod yul du ma lhung bar chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: snang ba bzhin du chos kyi tshul rjes su mthun par don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par rtogs pa la bzhugs pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyi tshig gi spyod yul du ma lhung bar chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas, whose nature is to abide in the realization of ultimate truth, which is not dual, in accordance with the way things are, as they appear, teach the Dharma without falling into the domain of words.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos la mnga' mdzad pa nyid kyis chos gnyis po de legs par bshad du gsol zhes bya ba la chos la mnga' mdzad ces bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs sna tshogs su cho 'phrul mdzad pas mgu bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos la mnga' mdzad pa nyid kyis chos gnyis po de legs par bshad du gsol zhes bya ba la chos la mnga' mdzad ces bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs sna tshogs su cho 'phrul mdzad pas mgu bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, having mastery over the Dharma, should explain those two dharmas well. Mastery over the Dharma means that the Lord of Yogins, omniscient through concentration with and without appearances, delights the various forms of magic by his magic.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis bsam pa'i dogs pa ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar bshad du gsol zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis bsam pa'i dogs pa ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar bshad du gsol zhes so //
translated: Please explain in such a way that the doubts of all worldly people are dispelled.

original: chos nyid kyang spong bar bgyid na chos ma mchis pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang spong bar bgyid na chos ma mchis pa lta ci smos /
translated: If one abandons even the true nature of phenomena, what need is there to mention abandoning the Dharma?

original: chos gnyis pa de ji ltar spang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chos gnyis pa de ji ltar spang bar 'gyur //
translated: How can the second dharma be abandoned?

original: chos sa ma chos ma mchis pa gang lags /
analyzed: chos sa ma chos ma mchis pa gang lags /
translated: What is a dharma, what is not a dharma?

original: gnyis spang ba'i chos can rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba rnams la ji ltar na mchis zhes bya ba ni don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa la chos dang chos ma yin par rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis spang ba'i chos can rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba rnams la ji ltar na mchis zhes bya ba ni don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa la chos dang chos ma yin par rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of those who have fallen into the conceptual characteristics of dharmas and non-dharmas to be abandoned as dual, how can they exist? This is because in the realization of non-dual ultimate reality, the two concepts of dharma and non-dharma do not appear.

original: khyad par du snang ba med na yang ji ltar na chos dang chos ma yin par 'byed pa yod /
analyzed: khyad par du snang ba med na yang ji ltar na chos dang chos ma yin par 'byed pa yod /
translated: Even when there is no appearance of distinction, how can there be a distinction between dharma and non-dharma?

original: de dag yod pa nyid de 'bras bur 'brel bar byed pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid de 'bras bur 'brel bar byed pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do exist because they are definitely connected as causes and effects.

original: de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin par ji ltar yid ches par bya zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin par ji ltar yid ches par bya zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: How can one be confident that they do not ultimately exist?

original: 'bod 'grogs kyis rigs pa gzhan smras pa /
analyzed: 'bod 'grogs kyis rigs pa gzhan smras pa /
translated: In response, Vimalakƒ´rti speaks of another reason:

original: 'byung ba las gyur ba ma lags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur ba ma lags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Not made of elements and so on.

original: 'byung ba las gyur ba ma yin pa'i dngos @22a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur ba ma yin pa'i dngos @22a * //
translated: Not made of elements,

original: po dang / dngos po ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: po dang / dngos po ma yin pa ste /
translated: and not a thing.

original: yin pa'i sgra bsnan par bya'o //
analyzed: yin pa'i sgra bsnan par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthing‚Äù should be supplied.

original: gang dag yang don dam pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur ba yang dag par phyi rol gyi don med pas na yang dag pa las ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag yang don dam pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur ba yang dag par phyi rol gyi don med pas na yang dag pa las ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Those which are not ultimate things are not real, because external objects do not exist.

original: de dag kyang spyi'i rnam par sgro btags pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang spyi'i rnam par sgro btags pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And those are conceptual fabrications of a universal.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rig pas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su mi shes pa ste
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rig pas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su mi shes pa ste
translated: ‚ÄúNot fully understanding the store-consciousness‚Äù means not understanding the nature of the store-consciousness as luminous clarity, etc.

original: / mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pas 'khrug pas sgra dang don du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad 'byung ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pas 'khrug pas sgra dang don du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad 'byung ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is disturbed by the ignorance of non-integration, the appearance of the convention of the duality of sound and meaning does not ultimately exist.

original: bag chags bsags pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rim par dbye ba 'byed pa na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bag chags bsags pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rim par dbye ba 'byed pa na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: When the process of accumulating latent impressions and the process of their maturation are distinguished, it is like a dream, a conjuring trick, and so on.

original: chos dang chos med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa yang ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: chos dang chos med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa yang ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: How can the aspects of both existent and nonexistent things occur?

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, possessions, and the appearance of the place

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: arise from the store consciousness.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, the eight and the nine

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: are like waves in the ocean.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa yul dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rang gi rig pa de rnams kyang med de /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa yul dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rang gi rig pa de rnams kyang med de /
translated: At the time of a dream, those objects such as form, those consciousnesses such as visual consciousness, and those self-cognitions such as pleasure and pain do not exist.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig yod de bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las nad glongs pa sa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa snang ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig yod de bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las nad glongs pa sa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa snang ngo //
translated: Only the store consciousness exists, and it appears in various aspects due to the power of its own stream and the stream of others, like the dizziness and fainting of a person with vertigo.

original: sgra shad 'dzings pa chu dang zheng du snang ba'i khyad par du 'byed pa bzhin der rnam pa gnyis su ji ltar 'byed ces 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol pa'o //
analyzed: sgra shad 'dzings pa chu dang zheng du snang ba'i khyad par du 'byed pa bzhin der rnam pa gnyis su ji ltar 'byed ces 'bod 'grogs kyis gsol pa'o //
translated: The questioner asks, How can it be divided into two aspects, like the difference between the length and width of a rope that is twisted together?

original: ring du mi gnas pa dang / skad cig mar 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: ring du mi gnas pa dang / skad cig mar 'jig pa'o //
translated: It does not remain for a long time, and it is destroyed in an instant.

original: rtag pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not permanent,

original: ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not produced, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ma dag pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa rnams kyis shes pa rnams kyi bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yul gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang gi / de dag don dam par mchis
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ma dag pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa rnams kyis shes pa rnams kyi bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yul gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang gi / de dag don dam par mchis
translated: The so-called impure object of the sense consciousnesses is like the consciousnesses of those who are dizzy, fainting, and so on. Forms and so on appear as apprehended objects and apprehending subjects, but ultimately they do not exist as external objects.

original: pa ni ma lags zhes gsol pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / @22b snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sems can thams cad la phan gdags par zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis dris pa'i lan du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: pa ni ma lags zhes gsol pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / @22b snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sems can thams cad la phan gdags par zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis dris pa'i lan du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One, who is endowed with the concentration of appearance and non-appearance, the lord of the yoga of various forms, who is engaged in benefiting all sentient beings, replied to the question:

original: lang ka'i bdag po 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa 'chag ba'i rang bzhin 'jig pa'i chos can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi dmigs par rtogs pa la chos dang chos med pa la sogs pa so sor snang bar 'byed
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa 'chag ba'i rang bzhin 'jig pa'i chos can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi dmigs par rtogs pa la chos dang chos med pa la sogs pa so sor snang bar 'byed
translated: O Lord of Lanka, in this way, the so-called 'impermanent phenomena' such as pots and so forth, which are of the nature of destruction, and so on, are not different in terms of the ultimate truth, which is realized as non-apprehensible.

original: pa med du zin yang /
analyzed: pa med du zin yang /
translated: Although there is no differentiation in terms of the appearance of phenomena and non-phenomena, and so on,

original: 'on kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul bzhin du tha dad pa'i bye brag yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul bzhin du tha dad pa'i bye brag yod do //
translated: nevertheless, there is a difference in terms of the objects of conceptualization of the childish, such as pots, cloth, and so forth.

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa 'di bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi mthu las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis gang gi tshe gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa so sor snang ba'i tshe rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa 'di bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi mthu las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis gang gi tshe gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa so sor snang ba'i tshe rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This connection between karma and its effects is posited by the power of the mind's engagement with virtue and nonvirtue in one's own and others' continuums, when the cognition of both appears distinctly.üîΩThe Omniscient One also said in response to the question of how to distinguish phenomena and nonphenomena:

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang snang bar 'byed pa nyid kyi lan du gsungs pa ni don dam par chos dang chos med pa dbyer med mod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang snang bar 'byed pa nyid kyi lan du gsungs pa ni don dam par chos dang chos med pa dbyer med mod kyi /
translated: Ultimately, phenomena and nonphenomena are inseparable.

original: 'on kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin du so sor snang bar 'byed pas dbye ba yod na byis pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzung ste chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag gi 'bras bu de bzhin du 'di la yang
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin du so sor snang bar 'byed pas dbye ba yod na byis pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzung ste chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag gi 'bras bu de bzhin du 'di la yang
translated: Nevertheless, just as a vase and a cloth are distinguished by their distinct appearances, if there is a distinction, then, taking the conceptual thoughts of the childish into account, the effects of the distinctions between phenomena and nonphenomena are accepted.

original: ci'i phyir mi gzung /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi gzung /
translated: Why should it not be accepted in the same way in this case?

original: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdus pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdus pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Compendium of Reality:

original: rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Son of noble family, this mind is naturally luminous.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mngon bar 'du byed pa rnams kyis gang ji ltar sbyong ba bzhin du de de ltar yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mngon bar 'du byed pa rnams kyis gang ji ltar sbyong ba bzhin du de de ltar yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: Whatever is purified by the performance of virtue and non-virtue, that is accomplished accordingly.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa gong ma gong ma'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i sku so sor snang ba rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par spyod pa'i thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa gong ma gong ma'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i sku so sor snang ba rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par spyod pa'i thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the bodies adorned with the marks of the collections of merit of the higher and higher stages and perfections, the Buddhas act for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: sdig pa mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis kyang ngan song du snang ba rnams mthong zhing rmi lam ngan pa bzhin du yun ring po mi bzad pa tsha ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis kyang ngan song du snang ba rnams mthong zhing rmi lam ngan pa bzhin du yun ring po mi bzad pa tsha ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: By the performance of evil, the appearances of the lower realms are seen, like a bad dream, for a long time, with the ripening of the fruit of unbearable heat.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'di yang rnam par shes par gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo 'di yang rnam par shes par gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: This nature of cause and effect is also the transformation of consciousness.

original: chos dang chos med pa so sor nges par smin pa snang ngo //
analyzed: chos dang chos med pa so sor nges par smin pa snang ngo //
translated: The appearance of the ripening of the definite individual of virtue and non-virtue is seen.

original: phyi'i don @23a * //
analyzed: phyi'i don @23a * //
translated: The external object

original: med par yang rmi lam du mes tshig pa la sogs pa dang / chus 'khru ba dang 'thung ba la sogs pa dgos pa bzhin du 'khor ba stong pa la yang chos dang chos med pa'i 'bras bu nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: med par yang rmi lam du mes tshig pa la sogs pa dang / chus 'khru ba dang 'thung ba la sogs pa dgos pa bzhin du 'khor ba stong pa la yang chos dang chos med pa'i 'bras bu nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Also, in dreams, one is burned by fire, etc., and one is washed and drinks water, etc., even though they do not exist.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes khong du chud par mthong bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes khong du chud par mthong bas ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, in empty cyclic existence, the effect of dharma and nondharma is certain, but it is not seen by the understanding of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes ni mi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes ni mi gnyis pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of the noble ones is nondual.

original: so sor snang ba 'byed pas ni phye ba ma yin pas der rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel bar 'jug pa chos dang chos med pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang bar 'byed pa med do //
analyzed: so sor snang ba 'byed pas ni phye ba ma yin pas der rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel bar 'jug pa chos dang chos med pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang bar 'byed pa med do //
translated: Since it is the discernment of individual appearances, it is not a discernment, and therefore it does not discern the connection of cause and effect as the appearance of the two, dharma and nondharma.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas rigs pa'i khyad par gzhan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas rigs pa'i khyad par gzhan yang gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has stated another special reasoning:

original: lang ka'i bdag po bum pa la sogs pa dngos po'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su lhung ba rnams ni byis pa dag gi yin te /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po bum pa la sogs pa dngos po'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su lhung ba rnams ni byis pa dag gi yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúO Lord of Lanka, the various characteristics of things, such as pots, are the domain of fools,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi ma yin pa lta zhog la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ma yin pa lta zhog la /
translated: not of the noble ones.

original: rang bzhin gcig cing zhes bya ba ni mi gnyis pa don dam par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig cing zhes bya ba ni mi gnyis pa don dam par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúthey have the same nature‚Äù should be understood to mean that they are nondual in ultimate reality.

original: 'bar ba gcig las byung ba'i rab tu 'bar ba khyim dang / gnas dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang pa la 'dug pa'i shing gi dbang gis 'od ring ba dang / thung ba dang / chung ba dang / che ba'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: 'bar ba gcig las byung ba'i rab tu 'bar ba khyim dang / gnas dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang pa la 'dug pa'i shing gi dbang gis 'od ring ba dang / thung ba dang / chung ba dang / che ba'i khyad par dang /
translated: The line ‚Äúthe difference in the length and shortness of the flames is due to the wood‚Äù means that the difference in the length and shortness of the flames that appear in the houses, dwellings, parks, and huts that are burning in a single conflagration is due to the wood that is in them.üîΩThe line ‚Äúthe difference in the appearance of the flames is due to the wood‚Äù means that the difference in the length and shortness of the flames that are perceived in a single conflagration in the houses and so on is due to the wood that is in them.

original: tha dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba zhes bya ba ni me tsam gyis gzung ba spyir khyim la sogs pa'i 'bar ba la shing gi dbang gis thung ngu dang / ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par rab tu shes par byed pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid chud pa tsam yod mod kyi 'on kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dam pa dang /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba zhes bya ba ni me tsam gyis gzung ba spyir khyim la sogs pa'i 'bar ba la shing gi dbang gis thung ngu dang / ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par rab tu shes par byed pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid chud pa tsam yod mod kyi 'on kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dam pa dang /
translated: In the same way, although all sentient beings are pervaded by the nondual ultimate reality, nevertheless, due to the difference in the spiritual lineages of self and others, the difference in the length and shortness of the flames of the fire of wisdom that burns the fuel of the afflictions is due to the difference in the spiritual lineages of self and others.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bshad pas bsod nams dang / sdig pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyud tha dad par 'byed pas dbye ba na rtogs pa khyad par can du 'gyur ba ni rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par lta bu ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bshad pas bsod nams dang / sdig pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyud tha dad par 'byed pas dbye ba na rtogs pa khyad par can du 'gyur ba ni rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par lta bu ste /
translated: The explanation of the non-sacred Dharma is the cause of the accumulation of merit and the cause of the accumulation of sin. The division is the division of the different continuums. The special realization is the special result from the special cause.

original: ji ltar dharma k'irtis smra ba 'byed pa dang / 'byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di lta ste /üîΩ'gal ba'i chos la gnas pa dang / phyed par 'byed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: ji ltar dharma k'irtis smra ba 'byed pa dang / 'byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di lta ste / 'gal ba'i chos la gnas pa dang / phyed par 'byed pa'o zhes so //
translated: As Dharmakirti says, ‚ÄúThe cause of the division of the speech is the division of the cause.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe division is the division of the appearance of the Dharma and the non-Dharma.‚Äù

original: chos dang chos med pa so sor snang bar 'byed pas 'byed do zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: chos dang chos med pa so sor snang bar 'byed pas 'byed do zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa rjes su dpag go //
translated: The intention of the Omniscient One is inferred from all of this.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
translated: As the master Dharmakirti says,

original: gzhan la gzhan du 'grib pa yang //üîΩdbyer med min te gzugs mthong phyir //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan du 'grib pa yang // dbyer med min te gzugs mthong phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other is not the other,üîΩbecause it is not indivisible, because it is seen.

original: rang @23b bzhin tha dad mi mthong bas //üîΩblos ni tha dad mi rtogs so //
analyzed: rang @23b bzhin tha dad mi mthong bas // blos ni tha dad mi rtogs so //
translated: The nature is not seen as different,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: and the mind does not conceive of difference.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag yod par ci'i phyir mi gzung /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag yod par ci'i phyir mi gzung /
translated: Likewise, why wouldn‚Äôt you also apprehend the difference between phenomena and non-phenomena in this case?

original: me lce rgyud gcig tu gyur ba'i 'od 'phro ba tha dad pa'i bye brag tu mthong ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: me lce rgyud gcig tu gyur ba'i 'od 'phro ba tha dad pa'i bye brag tu mthong ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only do you see the difference between the light of a single flame and the light of a different flame,

original: lang ka'i bdag po sa bon gcig las byung yang myu gu dang / ljang bu dang / sog ma dang / tshigs dang / lo ma dang / yal ga dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / gra ma'i bye brag yod pa de bzhin du phyi'i chos skye ba'i chos can thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po sa bon gcig las byung yang myu gu dang / ljang bu dang / sog ma dang / tshigs dang / lo ma dang / yal ga dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / gra ma'i bye brag yod pa de bzhin du phyi'i chos skye ba'i chos can thams cad kyi'o //
translated: the lord of Lanka, just as there is a difference between the sprout, the stalk, the husk, the node, the leaf, the branch, the flower, the fruit, and the straw, which arise from a single seed, so it is with all external phenomena that arise.

original: nang gi rnams kyi yang ma rig pa las rab tu byung ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du gtogs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sa bon gcig las byung ba ni ji ltar myu gu dang / ljang bu dang / 'dab ma dang /
analyzed: nang gi rnams kyi yang ma rig pa las rab tu byung ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du gtogs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sa bon gcig las byung ba ni ji ltar myu gu dang / ljang bu dang / 'dab ma dang /
translated: And for internal phenomena, all that is included in the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres that arise from ignorance are called ‚Äòarisen from a single seed.‚Äô Just as the sprout, the stalk, the leaf,

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rim pa tha dad par dbye ba rkyen gyi khyad par gyi dbang las 'byed pas 'byed pa de bzhin du rtogs pa bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis chos dang chos ma yin pa mngon par 'du byed pas mtho ris dang /üîΩngan song so sor snang ste /
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rim pa tha dad par dbye ba rkyen gyi khyad par gyi dbang las 'byed pas 'byed pa de bzhin du rtogs pa bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis chos dang chos ma yin pa mngon par 'du byed pas mtho ris dang / ngan song so sor snang ste /
translated: Just as flowers, fruits, and so on are distinguished by the power of different conditions, in the same way, by the power of the mind streams of self and others, the creation of virtue and nonvirtue appears as the individual states of high status and bad migrations.

original: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro rnam pa lngar snang ba khams gsum du rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro rnam pa lngar snang ba khams gsum du rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba yin no //
translated: The various appearances of the three realms‚Äîthe five types of happy and bad migrations‚Äîappear in various ways.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'byed pa rnams ma rig pa las byung ba ni sems rgyu gcig nyid las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'byed pa rnams ma rig pa las byung ba ni sems rgyu gcig nyid las byung ba yin te /
translated: The distinctions of the aggregates, constituents, sense spheres, and so on arise from ignorance, which arises from the single cause of the mind.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa sa bcu pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa sa bcu pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in the noble S≈´tra on the Ten Grounds:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúO children of the Victorious Ones, this three-realm world is merely mind.‚Äù

original: khams gsum du skyes pa'i chos thams cad la bde ba dang / dbyibs dang / brjod pa med pa dang / 'gro ba'i khyad par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum du skyes pa'i chos thams cad la bde ba dang / dbyibs dang / brjod pa med pa dang / 'gro ba'i khyad par yang snang ngo //
translated: All the phenomena that arise in the three realms appear as pleasure, as shape, as inexpressible, and as the particularities of beings.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa yul la mngon par 'dzin par rab tu 'jug pa'i khyad par rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i bye brag dang / rnam par byang ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge bar yang snang ngo zhes bya ba la khams gsum du skyes ba'i chos thams cad kyi khyad par snang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa yul la mngon par 'dzin par rab tu 'jug pa'i khyad par rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i bye brag dang / rnam par byang ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge bar yang snang ngo zhes bya ba la khams gsum du skyes ba'i chos thams cad kyi khyad par snang ngo //
translated: The consciousness that has the same characteristic appears as the particularities of the phenomena that arise in the three realms, as the distinctions of superior, middling, and inferior, and as the distinctions of purification, virtue, and nonvirtue.

original: bde bar 'byed pa dang / dbyibs su 'byed pa ni khams gnyis su ste 'dod pa'i bde ba 'dod pa'i khams so //üîΩbsam @24a * //
analyzed: bde bar 'byed pa dang / dbyibs su 'byed pa ni khams gnyis su ste 'dod pa'i bde ba 'dod pa'i khams so // bsam @24a * //
translated: The distinction of pleasure and the distinction of shape are in two realms, the desire realm and the form realm.üîΩThe distinction of pleasure is in the desire realm.

original: gtan gyi bde ba ni gzugs kyi khams su ste /
analyzed: gtan gyi bde ba ni gzugs kyi khams su ste /
translated: The distinction of shape is in the form realm.

original: lus kyi'o // de bas na khams gnyis ga ni bde bar 'byed pa dang dbyibs kyis 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi'o // de bas na khams gnyis ga ni bde bar 'byed pa dang dbyibs kyis 'byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, both realms are distinguished by pleasure and shape.

original: bsam gtan gyi bar du ni yid kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bar du ni yid kyi yang ngo //
translated: up to the meditative absorptions are also of the mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The first meditative absorption is associated with discursive thought and also with examination.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second meditative absorption is without discursive thought and also without examination.

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth meditative absorptions are associated with joy and also without joy.

original: brjod pa med pa'i khyad par snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'brel te /
analyzed: brjod pa med pa'i khyad par snang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'brel te /
translated: The appearance of the difference of the inexpressible is connected with the realms of form and the formless.

original: gzugs kyi khams su ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa brjod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa brjod pa med pa'o //
translated: In the realm of form, the second meditative absorption, etc., are inexpressible.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni gang na 'du shes med pa de yang brjod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni gang na 'du shes med pa de yang brjod pa med pa'o //
translated: In the formless realm, the state of nondiscernment is also inexpressible.

original: bsam gtan zhes khyad par ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes khyad par ro //
translated: The meditative absorptions are distinguished in this way.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa tsam gyis yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa tsam gyis yin te /
translated: Consciousness of the same characteristic is due to mere conceptualization.

original: khyad par 'di ni rkyen gyi khyad par las so //
analyzed: khyad par 'di ni rkyen gyi khyad par las so //
translated: This distinction is due to the difference of conditions.

original: rnal 'byor can rnal 'byor sgom pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi lam la yang so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par snang na zhes bya ba ni chud pa skad cig pa'i rgyun rab tu 'jug pa rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad par
analyzed: rnal 'byor can rnal 'byor sgom pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi lam la yang so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par snang na zhes bya ba ni chud pa skad cig pa'i rgyun rab tu 'jug pa rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad par
translated: If the yogis who cultivate the path of yoga see the special characteristics of the individual self-cognizers, then the continuum of moments of the yogis who are engaged in the path of yoga would be different in terms of their individual characteristics.

original: dbyer med kyang rnal 'byor goms par byed pa snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa de dag la dbye ba yod na so so'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i chos dang chos med pa'i khyad par lta ci'i phyir med de yod do zhes so //
analyzed: dbyer med kyang rnal 'byor goms par byed pa snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa de dag la dbye ba yod na so so'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i chos dang chos med pa'i khyad par lta ci'i phyir med de yod do zhes so //
translated: If there were a difference in the yogis who are engaged in the path of yoga, then how could there not be a difference in terms of the phenomena and non-phenomena that arise from individual conceptual thoughts? There would be.

original: chos dang chos med pa'i tha dad pa'i bye brag ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos dang chos med pa'i tha dad pa'i bye brag ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir te /
translated: The difference between phenomena and non-phenomena is due to the aspect of duality.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa snang bzhin par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs nas langka'i bdag po chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa snang bzhin par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs nas langka'i bdag po chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Omniscient One, considering the appearance of form, sound, etc., said to the Lord of Lanka: ‚ÄúThere is a difference between dharma and nondharma.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One taught the difference in causes:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the characteristic of conceptualization.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par rtog pas khong du chud par bya ba 'di yod pas 'dir 'gyur ro zhes rnam par shes pa'i rtog pas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par rtog pas khong du chud par bya ba 'di yod pas 'dir 'gyur ro zhes rnam par shes pa'i rtog pas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because of the existence of the cause-effect relationship that is to be understood through conceptualization, it is established by the conceptualization of consciousness that thinks, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: gang yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa de @24b ni mi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa de @24b ni mi gnyis pa ste /
translated: Whatever is a specific characteristic is nondual.

original: der 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi la rig pa po dang / rig par bya ba'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i snang bar 'byed pa med do //
analyzed: der 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi la rig pa po dang / rig par bya ba'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i snang bar 'byed pa med do //
translated: There is no appearance of the past, future, and present in the differentiation of the appearance of the thing to be known and the knower.

original: de la rang gi rig pas bdag nyid la bya ba med la /
analyzed: de la rang gi rig pas bdag nyid la bya ba med la /
translated: In that, there is no activity of self-awareness toward itself.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin la sems kyang rgyu ba med na yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin la sems kyang rgyu ba med na yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos te /
translated: If the mind does not move in the nature of the self, how much less so do letters and sounds.

original: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the non-dual thought of ultimate truth.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa rnams ni skye bo rnams dang / rnal 'byor can rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa rnams ni skye bo rnams dang / rnal 'byor can rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The cognitions with and without discursive thought exist for the people and the yogis.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni me dang dud pa la sogs par snang ba gnyis kyi rnam pa can de de ma thag pa tsam gyis so sor snang ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni me dang dud pa la sogs par snang ba gnyis kyi rnam pa can de de ma thag pa tsam gyis so sor snang ste /
translated: The cognitions of the eye, etc. have the appearance of two, such as fire and smoke, and they appear separately by mere immediate succession.

original: btags pa mngon par mi shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa des ni tha snyad med de /
analyzed: btags pa mngon par mi shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa des ni tha snyad med de /
translated: The non-discursive cognition of one who does not understand the designation has no convention.

original: nges par zhugs pa dbang po'i shes pa rang gi rig pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nges par zhugs pa dbang po'i shes pa rang gi rig pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The cognition of the sense faculty of one who has entered certainty is indeed self-awareness.

original: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: However, it is non-discursive.

original: de bas na skye bo dang rnal 'byor pa rnams la chud pa mang du 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skye bo dang rnal 'byor pa rnams la chud pa mang du 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the distinction of the many for the people and the yogis.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes gnyis su med mod kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes gnyis su med mod kyi /
translated: The wisdom of the Buddhists is nondual.

original: 'on kyang chud pa 'byed pa las chos dang chos med par 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang chud pa 'byed pa las chos dang chos med par 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, in the case of the non-Buddhists, the distinction between the existent and the nonexistent is not made.

original: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs par smra ba rnams kyi chud pa la khyad par med pas na chos dang chos med pa yang mi 'byed de /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs par smra ba rnams kyi chud pa la khyad par med pas na chos dang chos med pa yang mi 'byed de /
translated: Since there is no distinction in the consciousness of the non-Buddhists, such as the Brahmins, the Advaitins, and so on, the distinction between the existent and the nonexistent is not made.

original: grol ba dang ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol ba dang ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The faults of being the same as the liberated and the non-liberated, the rich and the poor, and so on, would ensue.

original: de la mu stegs can mi gnyis pa rnams la ni 'bod 'grogs kyis rgol ba rung ste /
analyzed: de la mu stegs can mi gnyis pa rnams la ni 'bod 'grogs kyis rgol ba rung ste /
translated: In that case, it is suitable to debate with the non-Buddhists, the Advaitins, and so on, by calling them ‚Äúyou.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi shes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par gyi mthu las chos dang chos ma yin pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi shes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par gyi mthu las chos dang chos ma yin pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness of the Buddhists becomes distinguished as existent and nonexistent due to the power of the special conditions of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mindstreams.

original: langka'i bdag po de la chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po de la chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúO Lord of La·πÖkƒÅ, what are phenomena?‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pas rnam par brtags pa rgyu las yon tan dang / rdzas kyi gzhi btsugs pa ni chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pas rnam par brtags pa rgyu las yon tan dang / rdzas kyi gzhi btsugs pa ni chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The so-called phenomena are the qualities and substances that are imputed by the conceptual thoughts of tƒ´rthikas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and fools, and that are established as bases of qualities and substances.

original: de dag ni spang bar bya ba gtang bar bya ba ste /üîΩmtshan nyid du so sor rnam par brtag par mi bya ba ni rang gi sems snang ba'i chos nyid la med pa yin te zhes bya bas chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag dang spong ba yang thams cad mkhyen @25a * //
analyzed: de dag ni spang bar bya ba gtang bar bya ba ste / mtshan nyid du so sor rnam par brtag par mi bya ba ni rang gi sems snang ba'i chos nyid la med pa yin te zhes bya bas chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag dang spong ba yang thams cad mkhyen @25a * //
translated: They are to be abandoned and given up.üîΩThe characteristics are not to be individually investigated. They do not exist in the reality that is the appearance of one‚Äôs mind.

original: pas gsungs ngo //
analyzed: pas gsungs ngo //
translated: The Omniscient One has said that phenomena and non-phenomena are different, and that they are to be abandoned.

original: ji ltar mu stegs can khyad par can la sogs pa rtog pa ni rdul phra mo'i rdzas la yan lag can gnas te /
analyzed: ji ltar mu stegs can khyad par can la sogs pa rtog pa ni rdul phra mo'i rdzas la yan lag can gnas te /
translated: The specific assertions of the tƒ´rthikas, such as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, are that the substances of the subtle particles are the bases of the parts.

original: de bzhin du yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / 'brel ba ste /
translated: Similarly, they assert qualities, actions, universals, and relationships.

original: de dag kyang chos dang chos can du 'byed par brtags pa ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos dang chos can du 'byed par brtags pa ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: And the distinction between the property and the property-possessor should be abandoned when it is imagined.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
translated: The atom is not a part.üîΩIf external things do not exist as they are imagined through the characteristics, what appears?

original: zhes bya'o // 'o na de ltar mtshan nyid du brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi med na ci zhig snang zhes glengs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pas lan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'o na de ltar mtshan nyid du brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi med na ci zhig snang zhes glengs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pas lan du gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One answers:

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i chos rnams la med ces so //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i chos rnams la med ces so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe things that appear in one‚Äôs own mind do not exist.‚Äù

original: chos rnams ni rang gi sems la snang ba nyid de rab rib tu snang ba dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa ma gtogs par chud par bya ba'i phyi rol gyi med do //
analyzed: chos rnams ni rang gi sems la snang ba nyid de rab rib tu snang ba dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa ma gtogs par chud par bya ba'i phyi rol gyi med do //
translated: Things appear in one‚Äôs own mind, like the appearance of floaters, a reflection, a dream, a magical creation, etc. Apart from that, there is no external object that is the basis of the appearance.

original: de de ltar na grangs can dang / ne ya yi ka dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dang / khyad par can la sogs pa smra ba po rnams kyi phyi'i don mi rigs te /
analyzed: de de ltar na grangs can dang / ne ya yi ka dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dang / khyad par can la sogs pa smra ba po rnams kyi phyi'i don mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, external objects are not tenable for the proponents of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the NaiyƒÅyika, the Vai≈õe·π£ika, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka, the LokƒÅyata, the Vai≈õe·π£i-ka, and so on.

original: gang sngon po la sogs pa so so'i snang ba'i shes pa de ni rang gi dngos po 'dzin pa rab rib can la sogs ba'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang sngon po la sogs pa so so'i snang ba'i shes pa de ni rang gi dngos po 'dzin pa rab rib can la sogs ba'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: The cognition that individually perceives blue and so on apprehends its own entity, like the appearance of floaters and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi char rnam par dbye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi char rnam par dbye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong ngo //
translated: When gross external objects are divided into directional parts, they are empty, like houses, armies, forests, and so on.

original: rdza ma la sogs pa'i chos byis pas kun brtags pa lus la ma reg pa rnams zhes pa rnam par phye ba na stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdza ma la sogs pa'i chos byis pas kun brtags pa lus la ma reg pa rnams zhes pa rnam par phye ba na stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: When phenomena such as pots imputed by children are divided into parts that do not touch the body, they become empty.

original: rdul phra mo rnams kyang phyogs kyi cha tha dad par dbye ba na stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdul phra mo rnams kyang phyogs kyi cha tha dad par dbye ba na stong pa nyid do //
translated: When subtle particles are divided into directional parts, they are also empty.

original: de lta bur lhag mthong gis rab tu mthong nas spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bur lhag mthong gis rab tu mthong nas spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having seen that in that way with insight, one abandons them.

original: so sor snang du zin kyang rab rib kyi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du shes rab kyis mi dmigs so //
analyzed: so sor snang du zin kyang rab rib kyi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du shes rab kyis mi dmigs so //
translated: Even though they appear individually, one does not perceive them with wisdom, like forms in a cataract, a reflection, a dream, a magical creation, and so on.

original: des na chos sbom po dang phra mo byis pas kun brtags pa de dag shes rab nyid kyis spangs te /
analyzed: des na chos sbom po dang phra mo byis pas kun brtags pa de dag shes rab nyid kyis spangs te /
translated: Therefore, one abandons with wisdom itself the coarse and subtle phenomena imagined by the childish.

original: mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not grasp them.

original: de la chos med pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos med pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the non-existent phenomena?

original: gang de dag bdag nyid du ma red pa yin te /
analyzed: gang de dag bdag nyid du ma red pa yin te /
translated: They are those that are not established as themselves.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa'i chos don gyi rgyu las 'byung ba de dag gang yang dag pa @25b pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin par 'jug pa med par mthong nas de'i phyir chos med pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la bdag nyid du ma red pa mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag la rang gi
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa'i chos don gyi rgyu las 'byung ba de dag gang yang dag pa @25b pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin par 'jug pa med par mthong nas de'i phyir chos med pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la bdag nyid du ma red pa mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag la rang gi
translated: The meaning of the Dharma arises from the cause of the Dharma, which is the non-wandering of conceptual thoughts about characteristics. When one sees that it is neither correct nor incorrect, one abandons the non-existent Dharma.

original: mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du so sor snang ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du so sor snang ba yang med pa'o //
translated: The non-wandering of conceptual thoughts about characteristics means that there are no phenomena that appear individually as if they had their own characteristics, like form and so forth.

original: de dag gi don ni rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Their meaning is the conceptual thoughts of permanence, self, and so forth.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba ni rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba ni rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba med pa'o //
translated: The non-wandering of conceptual thoughts arises from the cause of that.

original: yang dag pa las ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par so sor snang ba las ma byung bas na byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa las ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par so sor snang ba las ma byung bas na byung ba med pa'o //
translated: Not arising from the correct means not arising from the correct individual appearance.

original: de dag 'jug pa med par mthong nas chos med pa spong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de bas na /
analyzed: de dag 'jug pa med par mthong nas chos med pa spong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de bas na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ji ltar byis pa rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnam rtog pa //
translated: As the childish conceive,

original: de ltar dngos po yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ste /üîΩrtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang bar phyi'i dngos por bskyed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po yod ma yin // zhes bya ste / rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang bar phyi'i dngos por bskyed pa rnams so //
translated: so things do not exist.

original: de dag mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong par yongs su shes pas chos med pa log pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong par yongs su shes pas chos med pa log pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The things that are produced as external entities of permanence, self, pleasure, and purity are known as impermanent, selfless, suffering, and empty. By knowing them thus, one abandons the non-existence of phenomena, which is characterized by wrong knowledge.

original: yang bdag nyid du ma red pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang bdag nyid du ma red pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: Again, what are the phenomena that are not established as self?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: ri bong dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dang / rta'i rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: ri bong dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dang / rta'i rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The phenomena of the rabbit, camel, donkey, horse's horn, barren woman's child, and so forth.

original: bdag nyid du ma red pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de dag ma skyes pas na so sor snang ba yang med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid du ma red pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de dag ma skyes pas na so sor snang ba yang med pa ste /
translated: Because they are not established as selves. Since horns of a rabbit and so on are not produced, they do not appear individually.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa tsam du phyi rol gyi nges pa lta bur ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa tsam du phyi rol gyi nges pa lta bur ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The dependent nature, which is like an external object, is merely the aspect of the apprehended and apprehender, and is not produced as the nature of external objects that arise and disintegrate like dreams, illusions, and floaters.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de dag sgra'i don tsam nyid de /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de dag sgra'i don tsam nyid de /
translated: Those horns of a rabbit and so on are merely the referents of words.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
