analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
translated: As Master Dharmottara says:

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags 'byung //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags 'byung //
translated: Arising from beginningless latent propensities,

original: rnam par rtog las mthar phyin pa ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog las mthar phyin pa ;
translated: they are perfected from conceptuality.

original: / sgra yi don te chos rnam gsum //
analyzed: / sgra yi don te chos rnam gsum //
translated: They are the referents of words, the three phenomena,

original: dngos po dngos min gnyis ka'i gnas //
analyzed: dngos po dngos min gnyis ka'i gnas //
translated: the basis of both things and nonthings.

original: zhes pa'o // bum pa la sogs pa ltar ji ltar de dag rnam par shes pas mi bzung ba'i phyir spang bar bya ba de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po rnams kyang spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bum pa la sogs pa ltar ji ltar de dag rnam par shes pas mi bzung ba'i phyir spang bar bya ba de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po rnams kyang spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Just as pots and so on are to be abandoned because they are not apprehended by consciousness, so too are conceptual things to be abandoned.

original: de'i phyir @26a * //üîΩchos dang chos med pa rnams spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang na don gyi bya ba byed pa bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba yang shes rab kyis rnam par phye ba ni stong pas spong bar 'gyur na ri bong gi rva la
analyzed: de'i phyir @26a * // chos dang chos med pa rnams spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang na don gyi bya ba byed pa bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba yang shes rab kyis rnam par phye ba ni stong pas spong bar 'gyur na ri bong gi rva la
translated: Therefore,üîΩthe existence and nonexistence of things are to be abandoned.

original: sogs pa ma skyes pa dang / snang ba med pa'i chos med pa rnams der spong bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa ma skyes pa dang / snang ba med pa'i chos med pa rnams der spong bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If the appearance of manifest objects such as pots that perform a function are to be abandoned by discerning emptiness with wisdom, then what need is there to mention that non-arisen things such as the horns of a rabbit and non-existent things that do not appear are to be abandoned?

original: spong bar cher sla ba ni mi bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spong bar cher sla ba ni mi bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is much easier to abandon them, since they are not apprehended at all.

original: ji ltar mdo sde nyid du gsungs pa /üîΩyod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde nyid du gsungs pa / yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
translated: As it is said in the s≈´tras:üîΩNonexistence is implied by existence,

original: yod pa'ang med pa'i zla drangs so //
analyzed: yod pa'ang med pa'i zla drangs so //
translated: and existence is implied by nonexistence.

original: de bas med par shes mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med par shes mi bya //
translated: Therefore, one should not understand it as nonexistent.

original: yod par yang ni mi rtag go //üîΩlang ka'i bdag po khyod kyis chos dang chos med pa gnyis ji lta bur spang bar bya zhes smras pa de ni 'di ltar bshad do zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas chos dang chos med pa snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med par dbye bas ji ltar 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: yod par yang ni mi rtag go // lang ka'i bdag po khyod kyis chos dang chos med pa gnyis ji lta bur spang bar bya zhes smras pa de ni 'di ltar bshad do zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas chos dang chos med pa snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med par dbye bas ji ltar 'byed pa dang /
translated: Nor should one understand it as existent.üîΩO Lord of Lanka, as for what you said, How should one abandon both dharma and nondharma? it is explained like this.

original: shes rab kyis bzung du med pa'i phyir ji ltar spangs pa de yang gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis bzung du med pa'i phyir ji ltar spangs pa de yang gsungs so //
translated: The Omniscient One has also explained how to abandon dharma and nondharma by distinguishing them as having appearance and not having appearance, and how they are not apprehended by wisdom.

original: gang yang lang ka'i bdag po khyod kyis sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yang bdag gis dris te de dag gis kyang lan blan no zhes smras pa yang lang ka'i bdag po sngon zhes bya ba 'di
analyzed: gang yang lang ka'i bdag po khyod kyis sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yang bdag gis dris te de dag gis kyang lan blan no zhes smras pa yang lang ka'i bdag po sngon zhes bya ba 'di
translated: Moreover, O Lord of Lanka, as for what you said, I have also asked the past Tathagatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones, and they have also given answers, O Lord of Lanka, the past is...

original: ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshig bla dags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar du yang rnam par rtog pa snang bar 'byed pa rnams kyis chos dang chos med par byed do //
analyzed: ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshig bla dags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar du yang rnam par rtog pa snang bar 'byed pa rnams kyis chos dang chos med par byed do //
translated: The phrase the words of conceptualization and so forth means that the past, future, and present are conceptualized and differentiated as existent and nonexistent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni de'i chos nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang gis rig pa la bzhugs pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni de'i chos nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang gis rig pa la bzhugs pas ni /
translated: The phrase the TathƒÅgatas are non-conceptual by the nature of that means that they abide in the non-dual ultimate truth, which is inconceivable and non-apparent, by means of their own awareness.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: [They are] non-conceptual.

original: snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul bas snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang pos gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis skye bo mgu bar mdzad pa'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul bas snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang pos gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis skye bo mgu bar mdzad pa'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: However, due to being urged by the latent tendencies of compassion, the Lord of Yogins, with omniscience, teaches the Dharma through various forms of magical emanations in order to please beings with apparent samƒÅdhi.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gnyis su med pa'i rtogs pa don dam pa'i bden pa la yang dag par bzhugs pas @26b dngos po dang dngos
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gnyis su med pa'i rtogs pa don dam pa'i bden pa la yang dag par bzhugs pas @26b dngos po dang dngos
translated: ‚ÄúBeyond all conceptual elaborations‚Äù means that the transcendent state of the nondual, naturally luminous tathƒÅgatas, the transcendent conquerors, is truly present in ultimate truth.üîΩ

original: po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med cing spros pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med cing spros pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúBeyond all conceptual elaborations‚Äù means that the transcendent, ultimate truth is the nondual realization of the natural luminosity of the tathƒÅgatas, the transcendent conquerors. Therefore, they are free from the elaborations of conceptual thoughts of things and nonthings.

original: ji ltar dbu mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu mar gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka scriptures:

original: spros las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
analyzed: spros las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
translated: Beyond elaborations, nondual,

original: gang dag sangs rgyas spros par byed //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas spros par byed //
translated: Those who elaborate the Buddha

original: de dag spros nyams glen pa rnams //
analyzed: de dag spros nyams glen pa rnams //
translated: Are impaired by elaborations, the ignorant ones

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: Do not see the TathƒÅgata.

original: gang dag yod par mthong ba rnams //
analyzed: gang dag yod par mthong ba rnams //
translated: Those who see existence

original: dngos po rnams kyang med mthong ba //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyang med mthong ba //
translated: Also see nonexistence.

original: nyer zhi zhi ba blta bya ba //
analyzed: nyer zhi zhi ba blta bya ba //
translated: The pacified, the peaceful, should be seen,

original: blo chung rnams kyis mi mthong ngo //üîΩspros pa med cing snang ba med //
analyzed: blo chung rnams kyis mi mthong ngo // spros pa med cing snang ba med //
translated: But not by the small-minded.üîΩWithout elaborations, without appearances,

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: Not elaborated by elaborations,

original: 'di ni 'jig rten mgon po dag / sangs rgyas bstan pa bdud rtsi yis //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten mgon po dag / sangs rgyas bstan pa bdud rtsi yis //
translated: That the Buddha's teaching is the nectar of immortality.

original: stong pa zhes byar smra bya min //
analyzed: stong pa zhes byar smra bya min //
translated: It is not to be called empty,

original: mi stong zhes par 'gyur ba'ang min //
analyzed: mi stong zhes par 'gyur ba'ang min //
translated: Nor is it to be called non-empty.üîΩIt is not to be called both,

original: gnyis dang mi gnyis shes pa yang //
analyzed: gnyis dang mi gnyis shes pa yang //
translated: Nor is it to be called neither.üîΩWhat is the limit of nirvana?

original: rnam zhi zhi la ga la zhig / mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //üîΩ'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa //üîΩde gnyis par na cung zad kyang //
analyzed: rnam zhi zhi la ga la zhig / mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin // 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa // de gnyis par na cung zad kyang //
translated: What is the limit of samsara?üîΩThere is not the slightest difference

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod pa min //üîΩlen med nga ni mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod pa min // len med nga ni mya ngan 'da' //
translated: Between the two, even in the most subtle way.üîΩI will attain nirvana without grasping;

original: mya ngan 'da' bang yir 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bang yir 'gyur //
translated: Nirvana is not to be grasped.

original: de ltar gang 'dzin de dag ni //
analyzed: de ltar gang 'dzin de dag ni //
translated: Those who grasp it in this way

original: len pa legs min 'dzin pa'o //üîΩmya ngan 'da' ba'i rnam rtog med //
analyzed: len pa legs min 'dzin pa'o // mya ngan 'da' ba'i rnam rtog med //
translated: Grasp it wrongly.üîΩNirvana is free from conceptualization;

original: 'khor ba bsal ba ma yin te //
analyzed: 'khor ba bsal ba ma yin te //
translated: Samsara is not to be removed.

original: gang 'khor mya ngan 'das ba der //
analyzed: gang 'khor mya ngan 'das ba der //
translated: If samsara is nirvana,

original: su zhig rnam par rtog par par bya //
analyzed: su zhig rnam par rtog par par bya //
translated: What is there to conceptualize?

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de de ltar dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa 'phros pa med pa'i rtogs pa nyid thar pa ste /
analyzed: de de ltar dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa 'phros pa med pa'i rtogs pa nyid thar pa ste /
translated: That realization, which is free from the proliferation of the conceptualization of entities and non-entities, is liberation.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Seven Hundred Lines:

original: 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: This itself is nirvana.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mi sems pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: mi sems pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: It is non-mentation.üîΩIt is not like the investigation of the intrinsic reality of form, etc.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid la brtags pa ltar ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gcig dang / sbom po dang / che ba dang / gzugs can dang / reg pa can dang / rdul phra mo las brtsams pa'i yan lag can zhes par rnam par mi brtag go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid la brtags pa ltar ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gcig dang / sbom po dang / che ba dang / gzugs can dang / reg pa can dang / rdul phra mo las brtsams pa'i yan lag can zhes par rnam par mi brtag go //
translated: It is not investigated as one, many, gross, subtle, having form, having contact, or as having parts beginning with atoms.

original: gzhan du na ye shes thugs su chud pa bde ba'i don du mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: gzhan du na ye shes thugs su chud pa bde ba'i don du mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: Otherwise, one should cultivate it with the wisdom that practices signlessness for the sake of the happiness of the realization of gnosis.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe sbom pa dang phra ba'i mtshan ma shes rab kyis gzhigs pa na de'i tshe sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa la gnas @27a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe sbom pa dang phra ba'i mtshan ma shes rab kyis gzhigs pa na de'i tshe sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa la gnas @27a * //
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgatas are said to have the nature of wisdom.

original: pas gzigs kyang mi gzigs so //
analyzed: pas gzigs kyang mi gzigs so //
translated: When gross and subtle signs are destroyed by wisdom, then, abiding in the liberation of illusion, they see but do not see.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgatas, having the nature of wisdom, abide in the pure worldly meditative absorption,

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi yul du rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi yul du rnam par phye ste /
translated: and, having distinguished their objects of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity,

original: snod dang snod ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la mos pa ji bzhin du chos bshad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: snod dang snod ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la mos pa ji bzhin du chos bshad pa mdzad do //
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings, suitable or unsuitable, according to their aspirations.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni mi snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las bzhengs nas snang ba dang bcas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po bde bar gshegs pa gtogs 'dod dang / tshangs pa dang lha chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i chos rnams kyi bye brag ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni mi snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las bzhengs nas snang ba dang bcas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po bde bar gshegs pa gtogs 'dod dang / tshangs pa dang lha chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i chos rnams kyi bye brag ston par mdzad do //
translated: The body of intuition, having risen from the object of the concentration of invisibility, and having appearance, by the concentration of omniscience, the lord of the yoga of various forms, the Sugata, in the form of Brahma, Mahadeva, and so on, teaches the distinctions of the dharmas that are dual and non-dual.

original: gang gis mi rtag ce na /
analyzed: gang gis mi rtag ce na /
translated: By what is it impermanent?

original: yid kyi bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúby the self of mind, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag dang srog la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis mi rtag ste /
analyzed: bdag dang srog la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis mi rtag ste /
translated: It is impermanent by the conceptualizations of self, life, and so on.

original: yid kyis so //
analyzed: yid kyis so //
translated: It is by the mind.

original: rtag pa'i bdag ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du yod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du yod par mi rigs so //
translated: The permanent self is not reasonable, like the son of a barren woman, because it is not produced.

original: don du yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rnam par mi rtag go //
analyzed: don du yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rnam par mi rtag go //
translated: And in fact, it is not impermanent as the thing that is the object and subject.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang dbyibs dang / rnam pa bzhin zhes bya ba la gzugs ni sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang dbyibs dang / rnam pa bzhin zhes bya ba la gzugs ni sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid pa'o //
translated: The form of the dependent nature is the characteristic of form, its shape, and its appearance.

original: dbyibs ni rim pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: dbyibs ni rim pa'i gzugs te /
translated: The shape of form is its configuration,

original: zlum po dang / gru bzhi la sogs pas phye ba'o //
analyzed: zlum po dang / gru bzhi la sogs pas phye ba'o //
translated: distinguished as round, square, and so on.

original: rnam pa ni 'od dang mun pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'od dang mun pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pa tsam ste /
translated: The appearance of form is the mere appearance of light, darkness, and so on.üîΩAll such appearances are the dependent nature.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //üîΩsnying rje'i bag chags kyis glengs te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo // snying rje'i bag chags kyis glengs te /

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs las byung ba'i rnal 'byor can rnams kyi mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i sku la sogs pa sems can gyi don du snang ba ni ye shes nyid so sor snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs las byung ba'i rnal 'byor can rnams kyi mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i sku la sogs pa sems can gyi don du snang ba ni ye shes nyid so sor snang ba yin no //
translated: The form of the perfected nature is the form that is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones.üîΩThe form of the

original: skye bo rnams kyi yang bdag dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud kyi bdag rkyen gyi khyad par gyis 'khrug pa mnyam par ma 'dus pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa rnam par shes pa'i so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: skye bo rnams kyi yang bdag dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud kyi bdag rkyen gyi khyad par gyis 'khrug pa mnyam par ma 'dus pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa rnam par shes pa'i so sor snang ngo //
translated: For people, too, the various forms of consciousness appear individually due to the power of karma and the ripening of karma, and due to the specific dominant conditions in the mind streams of self and others.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du mchog tu yongs su dag pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i thams @27b cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mnga' bas rab tu sgrub par mdzad pas brtags pa ni rang bzhin gyis dngos po thams cadüîΩma skyes te /üîΩgzhan dbang la ni brten nas ni //üîΩmi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //üîΩrnam par rtog pas rnam spangs shing //üîΩgang tshe gzhan dbang dag pa ni //üîΩrdzogs pa de bzhin nyid ces bya //üîΩmdo sde mdo sder ngas smras so //

original: zhes so // kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pas brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang dngos su grub pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pas de ltar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes so // kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pas brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang dngos su grub pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pas de ltar bstan to //
translated: Thus, the imagined, the other-dependent, and the perfected are taught by the Omniscient One as the relative and ultimate realities.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni bsdu bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni bsdu bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary says,

original: khyod kyis brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: khyod kyis brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: you should imagine and be free from conceptual discrimination.

original: de 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the same text:

original: dngos po tsam du brtags pa ste //
analyzed: dngos po tsam du brtags pa ste //
translated: The imagined is merely an imputation of entities.

original: rnam par brtags pa khyad par du //üîΩchos nyid rang gi mtshan nyid gang //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa khyad par du // chos nyid rang gi mtshan nyid gang //
translated: The other-dependent is the imagination of the unreal.üîΩThe perfected is the absence of duality.üîΩThe reality of the imagined is the absence of production.üîΩThe reality of the other-dependent is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: chos nyid rang bzhin de nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid rang bzhin de nyid do //
translated: The reality of the perfected is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: brtags pa ni brjod pa tsam ste /
analyzed: brtags pa ni brjod pa tsam ste /
translated: The imagined is mere verbal expression.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can dang / rdzas la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur bar dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can dang / rdzas la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur bar dgongs par brtag go //
translated: It should be imagined as the appearance of the eternal, the self, the subtle particle, the whole, substance, and so on.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The other-dependent is the imagination of the unreal.

original: gzhan gyi dbang don gyi byed pa gsal bar nus pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos por brtag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang don gyi byed pa gsal bar nus pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos por brtag go //
translated: The other-dependent is the apprehending of the capacity to manifest the function of objects, and is imagined to be the entity of the apprehended.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yongs su grub pa pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par rang gi rig pa'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas thugs la dgongs par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yongs su grub pa pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par rang gi rig pa'i chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas thugs la dgongs par rjes su dpag go //
translated: The consummate is the ultimate truth, which is nondual, the nature of the intrinsic awareness of reality, and is inferred to be the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yang rgyu'i don du gsungs pa /üîΩlang ka'i bdag po 'di ltar yang sems can gyi spyod pa rnams ni rtsig pa'i ri mo'i gzugs dang 'dra ste zhes pa ni lus dang ngag gi spyod pa tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid ni so sor snang ba tsam ste gang dag gis rgyud gzhan par rjes su
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yang rgyu'i don du gsungs pa / lang ka'i bdag po 'di ltar yang sems can gyi spyod pa rnams ni rtsig pa'i ri mo'i gzugs dang 'dra ste zhes pa ni lus dang ngag gi spyod pa tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid ni so sor snang ba tsam ste gang dag gis rgyud gzhan par rjes su
translated: The Omniscient One is also stated to be the cause:

original: dpag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpag par byed pa'o //
translated: O Lord of Lanka, the conduct of sentient beings is like the forms in a wall painting. The conventional characteristics of the conduct of body and speech are merely individual appearances, by which the conduct of others is inferred.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
translated: As Master Dharmika Kirti said:üîΩFirst, the mind is made in one's own body,

original: thog mar blo byed bdag lus dang // mthong nas gzhan du de gzung phyir //
analyzed: thog mar blo byed bdag lus dang // mthong nas gzhan du de gzung phyir //
translated: And having seen, it is grasped elsewhere.

original: blo zhes gal te shes gyur nas //
analyzed: blo zhes gal te shes gyur nas //
translated: If one understands the mind,

original: sems tsam tshul dang de mtshungs so //
analyzed: sems tsam tshul dang de mtshungs so //
translated: it is the same as the method of mind-only.üîΩSince there are no external objects, the appearance of bodies, etc.

original: phyi'i don med pas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las lus la sogs pa snang ba so sor snang @28a * //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las lus la sogs pa snang ba so sor snang @28a * //
translated: from one's own and others' continuums appears separately.üîΩEven in dreams, bodies, etc. appear separately by the power of gods, ghosts,

original: ngo ; / rmi lam du yang lha dang 'dre sha za la sogs pa'i dbang gi stobs las lus la sogs pa tha dad par snang ba snang ngo //
analyzed: ngo ; / rmi lam du yang lha dang 'dre sha za la sogs pa'i dbang gi stobs las lus la sogs pa tha dad par snang ba snang ngo //
translated: pi≈õƒÅcas, etc.

original: shin tu gtan la phab pa'i 'bras bus rgyu la slu bar mi byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu gtan la phab pa'i 'bras bus rgyu la slu bar mi byed ces bya ste /
translated: The result of complete ascertainment is called not deceiving with respect to the cause.

original: de bas na rab rib dang mda' la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gsal bar snang yang nams kyang gzhan gyi blo bar rjes su mi dpag go //
analyzed: de bas na rab rib dang mda' la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gsal bar snang yang nams kyang gzhan gyi blo bar rjes su mi dpag go //
translated: Therefore, even though the result of cataracts, arrows, etc. appear clearly, one never infers the other's mind.

original: don yang rgyu tsam ma yin gyi snang ba'i khyad par yang ngo //
analyzed: don yang rgyu tsam ma yin gyi snang ba'i khyad par yang ngo //
translated: The object is not just the cause, but also the special appearance.

original: lang ka'i bdag po 'jig rten gnas pa ni /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po 'jig rten gnas pa ni /
translated: The Lord of La·πÖkƒÅ said, The abiding of the worldüîΩis unmoving.

original: g-yo ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni su gang na snang ba de de nyid du 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni su gang na snang ba de de nyid du 'gag pa ste /
translated: That which appears there ceases right there.

original: de nyid kyi skad cig par ni yul gzhan nam dus gzhan du 'pho ba med pa ni skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi skad cig par ni yul gzhan nam dus gzhan du 'pho ba med pa ni skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not move to another place or time, because it is momentary.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas de nyid du rgyu gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas de nyid du rgyu gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has stated another reason for this:

original: las dang byed pa las bral ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: las dang byed pa las bral ba zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from action and agent.‚Äù

original: byed pa dang byed pa po la mngon par chags pa ni ji ltar byed pa po rang dbang dang / byed par 'dod pa'i mchog ni las dang / byed pa pos byed pa bya bar brtsams pa ni las zhes bya'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang byed pa po la mngon par chags pa ni ji ltar byed pa po rang dbang dang / byed par 'dod pa'i mchog ni las dang / byed pa pos byed pa bya bar brtsams pa ni las zhes bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Attachment to the agent and action is as follows: The supreme one who desires to act is the agent, and the action that the agent begins to perform is called the action.

original: byed pa po dang las dang byed pa rnams la dbyer med de /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dang byed pa rnams la dbyer med de /
translated: The agent, action, and instrument are not different.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa rnams kyis klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa rnams kyis klog pa /
translated: As the noble MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghikas recite:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //üîΩmi brtan byed pa gal zhig /'byung ba gang yin byed pa de //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa // mi brtan byed pa gal zhig /'byung ba gang yin byed pa de //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩThe unstable one who acts is the agent.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //üîΩces pa ste /
translated: The arising of that which is to be done is the action.üîΩThat itself is also called the agent.

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams la byed pa po'i tha snyad don dam par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams la byed pa po'i tha snyad don dam par mi rung ngo //
translated: The conventional designation of an agent is not tenable ultimately for either permanent or impermanent things.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sgro btags pa'i tha snyad nyid de /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i tha snyad nyid de /
translated: It is just a superimposition.

original: ji ltar bha dra ha ris smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bha dra ha ris smras pa /
translated: As Bhadrahari said:

original: grub dang ma grub ji snyed pa //
analyzed: grub dang ma grub ji snyed pa //
translated: Whatever is accomplished or not accomplished

original: bsgrub pa'i phyir ni bstan pa ste //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i phyir ni bstan pa ste //
translated: is taught for the sake of accomplishment.

original: brten pa rim gyis gzugs pas na //üîΩde ni byed ces mngon par brjod //
analyzed: brten pa rim gyis gzugs pas na // de ni byed ces mngon par brjod //
translated: Since it is supported in stages,

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: it is called an agent.

original: rgyun la brten pa'i rim gyis rang bzhin ni yan lag gi skad cig pa gcig byed pa dang 'brel ba med de /
analyzed: rgyun la brten pa'i rim gyis rang bzhin ni yan lag gi skad cig pa gcig byed pa dang 'brel ba med de /
translated: The nature that is supported in a continuum is not related to the activity of a single momentary part.

original: de bas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, dependent origination does not occur.

original: skyed pas bskyed pa'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pas bskyed pa'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no arising of arising, which is the producer of the produced.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las gsungs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were produced,

original: mtshan nyid gsum ni der rigs te //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ni der rigs te //
translated: the three characteristics would be reasonable there.

original: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: But if arising is unproduced,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
translated: how could it be a characteristic of the produced?

original: skye ba @28b skye ba ji lta ba //
analyzed: skye ba @28b skye ba ji lta ba //
translated: Just as arising arises,

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin te //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin te //
translated: Not by itself, but from another,

original: 'gog pa la yang 'gog pa ni //
analyzed: 'gog pa la yang 'gog pa ni //
translated: So cessation also ceases,

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not by itself, but from another.

original: der de'i de lta bu'i dbu mar bshad pa rgya cher 'gyur te /
analyzed: der de'i de lta bu'i dbu mar bshad pa rgya cher 'gyur te /
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the middle way in that text.

original: ji ltar sa dang po'i dbang po slob dpon blo gros kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar sa dang po'i dbang po slob dpon blo gros kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As the master Matibhadra says in the first chapter of his commentary on the Abhidharmakosa:üîΩWithout cessation, without arising,üîΩWithout annihilation, without permanence,

original: 'gog med skye ba med pa dang // chad med rtag pa med pa dang // sna tshogs don dang gcig don min //
analyzed: 'gog med skye ba med pa dang // chad med rtag pa med pa dang // sna tshogs don dang gcig don min //
translated: Without diversity, without unity,

original: 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med //
analyzed: 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med //
translated: Without coming, without going,

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel 'byung ba //
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ni //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ni //
translated: As the pacification of fabrication, as peace,

original: yang dag sangs rgyas gsungs gyur pa //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas gsungs gyur pa //
translated: The perfect Buddha,

original: gsung mchog de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsung mchog de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to that supreme speech.

original: zhes bya'o // skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa rnams ni dngos po ma gtogs par yod par mi srid de /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa rnams ni dngos po ma gtogs par yod par mi srid de /
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing are not possible without a thing.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba las dang 'bras bu nges par 'brel bas snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes smos pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba las dang 'bras bu nges par 'brel bas snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes smos pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Since there is a definite connection between action and result in dependent origination, it is said, Because this exists, that comes to be.

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin pa rnams ni don dam par mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin pa rnams ni don dam par mi skye ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the natures that appear as the two aspects due to other-dependence are ultimately unborn.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang rab rib la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang rab rib la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: They are like forms in a dream, a magical creation, or with blurred vision.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig tu zin kyang de la khyad par du gzung ba med de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig tu zin kyang de la khyad par du gzung ba med de /
translated: Although the ultimate truth, which is nondual, is known, there is no apprehension of it as a special object.

original: bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang rig pa po'i dngos por so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang rig pa po'i dngos por so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: There is no conceptual thought that appears as a separate entity, the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: rgyud kyi rgyun la yang las dang byed pa med pa ni ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun la yang las dang byed pa med pa ni ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As for the continuum of the stream, there is no action or agent, as stated in the Diamond Cutter:

original: rab 'byor 'das pa'i sems kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'das pa'i sems kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Subh≈´ti, the past mind is not apprehended.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: The future mind is also not apprehended.

original: da ltar gyi sems kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi sems kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: The present mind is also not apprehended.

original: zhes bya ba la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Here, the past and future do not exist as entities.

original: da ltar gyi yang sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la mi dmigs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi yang sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la mi dmigs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa'o //
translated: The present mind is also not apprehended by that very mind itself. This is the intention of the Blessed One.

original: de bas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba las dang byed pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba las dang byed pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therefore, dependent origination is free from action and agent.

original: chos thams cad yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: All phenomena do not exist.

original: yod pa ni ji lta bur phyi dang nang gi dngos por 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pa gdon mi za bas gdon mi za bar byed pa rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan dang / @29a * //
analyzed: yod pa ni ji lta bur phyi dang nang gi dngos por 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pa gdon mi za bas gdon mi za bar byed pa rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan dang / @29a * //
translated: Here, existence is definitely in the form of the apprehension of external and internal entities, and the apprehended. Therefore, they are like a dream, an illusion, a reflection,

original: rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bas na /
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bas na /
translated: and the nature of eye disease, etc.

original: de lta bur med do //
analyzed: de lta bur med do //
translated: They do not exist in that way.

original: mu stegs can gyi sems can rtag par kun tu brtags pa yang sems can ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi sems can rtag par kun tu brtags pa yang sems can ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The permanent sentient beings imagined by the tƒ´rthikas do not exist, because sentient beings are unborn, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: mig dang rna ba la sogs skye mched rnams kyis kyang ji ltar sems can du gdags par bya ba de lta bur yang sems can med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub pa gsungs pa /üîΩ'di la gang yang nyan pa'am /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba la sogs skye mched rnams kyis kyang ji ltar sems can du gdags par bya ba de lta bur yang sems can med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub pa gsungs pa / 'di la gang yang nyan pa'am /
translated: The omniscient one has said that sentient beings do not exist in the way that they are imputed to exist by the sense bases such as the eyes and ears.üîΩHere there is no one who hears

original: mnyan par bya ba med do //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba med do //
translated: or anything to be heard.

original: lang ka'i bdag po 'jig rten gnas pa ni sprul pa dang mtshungs na mu stegs can byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams rnam par mi bsgom mo zhes pas na /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po 'jig rten gnas pa ni sprul pa dang mtshungs na mu stegs can byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams rnam par mi bsgom mo zhes pas na /
translated: O lord of La·πákƒÅ, the world is like a magical creation, but the tƒ´rthikas, childish yogis, do not meditate on it.

original: nyan pa bos mnyan par bya ba sgra'i yul mnyan du med pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan pa bos mnyan par bya ba sgra'i yul mnyan du med pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who hears and the object to be heard, the object of sound, do not exist, because external objects do not exist, like dreams and so on.

original: 'jig rten sprul pa dang mtshungs pa ni so sor snang ba tsam pas na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten sprul pa dang mtshungs pa ni so sor snang ba tsam pas na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: The world is like an emanation, because it is merely a separate appearance. Therefore, objects such as form are not cognized by the eye consciousness and so on.

original: mu stegs can byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi'i don la mngon par zhen pas don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa mi bsgom mo //
analyzed: mu stegs can byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi'i don la mngon par zhen pas don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa mi bsgom mo //
translated: Even the tƒ´rthikas, childish yogis, are attached to permanence, self, and external objects. Therefore, they do not meditate on the nondual, ultimate truth.

original: lang ka'i bdag po gang gis de ltar mthong ba de ni yang dag par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po gang gis de ltar mthong ba de ni yang dag par mthong ba ste /
translated: Lord of La·πÖkƒÅ, whoever sees in that way sees correctly.

original: rnam pa gzhan du mthong na rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'o /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mthong na rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'o /
translated: If seen in another way, one engages in conceptualization.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dzin te zhes bya ba gang dag rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba so sor snang ba nyid kyis rtag par bdag dang / bdag gir mngon par zhen pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dzin pas ni thams cad mkhyen pas dpes gsal bar bsgrub par mdzad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dzin te zhes bya ba gang dag rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba so sor snang ba nyid kyis rtag par bdag dang / bdag gir mngon par zhen pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dzin pas ni thams cad mkhyen pas dpes gsal bar bsgrub par mdzad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Omniscient One has clarified this with examples, such as:

original: me long gi nang du yod pa'i bdag gi gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan dang / chu la bdag gi lus kyi grib ma dang / zla ba'i 'od dang / khyim na me 'bar ba la bdag gi lus kyi grib ma dang brag ca'am /
analyzed: me long gi nang du yod pa'i bdag gi gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan dang / chu la bdag gi lus kyi grib ma dang / zla ba'i 'od dang / khyim na me 'bar ba la bdag gi lus kyi grib ma dang brag ca'am /
translated: The reflection of one's own form in a mirror, the shadow of one's body in water, the light of the moon, the shadow of one's body in a burning house, an echo,

original: gzhan yang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba rab tu gzung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba rab tu gzung ba ste /
translated: and also the apprehended objects of one's own conceptual thoughts.

original: chos dang chos med pa rnam par rtog cing chos dang chos med pa'i spong ba la mi spyod de /
analyzed: chos dang chos med pa rnam par rtog cing chos dang chos med pa'i spong ba la mi spyod de /
translated: One does not engage in the abandonment of phenomena and non-phenomena by conceptualizing phenomena and non-phenomena.

original: dpyod do // rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: dpyod do // rnam par rtog go //
translated: One analyzes and conceptualizes.

original: @29b rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: @29b rgyas par byed do //
translated: It expands.

original: rab tu zhi ba mi 'thob po zhes te /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba mi 'thob po zhes te /
translated: One does not attain peace.

original: de la me long dang / chu dang / snang ba'i don du yod pa bdag gi gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan ni yod pa dang med ces bya ba bzhin du chos dang chos med par rnam par rtog pa dpyod kyi /
analyzed: de la me long dang / chu dang / snang ba'i don du yod pa bdag gi gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan ni yod pa dang med ces bya ba bzhin du chos dang chos med par rnam par rtog pa dpyod kyi /
translated: There, the reflection of one‚Äôs form exists as the object of a mirror, water, and light. It is like saying, ‚ÄúIt exists and does not exist.‚Äù One analyzes the concepts of dharma and nondharma.

original: yang 'di dang 'di lta bur chos dang chos med pa spong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: yang 'di dang 'di lta bur chos dang chos med pa spong bar mi byed do //
translated: However, one does not abandon this and that dharma and nondharma.üîΩAs it is said:

original: ji ltar / gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar / gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: ‚ÄúForm is analyzed into particles.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa'o //üîΩzhes pa te /
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa'o // zhes pa te /
translated: The particles are partless.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pa ni phyir dngos po med par mtshungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pa ni phyir dngos po med par mtshungs te /
translated: The analysis with wisdom is the same as the external nonexistence of things.

original: ji tsam du gzugs brnyan stong pa nyid pa de bzhin du lus kyi rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'jig rten du chud pa so sor snang ngo zhes bya'o /
analyzed: ji tsam du gzugs brnyan stong pa nyid pa de bzhin du lus kyi rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'jig rten du chud pa so sor snang ngo zhes bya'o /
translated: To the extent that the reflection is emptiness, the world is understood to be the nature of the body, dream, and magical illusion.

original: brag rtsal sogs par 'byed pas sgra thos pa rnam par rtog pa ni sgra de lta bur tha dad par yang gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brag rtsal sogs par 'byed pas sgra thos pa rnam par rtog pa ni sgra de lta bur tha dad par yang gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The hearing of sound is a conceptual thought that is differentiated by the analysis of sound. It is not that there is another sound that is different from that.

original: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa 'ba' zhig yin pas chos dang chos med pa'i rnam par rtog par rab tu mi zhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa 'ba' zhig yin pas chos dang chos med pa'i rnam par rtog par rab tu mi zhi ste /
translated: Since it is only the domain of conceptual thought, the conceptual thought of dharma and nondharma is not pacified.

original: des na de dag gi rnam par rtog pa rnams ni shes pas rab tu zhi ba mi 'thob bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na de dag gi rnam par rtog pa rnams ni shes pas rab tu zhi ba mi 'thob bo zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, their conceptual thoughts do not obtain pacification through knowledge.

original: 'di ni rtse gcig pa'i tshig bla dgas te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtse gcig pa'i tshig bla dgas te zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the state of one-pointedness.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sbom bo dang phra mo mnyam par 'dus pa'i shes rab kyis gzhigs pa na gang yang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe dbang po'i shes pa mi rtog cing snang ba med par rang gi rig pa 'byung ba bzhin du rnal
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sbom bo dang phra mo mnyam par 'dus pa'i shes rab kyis gzhigs pa na gang yang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe dbang po'i shes pa mi rtog cing snang ba med par rang gi rig pa 'byung ba bzhin du rnal
translated: When the coarse and subtle characteristics of form and so on are destroyed by the wisdom of equipoise, if nothing is observed, then the nonconceptual sense consciousness arises as one‚Äôs vidyƒÅ without appearances.

original: 'byor gyi dbang bo mnyam par 'dus pa rnams don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa chud pa'i chos nyid rtse gcig pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor gyi dbang bo mnyam par 'dus pa rnams don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa chud pa'i chos nyid rtse gcig pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The faculties of the rich and the poor are equal in their convergence, abiding in the one-pointed reality that is immersed in the non-dual ultimate truth.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying bor 'jug pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin skye'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying bor 'jug pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin skye'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that samƒÅdhi arises in order to enter the heart of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ste /
translated: All sentient beings are called the heart of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: chud pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chud pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they have the nature of being immersed.

original: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that the tathƒÅgatas arise in all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems rab tu sangs pas sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo thob ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems rab tu sangs pas sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo thob ste /
translated: Since the minds of all sentient beings are completely awakened, they attain the essence of buddhahood.üîΩTherefore, all sentient beings become the omniscient blessed buddhas.

original: des na sems can thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su 'gyur ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor la goms shing bsod nams dang ye @30a * //
analyzed: des na sems can thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su 'gyur ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor la goms shing bsod nams dang ye @30a * //
translated: The appearance and non-appearance samƒÅdhi yogas are cultivated and merit and wisdom are accumulated.

original: shes kyi tshogs mngon bar spel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes kyi tshogs mngon bar spel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the assembly of wisdom is manifestly increased.

original: gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa gang dag kyang rnal 'byor gyi dbang po khyad par bdag la bstod pa byed pa de dag kyang tshud pa tsam sangs bas na tshud pa tsam gyis dbang ston to //
analyzed: gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa gang dag kyang rnal 'byor gyi dbang po khyad par bdag la bstod pa byed pa de dag kyang tshud pa tsam sangs bas na tshud pa tsam gyis dbang ston to //
translated: Those who are included, such as Mahe≈õvara, BrahmƒÅ, and so on, who praise the lord of yogins, are also included. Therefore, they are taught to be included by mere inclusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid kyis sems can gyi don la spyod pas gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par spyod pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid kyis sems can gyi don la spyod pas gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par spyod pa na /
translated: When bodhisattvas, by the nature of phenomena, engage in the welfare of sentient beings, and when they engage in the samƒÅdhi of nonduality,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po 'jug pa'i phyir de dag la ting nge 'dzin skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po 'jug pa'i phyir de dag la ting nge 'dzin skye'o //
translated: the samƒÅdhi arises for them because the essence of the tathƒÅgata enters.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos byas pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos byas pa las /
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter of the treatise Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes, called ‚ÄúThe Thorough Affliction of the Mind.‚Äù

original: le'u dang po sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa thob cing 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rnams la mi rtag pa dang thabs la mkhas pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa gsol ba'i lan bka' stsal pa dang /
analyzed: le'u dang po sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa thob cing 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba rnams la mi rtag pa dang thabs la mkhas pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa gsol ba'i lan bka' stsal pa dang /
translated: Chapter 1: The attainment of the liberation of illusion and the victory over the three worlds, impermanence and skillful means, the practice of the bodhisattvas, and the reply to the question of Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: le'u phran gsum mo /
analyzed: le'u phran gsum mo /
translated: Three short chapters.

original: // / zab mo rgya chen chos rnams nor bu bzhin //
analyzed: // / zab mo rgya chen chos rnams nor bu bzhin //
translated: The profound and vast dharmas are like jewels,

original: rgya mtsho chen po mching las gang rnams 'thob //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po mching las gang rnams 'thob //
translated: Obtained from the great ocean and the vast earth.

original: bsgrub pa gsal ba cis kyang de dag ni //
analyzed: bsgrub pa gsal ba cis kyang de dag ni //
translated: By clearly accomplishing them, they are

original: mkhas pa'i byang chub lam du phyin par byas //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i byang chub lam du phyin par byas //
translated: Brought to the path of enlightenment by the wise.

original: gang yod de kun skad cig pa //
analyzed: gang yod de kun skad cig pa //
translated: All that exists is momentary,

original: glog gi 'khor lo 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: glog gi 'khor lo 'dra ba ste //
translated: Like a wheel of lightning.

original: rmi stong shes dpal bzang tshig gis //
analyzed: rmi stong shes dpal bzang tshig gis //
translated: With the words of the glorious knowledge of empty dreams,

original: bdag gzhan phan tshig dbang mchod gyur //
analyzed: bdag gzhan phan tshig dbang mchod gyur //
translated: I have become a worshipper of self and other.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rgyu ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rgyu ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then the great bodhisattva who roams all buddha realms, called Mahamati, and so forth,

original: blo gros chen po gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i chos kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis chos rab tu 'byed par rgya che bas na blo gros chen pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i chos kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis chos rab tu 'byed par rgya che bas na blo gros chen pa'o //
translated: Great Intelligence is the second, and the concentration of the non-dual Dharma is the extensive discernment of the Dharma.

original: lhan cig ces pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nas byon pa'i btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig ces pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nas byon pa'i btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang ngo //
translated: Together means with the foremost bodhisattvas who have come from all buddhafields.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyu ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad gsol ba'i lan 'don pas skyon thams cad kyi rgyal mo bag chags dang bcas pa rtsa ba nas bton pa mchog tu kun dag pa 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyu ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad gsol ba'i lan 'don pas skyon thams cad kyi rgyal mo bag chags dang bcas pa rtsa ba nas bton pa mchog tu kun dag pa 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams
translated: Moving in all buddhafields means that, by answering all questions about mundane and supramundane phenomena, the supreme purity of the king of all faults, together with their imprints, is uprooted, and one becomes free from attachment and completely pure.

original: cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po cho 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma dang / gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs @30b kyis chos ston pas sems can gyi rgyud mtha' med pa rangs par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa la thog mar bstod de /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po cho 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma dang / gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs @30b kyis chos ston pas sems can gyi rgyud mtha' med pa rangs par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa la thog mar bstod de /
translated: The Omniscient Lord of Yogins, having satisfied the endless continuums of sentient beings with his teachings of Dharma through many kinds of miracles and various forms, the Blessed Sugata is first praised.

original: sems can gyi don du yongs su zhu bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du yongs su zhu bar byed do //
translated: Then, for the sake of sentient beings, he makes a request.

original: de la bstod pa ni /
analyzed: de la bstod pa ni /
translated: The praise is as follows:

original: 'jig rten skye 'jig ma mchis te //
analyzed: 'jig rten skye 'jig ma mchis te //
translated: The world is not born and does not perish.

original: nam mkha'i me tog rab tu 'dra /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog rab tu 'dra /
translated: It is just like a sky-flower.

original: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis //üîΩkhyod kyis yod dang med ma dmigs //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis // khyod kyis yod dang med ma dmigs //
translated: Through your wisdom and compassion,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: you do not apprehend existence and non-existence.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa skyed pa pos bskyed pa'i skye ba byed pa po dang / byed pa'i chos gzhan bar kun tu brtag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa skyed pa pos bskyed pa'i skye ba byed pa po dang / byed pa'i chos gzhan bar kun tu brtag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to imagine that arising, perishing, and so forth are produced by a producer, or that there are other phenomena that are produced and producers.

original: ji ltar khyad par can dang / bya ka ra na pa la sogs pas yongs su rtog pa de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis la yang tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par can dang / bya ka ra na pa la sogs pas yongs su rtog pa de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis la yang tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the particular and the karana bird, etc. are imagined, so also birth, endurance, cessation, etc. are imagined. But in the two selflessnesses of the person and the factors of existence, there is no difference at all.

original: de bas na 'jig rten la yang skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin zhes brtag pa'i don no //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten la yang skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin zhes brtag pa'i don no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the investigation is that even in the world, birth, etc. do not exist.

original: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang mi 'brel te /
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang mi 'brel te /
translated: One moment is not related to anything else.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig gcig pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig gcig pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When there is one moment,

original: skad cig gnyis pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa med do //
translated: there is no second moment.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod pa ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod pa ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste /
translated: This is dependent origination, because this exists due to the existence of that in the aftermath of the former.

original: de yang skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de yang skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is free from origination, destruction, etc.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel bas skye ba med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa yang gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba med pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel bas skye ba med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa yang gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba med pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The moments of the selflessness of the person are not produced, because they are related to the agent and the action. The selflessness of phenomena is also not produced in the aspect of duality, like a dream, an optical illusion, and so on.

original: des na 'jig rten nam mkha'i me tog dang rab tu 'dra ste /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten nam mkha'i me tog dang rab tu 'dra ste /
translated: Therefore, the world is just like a sky-flower.

original: sbom po dang phra mo shes rab kyis tha dad bar 'byed pas phye ba na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo shes rab kyis tha dad bar 'byed pas phye ba na mi dmigs te /
translated: When it is differentiated by the wisdom that distinguishes the gross and the subtle, it is not perceived.

original: stong ba 'gyur ba ni khang ba dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: stong ba 'gyur ba ni khang ba dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It becomes empty, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: yod dang med ma dmigs zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gnas ni yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: yod dang med ma dmigs zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gnas ni yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The phrase not perceived as existent or nonexistent means that the basis of the aspect of duality is the convention of the conception of existence and nonexistence.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /üîΩyod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa / yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
translated: As it is said in this very text:üîΩNonexistence is implied by existence,

original: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
analyzed: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
translated: And existence is implied by nonexistence.

original: de bas med pa zhes mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med pa zhes mi bya //
translated: Therefore, it is not called nonexistence.

original: yod par yang ni mi rtag go //
analyzed: yod par yang ni mi rtag go //
translated: And also, it is not permanent.

original: zhes so // ji ltar byis pa rnams rnam par rtog pa ni gnyid kyis ma @31a * //
analyzed: zhes so // ji ltar byis pa rnams rnam par rtog pa ni gnyid kyis ma @31a * //
translated: As for the way in which the childish conceive, it is like this:

original: log pa'i dus ni /
analyzed: log pa'i dus ni /
translated: In the waking state,

original: gzugs yod la /
analyzed: gzugs yod la /
translated: forms exist,

original: rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes so //
translated: but in the dream state, they do not.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis ni shes rab kyi sa yod pa dang med pa mi dmigs pa ni thos pa dang sems pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis ni shes rab kyi sa yod pa dang med pa mi dmigs pa ni thos pa dang sems pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: As for the wise, the non-observation of existence and non-existence is by means of the wisdom of hearing and reflection.

original: de ltar bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang gi rig pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa rnams shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang gi rig pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa rnams shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa lta ci smos /
translated: So, what need is there to speak of the non-observation of the ultimate truth, which is free from conceptual elaborations and appearances, and which is the non-dual self-awareness of the Buddhas, the Transcendent Conquerors, by means of the wisdom of meditative equipoise?

original: thugs rjes kyang gzhan gyi don mdzad par brtson zhing gang gi tshe don dam pa bshad pa mdzad pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs su rdzogs par byed du gzhug pa de'i tshe sgyu ma byed pa'i skyes bu bzhin du mi dmigs pa ni gzugs rnam pa sna
analyzed: thugs rjes kyang gzhan gyi don mdzad par brtson zhing gang gi tshe don dam pa bshad pa mdzad pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs su rdzogs par byed du gzhug pa de'i tshe sgyu ma byed pa'i skyes bu bzhin du mi dmigs pa ni gzugs rnam pa sna
translated: Compassion also strives to benefit others, and when it is time to explain the ultimate, it causes one to engage in perfecting the accumulations of generosity and so on.üîΩ

original: tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sgyu ma'i rnam par thar ba la gnas pa rnams snang ba tsam la bzhugs te tha snyad mdzad do //
analyzed: tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sgyu ma'i rnam par thar ba la gnas pa rnams snang ba tsam la bzhugs te tha snyad mdzad do //
translated: And with compassion, he strives to benefit others. When he teaches the ultimate, he causes the perfection of generosity and so forth to be completed. At that time, like a magician, he abides in the mere appearance of the various aspects of form, such as the yogi who is the master of the sense faculties, abiding in the liberation of illusion, and he makes conventional designations.

original: chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: All phenomena are like illusions.

original: sems dang rnam par shes pa spang //
analyzed: sems dang rnam par shes pa spang //
translated: Abandoning mind and consciousness,

original: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje yis //
translated: with your wisdom and compassion,

original: khyod kyi yod dang med ma dmigs //
analyzed: khyod kyi yod dang med ma dmigs //
translated: you do not observe existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lta bur gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sems dang / rnam par shes pa spangs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lta bur gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sems dang / rnam par shes pa spangs te /
translated: This is like the nature of dreams, magical illusions, reflections, and floaters and so forth. Abandoning mind and consciousness that have the aspect of duality,

original: sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i snang ba tsam du snang ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i snang ba tsam du snang ba'o //
translated: They appear as mere appearances that are like illusions.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here:

original: sems can kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: sems can kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: The all-base consciousness of all sentient beings

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid bzhin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid bzhin no //
translated: Is the mind that thinks ‚ÄúI,‚Äù the mental consciousness.

original: gang gi yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That which apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya // zhes pa ste /
translated: Is called the consciousnesses.

original: chud pa'i gnyid kyis rnam pa de dag ni mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: chud pa'i gnyid kyis rnam pa de dag ni mi skye ba ste /
translated: When one is in deep sleep, those do not arise,

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As explained above.

original: 'jig rten rtag dang chad spang ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag dang chad spang ba //
translated: The world is free from permanence and annihilation.

original: 'khor gzugs rmi lam 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'khor gzugs rmi lam 'dra ba ste //
translated: The wheel of existence is like a dream.

original: khyod ni shes rab thugs rje yis //
analyzed: khyod ni shes rab thugs rje yis //
translated: You, with your wisdom and compassion,

original: khyod kyi yod dang med ma dmigs //üîΩzhes pa ste /üîΩde la rtag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyi yod dang med ma dmigs // zhes pa ste / de la rtag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Do not observe existence and nonexistence.

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no permanence, because it does not exist.üîΩThere is no annihilation, because it is not nonexistent.

original: mi gnyis pa'i chud pa'i rgyud las chad pa yang med do //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i chud pa'i rgyud las chad pa yang med do //
translated: The wheel of existence is free from the annihilation of a nondual continuum.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chad pa yang yun ring po dang / yun thung du'i rmi lam bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chad pa yang yun ring po dang / yun thung du'i rmi lam bzhin no //
translated: The annihilation of the aspect of duality is like a long or short dream.

original: chos dang gang zag bdag med dang // khyod kyi nyon mongs shes bya rnams //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag bdag med dang // khyod kyi nyon mongs shes bya rnams //
translated: and your afflictions and objects of knowledge,üîΩare always pure for you,üîΩbecause of your wisdom, compassion, and signlessness.

original: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje dang // mtshan ma med pas rtag tu dag / ces bya @31b ba la mtshan ma med pa ni mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyis 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po mtshan ma gang yang mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes rab thugs rje dang // mtshan ma med pas rtag tu dag / ces bya @31b ba la mtshan ma med pa ni mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyis 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po mtshan ma gang yang mi 'dzin to //
translated: Signlessness is the nonapprehension of any sign of either an apprehending subject or an apprehended object by nondual intuition.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar ba la gang gi tshe gnas bde'i tshe gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar ba la gang gi tshe gnas bde'i tshe gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one abides in the liberation of signlessness, the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable are purified, that is, the selflessness of persons and things.

original: shes rab kyi mtshan ma thams cad mtshan ma med par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan ma thams cad mtshan ma med par bya ste /
translated: One should make all the signs of wisdom signless.

original: stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: stong par mthong ngo //
translated: One sees emptiness.

original: stong pa la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas sems kyis smon par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas sems kyis smon par mi byed do //
translated: Since one does not apprehend signs in emptiness, the mind does not form wishes.

original: sems kyis smon par mi byed cing de lta bu'i smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgor gyur kyang shes rab dang thugs rjes bdag dang gzhan gyi don la bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis smon par mi byed cing de lta bu'i smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgor gyur kyang shes rab dang thugs rjes bdag dang gzhan gyi don la bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: They do not wish for it with their minds, and although they have become the door to such a non-wish-making liberation, they abide for the sake of self and others through wisdom and compassion.

original: mya ngan 'das par 'da' ba min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par 'da' ba min //
translated: They do not pass into nirvana.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang khyod mi gnas //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang khyod mi gnas //
translated: They do not abide in nirvana.

original: blo dang rig par bgyid dang bral //
analyzed: blo dang rig par bgyid dang bral //
translated: They are free from the knower and the known.

original: yod dang med pa'i phyogs kyang sbangs //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i phyogs kyang sbangs //
translated: They have abandoned the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes pa ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis sbom pa dang phra ba gzhigs pa na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis sbom pa dang phra ba gzhigs pa na /
translated: When the coarse and subtle are dissected by wisdom,

original: dmigs pa cung zad kyang mi mthong ba de'i tshe na mi gnyis pa bsam pa med pa snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa cung zad kyang mi mthong ba de'i tshe na mi gnyis pa bsam pa med pa snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: if not even the slightest observation is seen, at that time, they are the buddhas who know the ultimate truth, which is nondual, nonconceptual, and free from appearances.

original: blo dang rig par bya ba dang bral ba 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po gnyis kyi rnam pa las grol bas /
analyzed: blo dang rig par bya ba dang bral ba 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po gnyis kyi rnam pa las grol bas /
translated: They are free from the knower and the known, liberated from the aspects of the two things‚Äîthe apprehender and the apprehended.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from the conceptualization of things and nonthings.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in this very text:üîΩI do not attain nirvana as a characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
translated: as an action, or as a thing.

original: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
translated: When conceptualization and consciousness are reversed,

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o // zhes pa ste /
translated: I attain nirvana.üîΩNirvana is for the purpose of abandoning the conceptualizations of permanence,

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i dngos po phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i dngos po phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: self, purity, and pleasure.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa'i rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa'i rnam pa gnyis dang 'brel te /
translated: It is not related to the two aspects of agent and action.

original: mya ngan 'da' bas mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bas mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that nirvana is attained by attaining nirvana.

original: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Saptasatikapraj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus:

original: mi sems bde nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩde ltar skye 'jig spangs pa yis //
analyzed: mi sems bde nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o // de ltar skye 'jig spangs pa yis //
translated: The pacification of mind is nirvana.üîΩThus, those who see the peace of the Muni

original: thub pa'i zhi ba sus mthong ba //
analyzed: thub pa'i zhi ba sus mthong ba //
translated: who has abandoned birth and destructionüîΩwill not be reborn

original: de dag 'di dang slad mar yang //
analyzed: de dag 'di dang slad mar yang //
translated: in this world or the next.

original: chags med nyer len ma mchis 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: chags med nyer len ma mchis 'gyur // zhes pa ni /
translated: They are free from attachment and appropriation.

original: bdag med pa gnyis la yang @32a * //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis la yang @32a * //
translated: This verse shows that the Buddha, the BhagavƒÅn, is free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel nas skye ba med par gang dag gis thub pa skye ba spangs pa de ltar mthong ba de dag ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i srid par mngon par mtshams sbyor ba spangs te /üîΩnye bar len pa med pas snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pas 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtogüîΩpa spangs te /
analyzed: byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel nas skye ba med par gang dag gis thub pa skye ba spangs pa de ltar mthong ba de dag ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i srid par mngon par mtshams sbyor ba spangs te / nye bar len pa med pas snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pas 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs te /
translated: Those who see the Muni as free from birth, in the sense that he is free from the connection between action and agent, are free from the appropriation of existence through karma and afflictions.üîΩSince they are free from appropriation, they abide in the meditative absorption of light and nonlight.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The Omniscient One, through nondual wisdom, abides in nirvƒÅ·πáa for the benefit of all worlds, having abandoned the conceptual thoughts of things and nonthings.

original: chags pa med pa ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: He is free from attachment, free from movement.

original: bcom ldan bdag ni blo can te //
analyzed: bcom ldan bdag ni blo can te //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is intelligent.

original: theg chen khong du chud par rtogs //
analyzed: theg chen khong du chud par rtogs //
translated: He is known to have comprehended the Great Vehicle.

original: dri ba brgya po rtsa brgyad pa //
analyzed: dri ba brgya po rtsa brgyad pa //
translated: The eighty-one questions

original: gsungs pa'i mchog la zhu bar bgyi //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i mchog la zhu bar bgyi //
