translated: I will request the supreme one to explain.

original: zhes te / ye shes 'jug pa'i rigs dang / bdag gis sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pas smra ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes te / ye shes 'jug pa'i rigs dang / bdag gis sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pas smra ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is because of the lineage of engaging in wisdom and because of serving the victors of the past that I speak.

original: sems can rnams kyi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the wrong thoughts of sentient beings,

original: ji ltar bdag gis sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du zhu ba ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du zhu ba ltar ro //
translated: just as I request in all buddha realms for the sake of sentient beings.

original: theg chen khong du chud par rtogs /
analyzed: theg chen khong du chud par rtogs /
translated: I understand the Great Vehicle.

original: zhes pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
translated: This refers to the samƒÅdhi of light and the samƒÅdhi without light.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyad ba sems can rnams kyi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du zhu ba yongs su zhu bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyad ba sems can rnams kyi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du zhu ba yongs su zhu bar 'tshal na /
translated: If the bodhisattvas request the questions in order to dispel the wrong thoughts of sentient beings,

original: bcom ldan 'das mchog tu yongs su dag pa 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad pa ji ltar spyan snga nyid du sems can
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mchog tu yongs su dag pa 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad pa ji ltar spyan snga nyid du sems can
translated: The Blessed One, the supremely pure one, the one free from desire, the omniscient lord of yoga, delights the mind streams of infinite sentient beings with the magical display of various forms. Just as he does in the presence of sentient beings,

original: rnams kyi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgya mo ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar yang dag par zhu bar 'tshal ba bcom ldan 'das nyid mkhyen to //
analyzed: rnams kyi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgya mo ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar yang dag par zhu bar 'tshal ba bcom ldan 'das nyid mkhyen to //
translated: in the same way, he knows how to dispel the web of false conceptions of sentient beings. The Blessed One himself knows this.

original: zhes byang chub sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos dgongs pa'i don du dmigs so //
analyzed: zhes byang chub sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos dgongs pa'i don du dmigs so //
translated: Thus, the great bodhisattva MahƒÅmati focused on the intended meaning.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang 'khor gyi bsam ba thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang 'khor gyi bsam ba thugs su chud nas /
translated: The omniscient one, having understood the thoughts of the assembly,

original: nga la dris shig rgyal sras rnams //
analyzed: nga la dris shig rgyal sras rnams //
translated: said, Ask me, O sons of the victors!

original: blo gros chen po khyod kyang dris //
analyzed: blo gros chen po khyod kyang dris //
translated: You too, MahƒÅmati, should ask.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang btsun gtso blo gros chen po la skabs phye ba @32b dang / 'dri ba'i lus zhu bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang btsun gtso blo gros chen po la skabs phye ba @32b dang / 'dri ba'i lus zhu bar byed do //
translated: and he asked:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang gsung ba gang gis 'dri ba thams cad kyi lan lon par 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das par 'dri ba'i lan ni mchog tu zab mo gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang gsung ba gang gis 'dri ba thams cad kyi lan lon par 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das par 'dri ba'i lan ni mchog tu zab mo gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Lord also gave the answer to the question, which is the most profound, of the questions of the world and of those beyond the world, by which he would answer all questions.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi shes pa la shes rab kyi bye brag rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi shes pa la shes rab kyi bye brag rab tu 'jug go //
translated: The distinction of wisdom is applied to the two kinds of knowledge.

original: gang yang don dam par mi sems pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa der ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i rtog pa thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang don dam par mi sems pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa der ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i rtog pa thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: And that which is not thought ultimately, which is nondual, correct knowledge, there all appearances and thoughts cease.

original: so so rang gi spyod yul zhes pa ni rang gis rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: so so rang gi spyod yul zhes pa ni rang gis rig par bya ba ste /
translated: The domain of one's own experience means that which is to be known by oneself.

original: des na gang gis snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par gyi ye shes su 'gyur ba don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa tsam nyid spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis ngas khyod la bstan par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen bas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gang gis snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par gyi ye shes su 'gyur ba don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa tsam nyid spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis ngas khyod la bstan par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen bas dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I will teach you the ultimate truth, the nondual perfect knowledge, which is the wisdom that comes from the samƒÅdhis with appearances and without appearances, by means of a general method.

original: skabs phye ba dang blo gros chen pos tshig ma lus pa'i blo gros kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa'i tshad ma dang / gzhal ba dang / brjod pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams thugs su chud pa zhu bar byed do //
analyzed: skabs phye ba dang blo gros chen pos tshig ma lus pa'i blo gros kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa'i tshad ma dang / gzhal ba dang / brjod pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams thugs su chud pa zhu bar byed do //
translated: With his mind, MahƒÅmati opened the topic and asked the omniscient one to explain the valid cognitions, the objects of comprehension, the expressions, the samƒÅdhis with appearances and without appearances, which are the domain of omniscience.

original: ji ltar rtog ge rnam dag 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rtog ge rnam dag 'gyur //
translated: How does one become a pure logician?

original: rtog ge ci yi slad du 'byung //üîΩji lta bur na nor bar gda' //
analyzed: rtog ge ci yi slad du 'byung // ji lta bur na nor bar gda' //
translated: Why does logic arise?üîΩHow does one become mistaken?

original: ci yi slad du nor ba 'byung //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: ci yi slad du nor ba 'byung //üîΩzhes pa la /
translated: Why does one become mistaken?

original: rtog ge ni rnam pa mang po yod de /
analyzed: rtog ge ni rnam pa mang po yod de /
translated: There are many kinds of logic.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi stobs dang / log pa'i ye shes kyi stobs las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi stobs dang / log pa'i ye shes kyi stobs las 'byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the power of right knowledge and the power of wrong knowledge.

original: ji ltar ni ye ya'i ka rnams rtog pa tshad ma dang / gzhal ba dang / dogs pa dang / dgos pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / dpe dang / yan lag dang / rtog ge dang / nges pa dang / rtsod pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar ni ye ya'i ka rnams rtog pa tshad ma dang / gzhal ba dang / dogs pa dang / dgos pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / dpe dang / yan lag dang / rtog ge dang / nges pa dang / rtsod pa dang /
translated: What is it? It is the correct understanding of the categories of logic: valid knowledge, the object of comprehension, doubt, the goal, tenets, examples, parts, logic, ascertainment, debate,üîΩthe art of disputation, refutation, appearance of reasons, objections, similarity, and the grounds for refutation.

original: zug zug tu smra ba dang / tho btsams pa dang / rgyur snang ba dang / klan ka dang / rigs 'dra ba dang / tshar bcad pa'i gnas rnams yang dag par shes pas gdon mi za ba rnams khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: zug zug tu smra ba dang / tho btsams pa dang / rgyur snang ba dang / klan ka dang / rigs 'dra ba dang / tshar bcad pa'i gnas rnams yang dag par shes pas gdon mi za ba rnams khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Those who understand these will undoubtedly comprehend the definitive meaning.

original: tshad ma dang gzhal ba ma gtogs par tshig gi don gzhan med do //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal ba ma gtogs par tshig gi don gzhan med do //
translated: Apart from valid knowledge and the object of comprehension, there is no other meaning of the words.

original: gzhal pa yang tshad ma ma gtogs par yod pa ma yin pa nyid do /
analyzed: gzhal pa yang tshad ma ma gtogs par yod pa ma yin pa nyid do /
translated: And the object of comprehension does not exist apart from valid knowledge.

original: de ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in this text:

original: gang zag @33a * //
analyzed: gang zag @33a * //
translated: The person who is skilled in the methods of logic

original: rgyud dang phung po rnams //
analyzed: rgyud dang phung po rnams //
translated: The aggregates and the mind-stream,

original: de bzhin rkyen dang rdul phran rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin rkyen dang rdul phran rnams //
translated: Likewise conditions and atoms,

original: gtso bo dbang phyug byed ba rnams //
analyzed: gtso bo dbang phyug byed ba rnams //
translated: The primal substance, the creator,üîΩare all imagined in the mind-only.

original: sems tsam la ni rnam par rtog / yang ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: sems tsam la ni rnam par rtog / yang ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: When form is broken down into atoms,

original: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
translated: The atom has no parts.üîΩWhat then appears?

original: 'o na ci snang zhes gsol ba'i lan du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ci snang zhes gsol ba'i lan du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: In reply to this question, the Omniscient One said:

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even though external things do not exist,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: The mind appears in two aspects.

original: dpyid ka'i smig rgyu ji bzhin du //
analyzed: dpyid ka'i smig rgyu ji bzhin du //
translated: Like a mirage in the spring,

original: g-yo bas sems ni slu bar byed //
analyzed: g-yo bas sems ni slu bar byed //
translated: The moving mind deceives.

original: ri dags rnams ni chur 'dzin te //
analyzed: ri dags rnams ni chur 'dzin te //
translated: Deer think of a mirage as water,

original: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: But it is not a real thing.

original: de bzhin rnam shes sa bon ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam shes sa bon ni //
translated: In the same way, the seed of consciousness

original: g-yo ba sems kyi spyod yul la //
analyzed: g-yo ba sems kyi spyod yul la //
translated: Is the moving object of the mind.

original: byis pa 'dzin pa skye ba na //
analyzed: byis pa 'dzin pa skye ba na //
translated: When the childish grasp at it,

original: rab rib rab rib can bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rab rib rab rib can bzhin du'o //
translated: It is like the floaters seen by those with cataracts.

original: zhes pa'o // de de ltar bslu ba dang mi bslu ba la sogs pa tshad ma dang / gzhal ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de de ltar bslu ba dang mi bslu ba la sogs pa tshad ma dang / gzhal ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, all these conventions of valid cognition and the object of comprehension, such as deceptive and non-deceptive, are conceptual.

original: rmi lam du yang mtsho chen po la sogs par 'khru ba dang / btung ba dang / 'bogs pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa dang der yang mya ngan gyi smig rgyu'i chus slu bar snang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam du yang mtsho chen po la sogs par 'khru ba dang / btung ba dang / 'bogs pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa dang der yang mya ngan gyi smig rgyu'i chus slu bar snang ngo //
translated: Even in dreams, one bathes in a great lake, drinks, and is refreshed, and so on, and there is the appearance of being deceived by the water of a mirage of sorrow.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rtog ge ji ltar rnam par dag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rtog ge ji ltar rnam par dag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can such a conceptualization be purified?

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi mthus sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi char gzhigs te stong par 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshad ma dang gzhal ba gnyis shes rab kyi gcung zad kyang mi mthong nas mi gnyis pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi mthus sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi char gzhigs te stong par 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshad ma dang gzhal ba gnyis shes rab kyi gcung zad kyang mi mthong nas mi gnyis pa nyid de /
translated: When, by the power of wisdom, the gross and subtle are broken down into parts and become empty, at that time, not seeing even the slightest bit of valid cognition and the object of comprehension, there is non-duality.

original: nges par zhugs pa'i dbang po'i shes pa rang gis rig pa bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //üîΩde la rnam pa gnyis su snang bas glong sa ba'i mthu nyid kyis mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pa yongs su smin pas mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang rkyen gzhan pa rnams du ma'i
analyzed: nges par zhugs pa'i dbang po'i shes pa rang gis rig pa bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas par 'gyur ro // de la rnam pa gnyis su snang bas glong sa ba'i mthu nyid kyis mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pa yongs su smin pas mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang rkyen gzhan pa rnams du ma'i
translated: Just as the sense consciousnesses of one who has definitely entered [the path of seeing] are self-aware, one will abide in the ultimate truth, free from conceptualization of things and non-things.

original: dbang las kyang shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
analyzed: dbang las kyang shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
translated: There, due to the power of the two appearances, the ignorance of non-equipoise ripens. Like dizziness and fainting, various consciousnesses appear due to the power of many other conditions and faculties in one's own and others' continuums.

original: shes rab kyi sa dpyod pa ni mi snang bar 'gro ba ni ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sa dpyod pa ni mi snang bar 'gro ba ni ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
translated: The analysis of the stage of wisdom is as follows. As for the non-appearance, it is as stated by Master Dharmakƒ´rti:

original: blos ni myong byed gzhan med de //
analyzed: blos ni myong byed gzhan med de //
translated: The mind is not experienced by another,

original: de la'ang myong byed gzhan yang med //
analyzed: de la'ang myong byed gzhan yang med //
translated: And that [mind] also is not experienced by another.

original: 'dzin dang gzung ba chems med phyir //
analyzed: 'dzin dang gzung ba chems med phyir //
translated: Because there is no apprehender and apprehended,

original: de ni bdag nyid @33b snang byed do //
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid @33b snang byed do //
translated: It illuminates itself.

original: blo yis bdag nyid dbyer med kyang //
analyzed: blo yis bdag nyid dbyer med kyang //
translated: Although the self is not different from the mind,

original: 'khrul bar mthong ba rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: 'khrul bar mthong ba rnams kyis ni //
translated: those who see it as deluded

original: 'dzin pa gzung ba yang dag rig / tha dad bzhin du rtog par byed //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gzung ba yang dag rig / tha dad bzhin du rtog par byed //
translated: imagine the apprehender and the apprehended as different.

original: ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin 'di //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin 'di //
translated: This is just as it is seen.

original: 'dzin pa gzung ba rig rnams la //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gzung ba rig rnams la //
translated: For those who know the apprehender and the apprehended,

original: tshad ma gzhal ba 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhal ba 'bras bu ni //
translated: even though the result of valid cognition

original: med du zin kyang gzhag par bya //
analyzed: med du zin kyang gzhag par bya //
translated: is nonexistent, it should be posited.

original: de de ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rtog ge ma dag pa ni mi gnyis pa'i ye shes don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rtog ge ma dag pa ni mi gnyis pa'i ye shes don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the impure conceptualization of duality becomes pure through the nondual wisdom of ultimate truth.

original: khyad par rnams ni tshig gi don rnam pa drug yongs su shes pas mthar ro zhes kun rtog pa ni phyi'i don med pas tshig gi don rnam pa drug po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par rnams ni tshig gi don rnam pa drug yongs su shes pas mthar ro zhes kun rtog pa ni phyi'i don med pas tshig gi don rnam pa drug po med pa nyid do //
translated: The distinction is final through understanding the six topics. Conceptualization is the nonexistence of the six topics due to the nonexistence of external objects.

original: de dag gi rtog ge ma dag pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rtog ge ma dag pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their impure conceptualization becomes pure through the nondual perfect knowledge of ultimate truth.

original: de kho na nyid nyi shu ldang shes pas yongs su thar ro zhes grangs can rnams rnam par rtog pa phyi'i don med pas de dag gi yang gtso bo yul med bas na longs spyod med pa'i phyir spyod pa'i skyes bu yang ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de kho na nyid nyi shu ldang shes pas yongs su thar ro zhes grangs can rnams rnam par rtog pa phyi'i don med pas de dag gi yang gtso bo yul med bas na longs spyod med pa'i phyir spyod pa'i skyes bu yang ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: Since there are no external objects, how can the purusha, the experiencer, exist, since the prakriti, the experienced, does not exist?

original: skyes bu'i rang bzhin sems pa can pas na rang gi rig pa tsam don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes nyid du rung ngo //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang bzhin sems pa can pas na rang gi rig pa tsam don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes nyid du rung ngo //
translated: Since the nature of purusha is consciousness, it is suitable that the mere awareness of itself is the nondual gnosis of ultimate reality.

original: ni ye ya'i ka dang khyad par can gang dag yang bdag tshor ba can ma yin par kun tu rtog pa de dag gi dngos po rnam pa bcu drug dang / drug gi khyad par tshor ba med pa la ji ltar yongs su shes par rung /
analyzed: ni ye ya'i ka dang khyad par can gang dag yang bdag tshor ba can ma yin par kun tu rtog pa de dag gi dngos po rnam pa bcu drug dang / drug gi khyad par tshor ba med pa la ji ltar yongs su shes par rung /
translated: Those who imagine that the self is not a feeler, how can they understand the sixteen aspects and the six distinctions of things that are without feeling?

original: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'brel pa rnams khyad par bdag gis ji ltar yongs su shes /
analyzed: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'brel pa rnams khyad par bdag gis ji ltar yongs su shes /
translated: How can they understand the distinctions of substance, quality, action, universals, attributes, and relationships?

original: bdag dang yid du sbyor ba las skyes ba'i shes pas chud par byed ces na ni de ma gtogs par bdag nyid med pa dag la rtog pa ni don med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang yid du sbyor ba las skyes ba'i shes pas chud par byed ces na ni de ma gtogs par bdag nyid med pa dag la rtog pa ni don med pa'o //
translated: If you say that the self is perceived by a cognition that arises from the conjunction of the self and the mind, then it is pointless to imagine a self that is not included in that.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pa ni gtso bo'i mnyam pa'i dus na yon tan gsum ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pa ni gtso bo'i mnyam pa'i dus na yon tan gsum ste /
translated: When the principal is in a state of equilibrium, it is endowed with pleasure, pain, and delusion, which are the three qualities.

original: de 'dra ba ni chen po'i rgyu yin par kun tu rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni chen po'i rgyu yin par kun tu rtog par byed do //
translated: You imagine that such a state is the cause of the great one.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The great one is a synonym for intellect.

original: chen po las ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: chen po las ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: From the great one arises the I-am-ness.

original: nga rgyal las ni sgra la sogs pa'i yul de tsam rnam pa lnga'o //üîΩde tsam rnam pa lnga las ni 'byung ba lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang @34a * //
analyzed: nga rgyal las ni sgra la sogs pa'i yul de tsam rnam pa lnga'o // de tsam rnam pa lnga las ni 'byung ba lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang @34a * //
translated: From the I-am-ness arises the five subtle objects such as sound and so on.

original: po lnga rnams dang yid do //
analyzed: po lnga rnams dang yid do //
translated: From the five subtle objects arises the five elements, the five sense organs of cognition, the five action faculties, and the mind.

original: bdag tu chags pa longs sku shes ba ma gtogs pa gal te de lta bur yongs su shes pas thal bar 'gyur na ni re lde dang / rtsig pa la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su shes pas cis na thal bar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa longs sku shes ba ma gtogs pa gal te de lta bur yongs su shes pas thal bar 'gyur na ni re lde dang / rtsig pa la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su shes pas cis na thal bar mi 'gyur //
translated: If it were the case that one would be liberated by understanding the self in that way, then why would one not be liberated by understanding the distinctions of a fence, a wall, and so on?

original: de bas na ne ye ya'i ka dang / khyad par can gyi tshig gi don gyi khyad par yongs su shes pas thar pa'i skyon 'di'ang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ne ye ya'i ka dang / khyad par can gyi tshig gi don gyi khyad par yongs su shes pas thar pa'i skyon 'di'ang mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, this fault of liberation is the same for the NaiyƒÅyika and the Vai≈õe·π£ika, who understand the distinctions of the meanings of the words ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù and ‚Äúparticular.‚Äù

original: ksha pa na ka'i phyogs kyi thar par 'gyur bar smra bskyang dogs pa ldog par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: ksha pa na ka'i phyogs kyi thar par 'gyur bar smra bskyang dogs pa ldog par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: The assertion of the KƒÅ≈õmƒ´ri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas that liberation is attained by the side of the aggregates is not free from the same fault.

original: yod par 'gyur ba ni spyi'i bdag nyid dang / med pa 'gyur ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pas la 'gyur ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ba ni spyi'i bdag nyid dang / med pa 'gyur ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pas la 'gyur ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du'o //
translated: The universal is the nature of existence, the particular is the nature of nonexistence, and the both is the nature of both the universal and the particular.

original: yod par 'gyur ba spyi'i bdag nyid ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ba spyi'i bdag nyid ba ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: The universal, which is the nature of existence, should not be asserted as the nature of the particular.

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du sod bas 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //üîΩspyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod /üîΩmed kyang med pa ni cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du sod bas 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o // spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod / med kyang med pa ni cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: Nor can it be said that the particular exists as the universal, and that the universal exists as the particular.üîΩNor can it be said that the particular exists as the universal, and that the particular does not exist as the particular.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par cig car smyu bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par cig car smyu bar mi bya'o //
translated: Nor can it be said that the particular exists as the particular, and that the particular exists as the universal.

original: zhes pa ksha pa na ka rnams kyi thar ba'i rgyur gdon mi zab gang yang med do //
analyzed: zhes pa ksha pa na ka rnams kyi thar ba'i rgyur gdon mi zab gang yang med do //
translated: Thus, the Lokayatas are not to be blamed for anything.

original: de'i phyir na rtog gi 'di ni ma dag pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na rtog gi 'di ni ma dag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this conception is impure.

original: des na de ni don dam pa'i bden ba mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pas dag par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na de ni don dam pa'i bden ba mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pas dag par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that it becomes pure by means of the pure knowledge of the ultimate truth.

original: gang dag yang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs par smra ba rnams pa kun du rtog pa ni 'di thams cad tshangs ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag yang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs par smra ba rnams pa kun du rtog pa ni 'di thams cad tshangs ba yin te /
translated: Those who propound Brahma, Ishvara, etc.

original: de bas na zhib la snyen bkur gyis shig ces pa gnyis su med par smra ba de dag gis grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhib la snyen bkur gyis shig ces pa gnyis su med par smra ba de dag gis grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error of those who speak of nonduality is that liberation and nonliberation, wealth and poverty, and so on, would be the same.

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi mi gnyis pa'i chud ba ni mang po ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi mi gnyis pa'i chud ba ni mang po ste /
translated: The Sugatas have many teachings on nonduality.

original: de bas na de dag gi rtog ge ni dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi rtog ge ni dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, their logic is pure.

original: skyod pa can rnams kyi rig pa ni rtag pa'i tshad ma ste /
analyzed: skyod pa can rnams kyi rig pa ni rtag pa'i tshad ma ste /
translated: The knowledge of the LokƒÅyatas is the valid cognition of permanence.

original: zhes pa ni rtag pa ma skyes pa na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med pas rtog ge 'di yang ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtag pa ma skyes pa na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med pas rtog ge 'di yang ma dag pa'o //
translated: Since the unarisen permanent is like the horn of a rabbit, it is a nonentity. This logic is also impure.

original: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
translated: Whatever exists is momentary.

original: log pa'i sgra dang glog la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: log pa'i sgra dang glog la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a false sound, lightning, and so on.

original: rtag pas ni rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pas ni rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Permanence is contradictory to the performance of function sequentially and simultaneously.

original: gang @34b la don byed pa'i mthu med pa de ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang @34b la don byed pa'i mthu med pa de ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Whatever lacks the power to perform a function does not exist as an entity, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i rtog ge yang phyi'i don med pas na 'byung ba'i 'gyur pa la 'gro ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i rtog ge yang phyi'i don med pas na 'byung ba'i 'gyur pa la 'gro ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin no //
translated: The LokƒÅyata theory is also untenable, because external objects do not exist, the various aspects of consciousness do not arise from the transformation of the elements.

original: rgyu'i khyad par gyis byed pa ma gtogs par 'byung ba rnams kyang rnam pa sna tshogs su sus byed /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par gyis byed pa ma gtogs par 'byung ba rnams kyang rnam pa sna tshogs su sus byed /
translated: Apart from the special cause, who makes the various aspects of the elements?

original: de bas na 'gro ba sna tshogs 'byung ba las gzhan par 'thad de /
analyzed: de bas na 'gro ba sna tshogs 'byung ba las gzhan par 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that the various consciousnesses arise from something other than the elements.

original: rgyu'i khyad par las rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par las rjes su dpag go //
translated: One infers this from the special cause.

original: der yang dbang po rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: der yang dbang po rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculty is not the cause,

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because the permanent does not exist as a thing, like the son of a barren woman, etc., because it is not produced.

original: des na sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'brel bar 'jug pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang der ni log pa'i shes pas bdag tu zhen pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'brel bar 'jug pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang der ni log pa'i shes pas bdag tu zhen pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, whatever is related to and engaged with suffering arises from the cause of clinging to a self through false knowledge.

original: mar me la sogs par phye ba ma sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me la sogs par phye ba ma sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the example of the lamp, etc.

original: sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid blong ba dang / 'khrug pa'i las mtshan nyid du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid blong ba dang / 'khrug pa'i las mtshan nyid du 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is connected with suffering‚Äù means that it is characterized by birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation in cyclic existence.

original: gal te log pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par yang sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel par 'jug par 'gyur na ni des dben pa'i ye shes bskyed kyang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i yul spong du zin kyang de nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te log pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par yang sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel par 'jug par 'gyur na ni des dben pa'i ye shes bskyed kyang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i yul spong du zin kyang de nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: If the connection with suffering were to occur without the occurrence of a false cognition, then even if one generated the wisdom that is free from that, one would fall into that abyss, even though one had abandoned the object of the abyss, and so on.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma ste /üîΩdes na rtag pa'i bdag la zhen pa dang / las kyi srid pa rab tu byung ste de zad pa nyid kyi thar pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma ste / des na rtag pa'i bdag la zhen pa dang / las kyi srid pa rab tu byung ste de zad pa nyid kyi thar pa ste /
translated: This is the valid cognition that refutes the counter position.

original: phung por mi gnas shing 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: phung por mi gnas shing 'jig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who is attached to a permanent self and who has entered into the existence of karma, even though he has generated the wisdom that is free from that, he would fall into that abyss, and so on.üîΩTherefore, liberation is the exhaustion of that very [existence], and the aggregates do not endure and are destroyed.

original: rab rib 'khrul 'das 'khrugs pa nye bar zhi ba rab tu zhi //
analyzed: rab rib 'khrul 'das 'khrugs pa nye bar zhi ba rab tu zhi //
translated: The pacification of the disturbance of the confusion of cataracts is peace.

original: yod pa ma skyes nam mkha'i me tog pa'ang cig car dang // rim gyis don byed ma yin zhes pa dpal bzangs tshad ma ni //
analyzed: yod pa ma skyes nam mkha'i me tog pa'ang cig car dang // rim gyis don byed ma yin zhes pa dpal bzangs tshad ma ni //
translated: The non-arising of the existent, the sky-flower, is also simultaneous and gradual non-performance of function.

original: tshul gnyis 'dus pa bder gshegs pa'i yang mi gnyis la'o zhes bya'o /
analyzed: tshul gnyis 'dus pa bder gshegs pa'i yang mi gnyis la'o zhes bya'o /
translated: The glorious good valid cognition is the union of the two modes, the Sugata, and the non-dual.

original: // / de de bzhin du phran tshegs kyi rtog ge gzhan yang tshad mar rtog pa tsam la brten nas thar pa kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: // / de de bzhin du phran tshegs kyi rtog ge gzhan yang tshad mar rtog pa tsam la brten nas thar pa kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: In that way, other minor logics are also imagined to be liberation based on mere conceptual valid cognition.

original: khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang / bkra shis pa dang / @35a * //
analyzed: khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang / bkra shis pa dang / @35a * //
translated: [They imagine] bathing, fire sacrifice, sneezing, ravines, auspiciousness,

original: bkra shis ma yin par rnam pa rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ngo ma dang / 'o ma ma yin pa dang / rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog dang / rin po che dang / gser la sogs pa 'chang ba dang / thal bas bsku ba dang /
analyzed: bkra shis ma yin par rnam pa rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ngo ma dang / 'o ma ma yin pa dang / rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog dang / rin po che dang / gser la sogs pa 'chang ba dang / thal bas bsku ba dang /
translated: and inauspiciousness. The characteristics of imagination are not real, and holding milk, roots, fruits, flowers, jewels, gold, and so on, and smearing oneself with ashes,

original: skra 'bal ba dang / ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa dang / gar dang / glu dang / dbang po mgu bar byed pa dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / ri dags kyi brtul zhugs la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ni rtog ge ma dag pa ste /
analyzed: skra 'bal ba dang / ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa dang / gar dang / glu dang / dbang po mgu bar byed pa dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / ri dags kyi brtul zhugs la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ni rtog ge ma dag pa ste /
translated: The imagination of the hair-tuft, the diadem, the dance, the song, the pleasing of the senses, the cow-posture, the deer-posture, and so on, is impure speculation.

original: bdag tu zhes pa yongs su ma spang na ji ltar yongs su thar bar rung /
analyzed: bdag tu zhes pa yongs su ma spang na ji ltar yongs su thar bar rung /
translated: If the self is not completely abandoned, how can there be complete liberation?

original: rtag pa'i bdag tu chags pa'i mthu nyid las 'khor bar skye ba'i sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag tu chags pa'i mthu nyid las 'khor bar skye ba'i sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel bar 'gyur te /
translated: From the power of attachment to the self as permanent, there is the connection with the suffering of birth in cyclic existence.

original: de bas na bdag med pa yongs su shes pas thar par rung ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag med pa yongs su shes pas thar par rung ste /
translated: Therefore, liberation is possible through the complete understanding of selflessness.

original: de bzhin du yang bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi rtog ge rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi rtog ge rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, there is the pure speculation of the Sugatas.

original: ji ltar mchog tu yongs su dag ba 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud rangs par mdzad pas ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mchog tu yongs su dag ba 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud rangs par mdzad pas ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las gsungs pa /
translated: Just as the one who is utterly pure, free from attachment, and the lord of yogis, the Omniscient One, delights the mind-streams of infinite sentient beings with the magical display of form, as it is said in the Samadhiraja:

original: bdag tu 'du shes la ni gang gnas pa //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes la ni gang gnas pa //
translated: Those who abide in the notion of self

original: de dag sdug bsngal la ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal la ni rab tu gnas //
translated: They abide in suffering.

original: gang na sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: gang na sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: Those who do not have suffering

original: bdag med de dag gis ni mi shes so //
analyzed: bdag med de dag gis ni mi shes so //
translated: Do not know selflessness.

original: rtog ge zhes bya ba ni don khong du chud pa'i rgyu khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog ge zhes bya ba ni don khong du chud pa'i rgyu khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: Conceptual thought is that which causes one to understand the cause of understanding the object.

original: de yang bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi tshad ma'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi tshad ma'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of the valid cognition of the Sugatas.

original: don gsal bar chung par byed pa ste /
analyzed: don gsal bar chung par byed pa ste /
translated: It is that which clarifies the object.

original: de lta na yang dag pa'i shes pa des rtog ge rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dag pa'i shes pa des rtog ge rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: In that way, by that correct cognition, conceptual thought becomes pure.

original: gang gi the tshom du gyur te dngos po rnams mi rtog par mi 'gyur bas na 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi the tshom du gyur te dngos po rnams mi rtog par mi 'gyur bas na 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since it is that which causes doubt, it is the source of the non-understanding of things.

original: de de ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rten ni bde bar rtog pa dang / 'khrul ba'i tha snyad de /
analyzed: de de ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rten ni bde bar rtog pa dang / 'khrul ba'i tha snyad de /
translated: Thus, the basis of correct understanding and incorrect understanding is the conception of happiness and the conventional designation of error.

original: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa nyid kyi dngos po yongs su shes pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log par shes pas ldog pa na mdo sde 'dis log pa'i shes @35b pas rgya cher rnam par zlog par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa nyid kyi dngos po yongs su shes pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log par shes pas ldog pa na mdo sde 'dis log pa'i shes @35b pas rgya cher rnam par zlog par byed do //
translated: Since the understanding of impermanence, selflessness, suffering, impurity, and emptiness is the reversal of the incorrect understanding of permanence, self, purity, and things, this sutra extensively reverses incorrect understanding.

original: ci yi slad du sprul dang zhing //
analyzed: ci yi slad du sprul dang zhing //
translated: Why are there emanations and fields?

original: khyod kyi mtshan dang mu stegs dang // snang byed rim pa ci slad du //
analyzed: khyod kyi mtshan dang mu stegs dang // snang byed rim pa ci slad du //
translated: Why are there marks, tirthikas, and the stages of illumination?

original: khyod kyi rgyal sras gang las lags //
analyzed: khyod kyi rgyal sras gang las lags //
translated: From what are your bodhisattvas?

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don med par grangs las 'das pa'i zhing rnams ji ltar snal /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don med par grangs las 'das pa'i zhing rnams ji ltar snal /
translated: This is asking how, if external objects do not exist, the countless fields appear.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni smi lam lta bur chud pa'i snang ba lags na /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni smi lam lta bur chud pa'i snang ba lags na /
translated: Since this world is like a dream,üîΩplease explain to the world how to turn away from delusion.

original: gang gis rmongs pa rnam par ldog pa de ltar 'jig rten la bshad du gsol zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul du dri ba blo gros chen pos bsam par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: gang gis rmongs pa rnam par ldog pa de ltar 'jig rten la bshad du gsol zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul du dri ba blo gros chen pos bsam par rjes su dpag go //
translated: The great mind of Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is inferred to have contemplated the question in the domain of omniscience.

original: phyi'i don med par sprul pa rnams ji ltar na sgyur 'byed pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin bzhin du 'jig rten la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: phyi'i don med par sprul pa rnams ji ltar na sgyur 'byed pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin bzhin du 'jig rten la bshad du gsol /
translated: Please explain to the world how emanations are like the nature of an illusion, in the absence of external objects.

original: phyi'i don med par skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams ji ltar 'gyur ba de dag rgyang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du gang gis 'dus pa'i skye bo kun tu rmongs pa ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar bshad du gsol /
analyzed: phyi'i don med par skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams ji ltar 'gyur ba de dag rgyang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du gang gis 'dus pa'i skye bo kun tu rmongs pa ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar bshad du gsol /
translated: Please explain how the marks of a great being can occur in the absence of external objects, so that the deluded assembly will turn away from the nature of an illusion.

original: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba'i mu stegs can ji ltar ldog pa dang / de dag rtsod pa dang chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa bstan pas bzlog tu gsol /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba'i mu stegs can ji ltar ldog pa dang / de dag rtsod pa dang chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa bstan pas bzlog tu gsol /
translated: Please explain how to turn away from the tƒ´rthikas who speak of duality and non-duality, and how to turn them away through teaching the absence of self in phenomena and the individual.

original: snang med rim pa ci slad du //
analyzed: snang med rim pa ci slad du //
translated: Why is there a formless realm?üîΩ

original: zhes pa ni /üîΩphung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa bshad nas rnam par shes pa tsam bshad par mdzad kyang dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog par snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rim gyis bshad par mdzad na snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: zhes pa ni / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa bshad nas rnam par shes pa tsam bshad par mdzad kyang dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog par snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rim gyis bshad par mdzad na snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Why is the stage of non-appearance taught?üîΩHaving explained the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth, and having explained mere consciousness, if the meditative stabilization of non-appearance, which is non-conceptuality with regard to entity and non-entity, is gradually explained, then the meditative stabilizations of appearance and non-appearance are explained in order.

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin go rims su bshad par mdzad kyang dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs bde bstan du gsol /
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin go rims su bshad par mdzad kyang dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs bde bstan du gsol /
translated: Please teach the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /üîΩgcig la ston par gang mdzad pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa / gcig la ston par gang mdzad pa //
translated: As it is said here:

original: de ni gzhan la bstan pa min //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la bstan pa min //
translated: What is taught to one is not taught to another.

original: nad pa'i dbang la sman pa bzhin //
analyzed: nad pa'i dbang la sman pa bzhin //
translated: Like a doctor in relation to a patient,

original: sman ni tha dad rtog byed pa'o //
analyzed: sman ni tha dad rtog byed pa'o //
translated: the medicine is conceived to be different.

original: zhes so // ting nge 'dzin rim gyis bsgoms pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rgya che bas rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi yon tan bla ma'i bla mar khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes so // ting nge 'dzin rim gyis bsgoms pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rgya che bas rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi yon tan bla ma'i bla mar khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating meditative stabilization gradually, the bodhisattvas' qualities become superior, more and more superior, through the vast accumulations of merit and wisdom that come from the distinctions of the levels and the perfections.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in this very text:

original: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
analyzed: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
translated: The seven levels are mind;

original: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is nonappearance.

original: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
analyzed: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
translated: The two levels are abodes;

original: sa gzhan nga yi rang @36a * //
analyzed: sa gzhan nga yi rang @36a * //
translated: The other levels are my nature.

original: bzhin no // de de ltar chos rgya che rang bstan du gsol /
analyzed: bzhin no // de de ltar chos rgya che rang bstan du gsol /
translated: Please teach the vast Dharma in that way.

original: snang ba med pa'i rim pa ji lta bur mchis /
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i rim pa ji lta bur mchis /
translated: What is the process of nonappearance?

original: de ma mchis nas bcu la dbang ba rnams kyi khyad par ji ltar 'di nyid du bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de ma mchis nas bcu la dbang ba rnams kyi khyad par ji ltar 'di nyid du bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: If it does not exist, how do you establish the distinctions of the lords of the ten levels in this very text?

original: bcu po pa ni dang po yin //
analyzed: bcu po pa ni dang po yin //
translated: The tenth is the first;

original: dang po pa ni brgyad po yin //
analyzed: dang po pa ni brgyad po yin //
translated: The first is the eighth;

original: dgu po yang ni bdun pa ste //
analyzed: dgu po yang ni bdun pa ste //
translated: The ninth is the seventh;

original: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
analyzed: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
translated: What is the process of nonappearance?

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: sa dang por chos la bdag med par snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sa bcu por yang yin na ston pa nyid la khyad par ci mchis zhes pa la /
analyzed: sa dang por chos la bdag med par snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sa bcu por yang yin na ston pa nyid la khyad par ci mchis zhes pa la /
translated: On the first ground, one enters into the meditative absorption of the absence of appearance of the selflessness of phenomena, and on the ten grounds, as well. What is the difference between the teacher and the student?

original: der sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas bshad du gsol /üîΩgrol ba gang du mchi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas bshad du gsol / grol ba gang du mchi bar 'gyur //
translated: In that regard, please explain the accumulation of merit of the perfections such as generosity and so on, which is the object of omniscience.üîΩWhere does liberation go?

original: bcings pa su lags gang gis 'grol //
analyzed: bcings pa su lags gang gis 'grol //
translated: Who is bound and by what is one liberated?

original: bsam gtan pa yi yul de gang //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa yi yul de gang //
translated: What is the object of the meditator?

original: ji ltar theg pa gsum po lags //
analyzed: ji ltar theg pa gsum po lags //
translated: How are there three vehicles?

original: zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs la longs su zad de sems dag pa ni thar pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs la longs su zad de sems dag pa ni thar pa ste /
translated: The mind that is purified by the exhaustion of afflictions such as attachment and so on is liberation.

original: de ni gang yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de ni gang yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not go anywhere at all.

original: su stegs can rnams kyis ni spu bur stobs spyi bor brtol te nyi ma'i lam gyis zhi bar 'gro ba la sogs pas thar ba'i gnas su kun du rtog go //
analyzed: su stegs can rnams kyis ni spu bur stobs spyi bor brtol te nyi ma'i lam gyis zhi bar 'gro ba la sogs pas thar ba'i gnas su kun du rtog go //
translated: The Lokayatas imagine that the liberated person goes to the abode of liberation by the path of the sun, after the head has been pierced by the tip of a ku≈õa blade.

original: gang na yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod pa der skye ba'i gnas yin gyi thar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod pa der skye ba'i gnas yin gyi thar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But wherever there is going and coming, that is a place of birth, not liberation.

original: grol ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas gar yang ma yin no zhes bstan du gsol /
analyzed: grol ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas gar yang ma yin no zhes bstan du gsol /
translated: The Omniscient One has taught that the liberated person does not go anywhere.

original: bcings pa su zhig gang gis 'grol //
analyzed: bcings pa su zhig gang gis 'grol //
translated: Who is bound and by what is he liberated?

original: zhes bya ba ni phyugs kyi bdag pos phyugs kyi gtso bo bcings pa las bkrol ba ltar ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyugs kyi bdag pos phyugs kyi gtso bo bcings pa las bkrol ba ltar ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the owner of the cattle liberating the chief of the cattle from bondage.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi log pa'i shes pa bzlog pas bkrol ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi log pa'i shes pa bzlog pas bkrol ba ste /
translated: By the reversal of wrong knowledge through right knowledge, one is liberated.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las smras pa /üîΩchags pa'i 'dod chags tha dad par //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las smras pa / chags pa'i 'dod chags tha dad par //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩIf attachment and the one attached

original: gal te 'dod chags sngar gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags sngar gyur na //
translated: were different,

original: de yi rkyen gyis 'dod chags 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi rkyen gyis 'dod chags 'gyur //
translated: then attachment would be conditioned by that.

original: chags med 'dod chags ci phyir zhig /'dod chags chags pa skye bar yang //
analyzed: chags med 'dod chags ci phyir zhig /'dod chags chags pa skye bar yang //
translated: If there is no attachment, why is there passion? Passion arises from attachment.

original: rim pa de ni 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: rim pa de ni 'dra ba ste //
translated: This process is similar.

original: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
translated: All phenomena are like passion.

original: lhan cig mi 'jug lhan cig min //
analyzed: lhan cig mi 'jug lhan cig min //
translated: They do not occur together or not together.üîΩThe object of the meditator

original: bsam gtan pa yi yul de dang // zhes bya ba ni gang yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa yi yul de dang // zhes bya ba ni gang yang ma yin te /
translated: is not anything at all.

original: gang @36b chags par byed pa dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis chags par 'gyur ba dang / chos de des kun du mi mthong ba ni shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhags te gang yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang @36b chags par byed pa dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis chags par 'gyur ba dang / chos de des kun du mi mthong ba ni shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhags te gang yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: The meditator does not see any of those phenomena by which there would be attachment, to which there would be attachment, through which there would be attachment, or in which there would be attachment. He does not see anything at all. He does not see the gross or the subtle, through the method of not apprehending with wisdom.

original: ji ltar theg pa gsum lags zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sna tshogs su bya ba med na ji ltar theg pa gsum du bzhag / ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas sh'a ri'i bu la /
analyzed: ji ltar theg pa gsum lags zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sna tshogs su bya ba med na ji ltar theg pa gsum du bzhag / ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas sh'a ri'i bu la /
translated: If emptiness is not differentiated, how can there be three vehicles?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lan du gsungs pa thams cad mkhyen pa sems can gyi don gyi tshogs kyi sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas khyad par du phye bas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lan du gsungs pa thams cad mkhyen pa sems can gyi don gyi tshogs kyi sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas khyad par du phye bas so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is taught in reply to all of these, because of the distinction of the stage of the accumulation of the knowledge of the knower of all for the sake of sentient beings and the perfections.

original: yang ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, just as it is taught here:

original: nyan thos dang ni rgyal ba gang //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ni rgyal ba gang //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and the victors

original: snang ba'i gzugs dag de dag ni //
analyzed: snang ba'i gzugs dag de dag ni //
translated: are the forms of the appearance of thoseüîΩwho are the compassionate bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtse bdag dag / des na sprul pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtse bdag dag / des na sprul pa ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they display emanations.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa khyod kyi theg pa gcig pu nyid bshad du gsol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa khyod kyi theg pa gcig pu nyid bshad du gsol zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, please explain that your vehicle is the sole vehicle.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas sems can gyi mos pa'i khyad par las theg pa gsum du bsgyur bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas sems can gyi mos pa'i khyad par las theg pa gsum du bsgyur bar gsungs pa /
translated: The knower of all has taught that the three vehicles are due to the distinctions in the aspirations of sentient beings.

original: gcig la bshad pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: gcig la bshad pa gang yin pa //
translated: What is taught to one

original: de ni gzhan la bshad pa min //üîΩnad pa'i dbang las sman pa bzhin //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la bshad pa min // nad pa'i dbang las sman pa bzhin //
translated: is not taught to another.üîΩLike a doctor in relation to a patient,

original: sman ni so sor rtog par byed //
analyzed: sman ni so sor rtog par byed //
translated: the medicine is individually differentiated.

original: ces so // de de lta bu ni tshigs su bcad pa bsdus pa las zhus pa thams cad kyi lan yod pas na 'di'i bshad pa yang rgya che bar der rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ces so // de de lta bu ni tshigs su bcad pa bsdus pa las zhus pa thams cad kyi lan yod pas na 'di'i bshad pa yang rgya che bar der rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since all questions are answered in the summary verses, the extensive explanation should be understood there.

original: rkyen gyis skye ba de dag ci //
analyzed: rkyen gyis skye ba de dag ci //
translated: What are those conditions?

original: 'bras bu ci zhig rgyu ni gang //
analyzed: 'bras bu ci zhig rgyu ni gang //
translated: What is the effect? What is the cause?

original: gnyis ka gzhan pa ci slad du //
analyzed: gnyis ka gzhan pa ci slad du //
translated: Why are they different?

original: ji lta bur yang 'byung ba lags //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang 'byung ba lags //
translated: How do they arise?

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / skyed pa'i dngos po dang / byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel te rkyen las 'bras bu 'byung ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / skyed pa'i dngos po dang / byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel te rkyen las 'bras bu 'byung ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: This is related to the topic of arising and the entity that is produced, the agent and the instrument. There is not the slightest arising of an effect from conditions.

original: gang gi tshe na rgyu yod pa de'i tshe na 'bras bu med pas na rgyu ji ltar na yod /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na rgyu yod pa de'i tshe na 'bras bu med pas na rgyu ji ltar na yod /
translated: When the cause exists, the effect does not exist. Therefore, how can the cause exist?

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ;
translated: As the Omniscient One said:

original: / blo gros chen po bu ma skyes par yang phar 'dogs pa bzhin du rtog ge pa rnams kyi rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'thad pa dang / cig car 'byung bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: / blo gros chen po bu ma skyes par yang phar 'dogs pa bzhin du rtog ge pa rnams kyi rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'thad pa dang / cig car 'byung bar mi 'thad de /
translated: Just as a son is designated even though he is not born, so, Mahamati, for the logicians, gradual arising is untenable, and arising all at once is untenable.

original: rgyus mtshan nyid ma thob pa'i phyir dang / dus gcig tu phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa mi rung @37a * //
analyzed: rgyus mtshan nyid ma thob pa'i phyir dang / dus gcig tu phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa mi rung @37a * //
translated: Because the cause does not obtain the characteristics, and because it is not possible for the benefit to be given and the benefit to be taken at the same time.

original: ste ; de bas na gnyis ka gzhan ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ste ; de bas na gnyis ka gzhan ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because both are other, the state of cause and effect is not possible.

original: ji lta bur yang 'byung ba lags //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang 'byung ba lags //
translated: How can there be arising?

original: zhes bya ba ni med pa'i 'bras bu ji ltar na bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni med pa'i 'bras bu ji ltar na bya /
translated: This is to say, how can there be an effect that does not exist?

original: med par byed par 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: med par byed par 'gyur na ni //
translated: If it is made to exist,

original: byed pa bkag par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsnga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na //
analyzed: byed pa bkag par mi 'gyur ro // snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na //
translated: then the negation of the agent would not be possible.üîΩ If this exists, then that exists,

original: 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes te /
analyzed: 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes te /
translated: this being so, that is so.

original: rten cing 'brel bar byung ba las dang 'bras bur nges par 'brel ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar byung ba las dang 'bras bur nges par 'brel ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: This is only the definite connection of action and effect in dependent origination.

original: gzugs med snyoms par 'jug pa dang // 'gog pa de yang ji lta bu //
analyzed: gzugs med snyoms par 'jug pa dang // 'gog pa de yang ji lta bu //
translated: And formless absorption and cessation, how are they?

original: 'du shes 'gog pa ji lta bu //
analyzed: 'du shes 'gog pa ji lta bu //
translated: And how is the cessation of perception?

original: ci slad ji ltar sad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ci slad ji ltar sad par 'gyur //
translated: How does one awaken from it?

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sems 'jug pa 'gog pa'i rnal 'byor yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sems 'jug pa 'gog pa'i rnal 'byor yin mod kyi /
translated: This is the yoga of the perfection of wisdom, the cessation of the engagement of the mind.

original: 'on kyang gnyid lci ba la lags pa bzhin pas na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyid lci ba la lags pa bzhin pas na /
translated: However, since it is like deep sleep,

original: ji ltar na sad par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na sad par 'gyur /
translated: how does one awaken from it?

original: bdag tu chags pa dang las dang tshe'i rgyun ji srid du mi ldog pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams 'gog pa bdag tu chags pa yod na 'gog par 'gyur /üîΩ'du shes 'gog pa ji lta bu //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa dang las dang tshe'i rgyun ji srid du mi ldog pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams 'gog pa bdag tu chags pa yod na 'gog par 'gyur / 'du shes 'gog pa ji lta bu //
translated: As long as the continuum of self-attachment, karma, and life does not reverse, the afflictions are not ceased. When self-attachment exists, cessation occurs.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: And how is the cessation of perception?

original: 'du shes ni mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'du shes ni mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Perception has the nature of apprehending signs.

original: shes rab kyis stong pa nyid du khong du chud kyi bar de yang ji ltar na 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyis stong pa nyid du khong du chud kyi bar de yang ji ltar na 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: How is that also ceased until emptiness is comprehended through wisdom?

original: stong pa nyid la mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
translated: In emptiness, signs are not apprehended.

original: sems la mtshan ma med pas smon par mi byed de /
analyzed: sems la mtshan ma med pas smon par mi byed de /
translated: Since the mind is without signs, it does not make wishes.

original: de ltar na 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one becomes the Blessed Buddha, free from all discriminations.

original: ci slad ji ltar sad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ci slad ji ltar sad par 'gyur //
translated: Why and how does one awaken?

original: zhes bya ba ni snying rje ba'i bag chags kyis sems can gyi don du sad nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snying rje ba'i bag chags kyis sems can gyi don du sad nas /
translated: Awakening is due to the latent impressions of compassion, having awakened for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas rnam gzigs kyang shes rab kyis mi gzigs so //üîΩgang dag la yang nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam par shes pa mtha' yas dang / 'du shes yod pa dang med pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam gzigs kyang shes rab kyis mi gzigs so // gang dag la yang nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam par shes pa mtha' yas dang / 'du shes yod pa dang med pa yang rung ste /
translated: The Buddha, who sees with wisdom, does not see.üîΩFor those who abide in the mere cessation of the engagement of the mind, due to the discriminations of permanence and self in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: rtag pa dang bdag tu 'du shes pas sems 'jug pa 'gag pa tsam la gnas pa'i mu stegs can rnams des ji ltar na ;
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag tu 'du shes pas sems 'jug pa 'gag pa tsam la gnas pa'i mu stegs can rnams des ji ltar na ;
translated: how is it that the non-Buddhists

original: srid pa'i thog ma thob gyur kyang //
analyzed: srid pa'i thog ma thob gyur kyang //
translated: attain the peak of existence?

original: bsam gtan pa srid chags med rnams //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa srid chags med rnams //
translated: The meditators, free from attachment to existence,üîΩare drawn by the hook of pride,

original: ngar byed lcags kyus drangs pa dang // sems can dmyal bar yang lhung ba //
analyzed: ngar byed lcags kyus drangs pa dang // sems can dmyal bar yang lhung ba //
translated: and fall into the hells.

original: de dag sad par ji ltar rung //
analyzed: de dag sad par ji ltar rung //
translated: How can they be awakened?

original: rigs pa dang lung gi rjes su mthun par bdag gis cung zad cig bshad mod @37b kyi dam pa'i chos 'dri ba'i lan nges par ni thams cad mkhyen pa mkhyen to //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung gi rjes su mthun par bdag gis cung zad cig bshad mod @37b kyi dam pa'i chos 'dri ba'i lan nges par ni thams cad mkhyen pa mkhyen to //
translated: I have explained a little in accordance with reasoning and scripture, but the omniscient one knows the answers to questions about the sublime teaching.

original: 'gro ba dang ni lus 'dzin kyang //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ni lus 'dzin kyang //
translated: Although it moves and holds a body,

original: ci yi slad du bya ba 'byung //
analyzed: ci yi slad du bya ba 'byung //
translated: why does action occur?

original: ji ltar sa la 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar sa la 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: How does it enter the earth?

original: zhes bya ba ni su phyogs dang dus gang du skyes ba de de nyid du 'gags pas na bya ba ci'i slad du 'byung /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni su phyogs dang dus gang du skyes ba de de nyid du 'gags pas na bya ba ci'i slad du 'byung /
translated: Since it is born in a certain direction and time and ceases there, why does action occur?

original: skad cig pa'i don gyi dngos po 'gags pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i don gyi dngos po 'gags pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù is that an entity ceases and goes to another place.

original: lus 'dzin pa yang rtag par phyi'i don du 'du shes pas skad cig pa 'dra ba gzhan skye ba la gcig tu nges pa 'dzin to //
analyzed: lus 'dzin pa yang rtag par phyi'i don du 'du shes pas skad cig pa 'dra ba gzhan skye ba la gcig tu nges pa 'dzin to //
translated: Also, since it holds a body, it is conceived as an external object. It holds a body by holding a similar momentary thing to be one and the same.

original: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa 'khrul ba'i rnam pa la phyi rol gyi bar sgro btags nas sems can rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyin ci log 'khrul ba yin te /
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa 'khrul ba'i rnam pa la phyi rol gyi bar sgro btags nas sems can rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyin ci log 'khrul ba yin te /
translated: Just as in the case of dizziness, fainting, and so on, sentient beings superimpose external objects on the deluded appearances of the mind. They are deluded in the form of the duality of subject and object.

original: des na snang ba med do //
analyzed: des na snang ba med do //
translated: Therefore, appearances do not exist.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into particles.

original: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
translated: Particles do not have parts.

original: zhes so // ji ltar sa la 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes so // ji ltar sa la 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: How can one enter the stages?

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bla ma'i yang bla ma rnams kyis sa rnams su 'jug go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bla ma'i yang bla ma rnams kyis sa rnams su 'jug go //
translated: The great beings think, ‚ÄúOne enters the stages through the two collections of generosity and so on, through the consciousness of the two kinds of images, and through the special samƒÅdhis that are higher and higher.‚ÄùüîΩSince external objects do not exist, there is no division into stages such as the earth stage according to the order of place and time.

original: phyi'i don med pas na yul dang dus kyi rim pas sa la sogs par 'byed pa med do zhes par thams cad mkhyen pa sems can rnams la go bar mdzad du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs par rtag go //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pas na yul dang dus kyi rim pas sa la sogs par 'byed pa med do zhes par thams cad mkhyen pa sems can rnams la go bar mdzad du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs par rtag go //
translated: Thus the great beings think, ‚ÄúI request the Omniscient One to make sentient beings understand this.‚Äù

original: srid gsum tshoms nas pha de su //
analyzed: srid gsum tshoms nas pha de su //
translated: Who is the father from whom they depart in the three worlds?

original: gnas ni gang lags su ni ci //
analyzed: gnas ni gang lags su ni ci //
translated: What is the abode? What is it?

original: gnas shing 'gro ba gang zhig tu //
analyzed: gnas shing 'gro ba gang zhig tu //
translated: What is the abode? What is the going?

original: rgyal ba'i sras su ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras su ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How do they become the sons of the Victor?

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni srid pa gsum tshoms nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni srid pa gsum tshoms nas 'gro'o //
translated: Those who are free from passion in the three worlds depart from the three worlds.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni de dag la gnas yod de /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni de dag la gnas yod de /
translated: The abode is the place where they abide.

original: de dag kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And that is the state of Buddhahood.

original: de dag gi lus ni ye shes kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lus ni ye shes kyi'o //
translated: Their bodies are of knowledge.

original: de dag gnas pa'i mya ngan 'das pa la gnas pa na /
analyzed: de dag gnas pa'i mya ngan 'das pa la gnas pa na /
translated: When they abide in nirvana, their abode,

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i 'du shes kyis de dag 'phangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i 'du shes kyis de dag 'phangs pa ste /
translated: they are projected by the perception of entering and turning away.

original: gang dag la yang 'gro ba dang // 'ong ba'i 'du shes yod pas so //
analyzed: gang dag la yang 'gro ba dang // 'ong ba'i 'du shes yod pas so //
translated: For those who have the perception of coming and going,

original: rgyal ba'i sras bu ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras bu ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how do they become the sons of the Victor?

original: zhes bya ba des na 'dod chags dang bral ba yang srid pa gsum bcom ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba des na 'dod chags dang bral ba yang srid pa gsum bcom ste /
translated: Thus, those who are free from passion conquer the three worlds.

original: 'gro ba med pa ni sangs rgyas su @38a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa ni sangs rgyas su @38a * //
translated: The non-going is Buddhahood.

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes par blo gros chen pos dgongs par rtag go //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes par blo gros chen pos dgongs par rtag go //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of change‚Äù is to be supplied from the previous verse.üîΩHow do they attain the powers,

original: dbang dang ting nge 'dzin rnams dang // mngon par shes pa ji ltar 'thob //
analyzed: dbang dang ting nge 'dzin rnams dang // mngon par shes pa ji ltar 'thob //
translated: the meditative concentrations, and the superknowledges?üîΩHow do they attain mental stability?

original: ji ltar sems ni mnyam par 'jog / rgyal ba khyu mchog bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar sems ni mnyam par 'jog / rgyal ba khyu mchog bdag la gsungs //
translated: The Victor, the best of leaders, should explain this to me.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba gang la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de la sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzhan gyi don la bskul bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba gang la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de la sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzhan gyi don la bskul bas na /
translated: When a bodhisattva is free from attachment, the Buddhas encourage him to work for the benefit of others, since he has the seed of compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa mngon par shes pa dang / dbang dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams yod par 'gyur ro //üîΩsnying rje'i bag chags kyis gleng ba na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa mngon par shes pa dang / dbang dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams yod par 'gyur ro // snying rje'i bag chags kyis gleng ba na /
translated: Then he attains the superknowledges, the powers, and the meditative concentrations of a bodhisattva.

original: chags pa med pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
translated: When he is urged by the Buddhas to work for the benefit of others, he attains mental stability, because he is free from attachment.

original: sa bon thams cad kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi dge ba'i bag chags spang ste /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi dge ba'i bag chags spang ste /
translated: He abandons the nonvirtuous propensities in the store consciousness, which is the seed of everything,

original: dge ba'i bag chags de dag la yod do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bag chags de dag la yod do //
translated: and he has the virtuous propensities.

original: de bas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: yid dang rnam par shes pa dang // kun gzhi de yang ji lta bur //üîΩsnang la ji ltar 'jug pa lags //
analyzed: yid dang rnam par shes pa dang // kun gzhi de yang ji lta bur // snang la ji ltar 'jug pa lags //
translated: And how is the mind, consciousness, And the ground of all also?üîΩHow do they appear and how do they function?

original: ji ltar snang bas slad du ldog / ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: ji ltar snang bas slad du ldog / ces bya ba nas /
translated: How do they turn back from appearances?

original: mtshan rnams rnam par dgod pa dang // bdag med pa'ang ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnams rnam par dgod pa dang // bdag med pa'ang ji ltar 'gyur // zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: And how is there the arrangement of the marks, And also the selflessness?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa nges pa'i rigs su ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa nges pa'i rigs su ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How is it that the hearers and so forth are of a definite lineage?

original: yong ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yong ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ste /
translated: All sentient beings are said to have the essence of the TathƒÅgata.

original: snod ma yin pa'i sems can gang yang med pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa thams cad kyis thams cad kyang sangs rgyas su dgod par bya bas na /
analyzed: snod ma yin pa'i sems can gang yang med pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa thams cad kyis thams cad kyang sangs rgyas su dgod par bya bas na /
translated: Since there are no sentient beings who are not a vessel, all who arouse the mind of awakening should establish all in buddhahood.

original: de ltar sgrub tu gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dri bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub tu gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dri bar bsam pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is with this thought that MahƒÅmati asks for the teaching.

original: sems tsam du yang ji ltar rig par bya /
analyzed: sems tsam du yang ji ltar rig par bya /
translated: How is it known that there is only mind?

original: phyi'i don du gdon mi za bas sems can rnams kyi tha snyad du 'jug ste /
analyzed: phyi'i don du gdon mi za bas sems can rnams kyi tha snyad du 'jug ste /
translated: Undoubtedly, in terms of external objects, sentient beings engage conventionally.

original: ji ltar phyi'i don ma mchis par de ltar rig pa'i khyad par gyis bsgrub par gsol /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi'i don ma mchis par de ltar rig pa'i khyad par gyis bsgrub par gsol /
translated: Please establish by a special knowledge that external objects do not exist.

original: ji ltar don sun 'byin par 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar don sun 'byin par 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here, how to refute objects:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na /
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na /
translated: Form, when broken down into atoms,

original: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
