translated: The atom has no parts.üîΩAnd what is this appearance?

original: snang ba 'di ci zhes pa dang / gsungs pa /
analyzed: snang ba 'di ci zhes pa dang / gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: phyi yid ngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yid ngos po med par yang //
translated: Even without external objects,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: The mind appears as two.

original: zhes pa ste rab rib dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ltar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ste rab rib dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ltar ro //
translated: Like things such as a mirage, a circle of fire, a dream, an optical illusion, a reflection of the moon in water, a ghost, a double moon, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na /
translated: When?

original: shes rab mnyam @38b par 'jog pas cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab mnyam @38b par 'jog pas cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When, through the equipoise of wisdom, not even the slightest thing is observed, then

original: sems tsam nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems tsam nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: one abides in mind only.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar snang ba de tsam pa de ltar bstan du gsol /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar snang ba de tsam pa de ltar bstan du gsol /
translated: Please teach just that much, the mere appearance of the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, sense spheres, and so on.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don med pa dang / skad cig pas ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyi'i don med pa dang / skad cig pas ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: How can there be the selflessness of phenomena and of persons?

original: de ltar rig pa'i khyad par gyis bsgrub par gsol /
analyzed: de ltar rig pa'i khyad par gyis bsgrub par gsol /
translated: Thus, he requests the establishment by the special knowledge of the non-existence of external objects and of momentariness.

original: sems can ma mchis ji lta bu //
analyzed: sems can ma mchis ji lta bu //
translated: How can there be no sentient beings?

original: kun rdzob bshad pa ji lta bu //üîΩji ltar rtag dang chad pa yi //
analyzed: kun rdzob bshad pa ji lta bu // ji ltar rtag dang chad pa yi //
translated: How can there be the explanation of the conventional?

original: lta ba rab tu 'byung mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lta ba rab tu 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How can there be the arising of the views of eternalism and nihilism?

original: sems can rnam pa gnyis kyang 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: sems can rnam pa gnyis kyang 'byung ba med de /
translated: There are also no two kinds of sentient beings.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis rtag pa yin par yongs su rtog pa'i sems can de med de /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis rtag pa yin par yongs su rtog pa'i sems can de med de /
translated: The sentient being imagined by the tƒ´rthikas to be permanent does not exist,

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not produced, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyis gang la sems can du gdags par bgyi ba yang phyi'i don ma mchis pas na de yang ma mchis par bstan du gsol /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyis gang la sems can du gdags par bgyi ba yang phyi'i don ma mchis pas na de yang ma mchis par bstan du gsol /
translated: Please explain how the sentient being designated by the sense bases such as the eye does not exist because there are no external objects.

original: kun rdzob bshad pa ci lta bu //
analyzed: kun rdzob bshad pa ci lta bu //
translated: How can there be the explanation of the conventional?

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi'i don med na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi'i don med na /
translated: If external objects do not exist,

original: mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don ma rtogs par yang rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'byung zhes par ro //
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don ma rtogs par yang rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'byung zhes par ro //
translated: then, like the experience of a whirling firebrand as a wheel, a variety of consciousnesses would occur without the realization of external objects.

original: ji ltar rtag pa la mngon par chags pa kha cig la thar pa yang bdag rtag pa yod ces pa dang / ji ltar kha cig chad par mngon par chags te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa la mngon par chags pa kha cig la thar pa yang bdag rtag pa yod ces pa dang / ji ltar kha cig chad par mngon par chags te /
translated: Just as some who are attached to permanence say that liberation is the eternal self, and just as some who are attached to annihilation say that liberation is the complete nonexistence of the self,

original: der thar pa thams cad kyis med ces pa dang / 'di rtag pa dang chad par smra ba skad cig ma'i rgyun don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ji bzhin du 'jig bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du bshad du gsol /
analyzed: der thar pa thams cad kyis med ces pa dang / 'di rtag pa dang chad par smra ba skad cig ma'i rgyun don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ji bzhin du 'jig bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du bshad du gsol /
translated: please explain how the proponents of permanence and annihilation do not fall into the errors of permanence and annihilation, and how the proponents of momentariness do not fall into the error of the continuum of the ultimate truth being destroyed.

original: ji ltar khyod dang mu stegs su //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod dang mu stegs su //
translated: How is it that you and the tƒ´rthikas

original: mtshan nyid rnams kyis 'gal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyis 'gal mi 'gyur //
translated: do not contradict each other through your characteristics?

original: sde pa rnams kyang ji lta bur //
analyzed: sde pa rnams kyang ji lta bur //
translated: How is it that the schools

original: ma 'ongs dus na 'byung ba gsungs //
analyzed: ma 'ongs dus na 'byung ba gsungs //
translated: will arise in the future?

original: zhes bya ba la mu stegs can ni grangs can dang / khyad par can la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mu stegs can ni grangs can dang / khyad par can la sogs pa ste /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas are the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, and so on.

original: dbang po dang don gyi khyad par rnams kyis phyi'i don gyi mtshan nyid yongs su rtogs la /üîΩphyi'i don med par yang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la @39a * //
analyzed: dbang po dang don gyi khyad par rnams kyis phyi'i don gyi mtshan nyid yongs su rtogs la / phyi'i don med par yang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la @39a * //
translated: They understand the characteristics of external objects through the differences of sense faculties and objects.üîΩBut if external objects do not exist, how could the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on

original: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar na 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul dang / ji ltar na 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: not contradict the way of the TathƒÅgata?

original: sde pa rnams ni thams cad yod par kun tu rtog ste /
analyzed: sde pa rnams ni thams cad yod par kun tu rtog ste /
translated: The schools imagine everything to exist.

original: thams cad du smra ba pa ni grangs can rnams kyis gsal ba dang / mi gsal bar kun tu rtog pa bzhin du dus gsum du yang bya ba byed pa dang / bya ba mi byed pa yod do zhes so //
analyzed: thams cad du smra ba pa ni grangs can rnams kyis gsal ba dang / mi gsal bar kun tu rtog pa bzhin du dus gsum du yang bya ba byed pa dang / bya ba mi byed pa yod do zhes so //
translated: The SarvƒÅstivƒÅdins say that just as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine the manifest and the unmanifest, so too the activity of the three times exists as the performance of activity and the nonperformance of activity.

original: sa mi ti ba rnams ni gang zag rtag par 'dod do //
analyzed: sa mi ti ba rnams ni gang zag rtag par 'dod do //
translated: The Sammitƒ´yas assert the person to be permanent.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po ba rnams dang / gnas brtan chen po pa rnams kyang rtog pa tha dad pa dang / 'dod pa tha dad pas phye ba phyi'i don du smra ba rnam pa bzhi po yang rnam pa bco brgyad du 'byed pa'i sde pa rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ji ltar 'byung /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po ba rnams dang / gnas brtan chen po pa rnams kyang rtog pa tha dad pa dang / 'dod pa tha dad pas phye ba phyi'i don du smra ba rnam pa bzhi po yang rnam pa bco brgyad du 'byed pa'i sde pa rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ji ltar 'byung /
translated: Likewise, the four schools of the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika, SthaviranikƒÅya, VibhajyavƒÅda, and Sarv√¢stivƒÅda, which are divided by different ideas and different assertions, will in the future divide into eighteen schools.

original: blo gros chen pos dgongs pa ni gang gis de lta bur smra bar mi 'gyur ba'i theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig bshad du gsol zhes par ro //
analyzed: blo gros chen pos dgongs pa ni gang gis de lta bur smra bar mi 'gyur ba'i theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig bshad du gsol zhes par ro //
translated: MahƒÅmati‚Äôs thought is, ‚ÄúPlease explain only the MahƒÅyƒÅna, so that it will not be like that.‚Äù

original: ji slad ji ltar stong pa nyid //
analyzed: ji slad ji ltar stong pa nyid //
translated: Why is it emptiness?üîΩHow is it momentary destruction?

original: ji ltar khyod kyi skad cig 'jig / snying po ji ltar 'byung ba lags //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyi skad cig 'jig / snying po ji ltar 'byung ba lags //
translated: How does the essence arise?

original: ji ltar 'jig rten byed ma mchis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten byed ma mchis //
translated: How is it that the world is not created?

original: zhes bya ba ni lta ba thams cad spong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lta ba thams cad spong ba ste /
translated: This is the abandonment of all views.

original: chos la bdag med pa yongs su mchis pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par bya ba ni shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yongs su mchis pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par bya ba ni shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-existence of a self in phenomena, the ultimate truth which is to be known as non-dual, is to be known by wisdom in a manner of non-apprehension.

original: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
translated: Whatever exists is momentary.

original: se gol gyi sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra bzhin no //
translated: Like the sound of a finger snap.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med par de ltar thams cad mkhyen par skad cig par sgrub tu gsol /
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med par de ltar thams cad mkhyen par skad cig par sgrub tu gsol /
translated: Since permanence is contradictory with the performance of an action gradually or instantaneously, it is non-existent like the horn of a rabbit. Thus, I request you to establish that all-knowingness is momentary.

original: bshes pa'i shes pa ni log pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: bshes pa'i shes pa ni log pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of a friend is a mistaken cognition.

original: de las rtag par yid ches bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las rtag par yid ches bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: One cannot have confidence in it as permanent.

original: skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad na phyir skyes pa bzhin du 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan skyes pa la shes pa 'jug go //
analyzed: skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad na phyir skyes pa bzhin du 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan skyes pa la shes pa 'jug go //
translated: When hair, grass, etc. are cut, the cognition engages in the arising of another similar thing, like the regrowth of hair.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po par rab tu chud pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po par rab tu chud pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By realizing the selflessness of phenomena and persons, one will attain the full comprehension that all sentient beings have the essence of the TathƒÅgata.

original: 'jig rten byed pa ma mchis pa ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa dang / byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten byed pa ma mchis pa ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa dang / byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world is not created because of the non-connection of the grasper, the grasped, the expression, the expressed, the produced, the producer, the action, and the actor.

original: ji ltar don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par chud la @39b yod pa dang / med par brjod par mi bya ba kun tu rtog pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba de ltar khong du chud par mdzad du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs pa'i don du rtag go //
analyzed: ji ltar don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par chud la @39b yod pa dang / med par brjod par mi bya ba kun tu rtog pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba de ltar khong du chud par mdzad du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs pa'i don du rtag go //
translated: Please cause me to understand the ultimate truth, which is non-dual, not to be expressed as existent or non-existent, and free from conceptualization, just as it is.

original: ji ste 'jig rten smig rgyu 'dra //
analyzed: ji ste 'jig rten smig rgyu 'dra //
translated: If the world is like a mirage,üîΩlike a gandharva city, a mirage,

original: dri za 'dra dang smig rgyu dang // chu yi zla ba 'dra ba yang //
analyzed: dri za 'dra dang smig rgyu dang // chu yi zla ba 'dra ba yang //
translated: and like the moon in water,

original: ci yi slad pa bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ci yi slad pa bdag la gsungs //
translated: please tell me why.

original: zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / chu zla dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / dgon pa'i smig rgyu la sogs pa chur 'khrul par snang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / chu zla dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / dgon pa'i smig rgyu la sogs pa chur 'khrul par snang ba bzhin du /
translated: Like a dream, an illusion, the moon in water, a gandharva city, and a mirage in the desert that appears to be water,

original: 'jig rten pa yang thog ma dang tha mar stong pa dang / dbus su gnyis kyi rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang thog ma dang tha mar stong pa dang / dbus su gnyis kyi rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ba ste /
translated: The world is empty in the beginning and end, and in the middle it is empty of the nature of duality.

original: 'khrugs pa'i mthu dang mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi dbang dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par las 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa'i mthu dang mnyam par mi 'du ba'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi dbang dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par las 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
translated: The world appears in various ways due to the power of agitation, ignorance of non-engagement, the power of karma, the power of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mindstreams, and specific conditions.

original: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang bas gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom pa dang phra ba phyogs kyi char dbye bas bye ba na stong par mthong ba ni /
analyzed: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang bas gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom pa dang phra ba phyogs kyi char dbye bas bye ba na stong par mthong ba ni /
translated: When one follows the wisdom of hearing, reflection, and meditation, and sees the coarse and subtle objects of knowledge as empty, divided into directional parts,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag pa'i rig pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par mi rtog par mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas spyir sgra'i don du sgro btags te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag pa'i rig pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par rnam par mi rtog par mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas spyir sgra'i don du sgro btags te /
translated: one will realize the non-dual ultimate truth, the correct knowledge that is non-conceptual regarding entities and non-entities. Thus the Omniscient One generally superimposes the meaning of the term.

original: 'jig rten gyi glo bar chud par mdzad du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi glo bar chud par mdzad du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs pa'o //
translated: Please explain the meaning of this to us.

original: byang chub yan lag ji ltar ces //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag ji ltar ces //
translated: How are the limbs of enlightenment?

original: byang chub phyogs rnams ci las 'byung //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs rnams ci las 'byung //
translated: How do the factors of enlightenment arise?üîΩHow do countries become disturbed and bloody,

original: yul 'khrug pa dang khrag khrug dang // ji ltar srid pa lta bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yul 'khrug pa dang khrag khrug dang // ji ltar srid pa lta bar 'gyur //
translated: and how do they become inclined to existence?üîΩHere, the limbs of enlightenment are the limb of perfect mindfulness, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa gang dag byang chub kyi phyir yan lag byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gang dag yang sum cu rtsa bdun rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa gang dag byang chub kyi phyir yan lag byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gang dag yang sum cu rtsa bdun rnams so //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are the thirty-seven factors such as the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: gang dag yang mu stegs can rnams kyis rtsod pa dang 'thab pas phan tshun du khrag khrug gi srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i chos dang yul 'khrugs nas bsregs pa dang / rgol ba dang / khro ba la sogs pa mchod sbyin pa po dang /
analyzed: gang dag yang mu stegs can rnams kyis rtsod pa dang 'thab pas phan tshun du khrag khrug gi srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i chos dang yul 'khrugs nas bsregs pa dang / rgol ba dang / khro ba la sogs pa mchod sbyin pa po dang /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas argue and fight with each other, killing each other in bloody battles, and so on. The countries are disturbed and burned. They quarrel and are angry. They perform sacrifices.

original: dran pa po dang / brtag pa po rnams kyis chos su kun tu brtags pa rnal 'byor pa @40a * //
analyzed: dran pa po dang / brtag pa po rnams kyis chos su kun tu brtags pa rnal 'byor pa @40a * //
translated: The one who remembers and the one who investigates, the yogis and the ones who are to be taught, the ones who are pacified and the ones who are not pacified, how could they engage in the cognition of the two aspects?

original: dang ; tshe lan pa po rnams kyi zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa las kyang ji ltar na 'jug / ji ltar srid ba lta bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dang ; tshe lan pa po rnams kyi zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa las kyang ji ltar na 'jug / ji ltar srid ba lta bar 'gyur //
translated: How could they enter into existence?

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩmtho ris 'dod pas mchod par bya //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / mtho ris 'dod pas mchod par bya //
translated: This is the request.

original: zhes pas na /
analyzed: zhes pas na /
translated: Since it is said, ‚ÄúWorship through the desire for the higher realms,‚Äù

original: gang gis phyi'i don du mngon par chags pas 'khrug pa de dag ldog par 'gyur bar gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa bdud rtsi'i chos de bstan du gsol /
analyzed: gang gis phyi'i don du mngon par chags pas 'khrug pa de dag ldog par 'gyur bar gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa bdud rtsi'i chos de bstan du gsol /
translated: therefore, since those who are agitated by attachment to external objects will be stopped, please teach the nectar of the Dharma of nondual ultimate truth.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Unborn and unceasing,

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog 'dra //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog 'dra //
translated: like a sky flower,

original: 'jig rten ji ltar thugs su chud //
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar thugs su chud //
translated: how is the world understood?

original: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs //
translated: How is it taught without syllables?

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / skyed pa dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po la mngon par 'brel bas ma skyes pas na ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / skyed pa dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po la mngon par 'brel bas ma skyes pas na ma skyes pa'o //
translated: This is because it is not produced by the connection of production, producer, action, and agent.

original: skad cig pa'i dngos po ma gtogs par skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa gzhan pa'i chos med de /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i dngos po ma gtogs par skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa gzhan pa'i chos med de /
translated: Apart from momentary things, there is no other thing such as production, duration, and cessation.

original: des na ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: des na ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is unceased.

original: ji ltar dbu sa las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu sa las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamak

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If production were conditioned,

original: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rigs te //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rigs te //
translated: It would have the three characteristics.

original: de ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: de ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: If production were unconditioned,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
translated: How could it be a characteristic of the conditioned?

original: des na bdag med pa gnyis la yang skye ba gang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med do //
analyzed: des na bdag med pa gnyis la yang skye ba gang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med do //
translated: Therefore, in the two kinds of selflessness, there is no other thing such as production, duration, and cessation.

original: chos la bdag med pa la yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams ma skyes pa ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams ma skyes pa ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: In the selflessness of things, the aspects of the two kinds of self, which are the nature of the relative, are unproduced, like dreams, illusions, and so forth.

original: de bas na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du shes rab kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa stong ste /
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du shes rab kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa stong ste /
translated: Therefore, like a sky flower, wisdom is empty of the aspect of duality.

original: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten thugs su chud do //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten thugs su chud do //
translated: In this way, the world is understood by the mind in a manner that is not an object of observation.

original: yi ge med pa ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par yang mngon pa'i tshul gyis spyir sgra dang don du skyed de /
analyzed: yi ge med pa ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par yang mngon pa'i tshul gyis spyir sgra dang don du skyed de /
translated: The absence of letters is the ultimate truth, which is not a duality, and is not generated in general as a sound and meaning by the manner of manifest knowledge.

original: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bshad par mdzad pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bshad par mdzad pa /
translated: The characteristics of the Dharma that are dual and nondual are explained.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa de rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyi bshad du gsol //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa de rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyi bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain nonconceptual wisdom to those who have conceptual wisdom.

original: ci yis rnam par mi rtog 'gyur //üîΩji ltar nam mkha' 'dra ba lags //
analyzed: ci yis rnam par mi rtog 'gyur // ji ltar nam mkha' 'dra ba lags //
translated: By what means does one become nonconceptual?üîΩHow is it like space?

original: de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa du //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa du //
translated: How many kinds of suchness are there?

original: sems dang pha rol phyin pa du //
analyzed: sems dang pha rol phyin pa du //
translated: How many perfections are there?

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na /
translated: This is asked when

original: shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra ba phyogs su dbye bas phye ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra ba phyogs su dbye bas phye ste /
translated: the objects of knowledge are divided into coarse and subtle.

original: cung zad @40b kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chud pa mi sems shing rnam par mi rtog pa dang / chags pa med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cung zad @40b kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chud pa mi sems shing rnam par mi rtog pa dang / chags pa med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not observe even the slightest thing, at that time one does not think of anything, is non-conceptual, and becomes like space, which is without attachment.

original: de bzhin nyid la rnam pa gnyis yod do /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la rnam pa gnyis yod do /
translated: Suchness has two aspects:

original: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa ste /
translated: with defilements and without defilements.

original: 'khor bar 'khrul ba'i rnam pa dang mi gnyis pa'i thar par stong pa'o //üîΩsems zhes bya ba /üîΩsems kyi kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khrul ba'i rnam pa dang mi gnyis pa'i thar par stong pa'o // sems zhes bya ba / sems kyi kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: It is empty as liberation, which is not different from the aspect of delusion in sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩThe mind is the all-base consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: The mind that thinks ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the mental consciousness.

original: gang gi yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That which apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //üîΩzhes pa'o // dbang po dang don med par yang sems nyid ni rmi lam gyi dus na /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya // zhes pa'o // dbang po dang don med par yang sems nyid ni rmi lam gyi dus na /
translated: is called the consciousnesses.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa rnams su so sor snang ba ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa rnams su so sor snang ba ni /
translated: Even without sense faculties and objects, the mind itself appears as various aspects of eye consciousness and so forth in dreams.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and the appearance of the place

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: arise from the all-base.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: The eight and nine consciousnesses are also like that.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: like the waves of the ocean.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni theg pa chen po la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni theg pa chen po la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
translated: The perfections are the ten perfections in the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa drug klog go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa drug klog go //
translated: The ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle is the six perfections.

original: theg pa chen po ni thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The Great Vehicle is characterized by the distinction of means, aspiration, power, and wisdom.

original: de'i phyir de ltar shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / smon lam dang / sems can gyi don du spyad par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi khyad par ni nyan thos kyi theg pa yang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / smon lam dang / sems can gyi don du spyad par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi khyad par ni nyan thos kyi theg pa yang ma gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the distinction of the Buddha's path, which is to be practiced for the sake of sentient beings with wisdom, skillful means, aspiration, and so on, is not taught in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ye shes ni byang chub gsum gyi yang thun mong pa lags te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ye shes ni byang chub gsum gyi yang thun mong pa lags te /
translated: The knowledge of the four noble truths is common to all three enlightenments.

original: des na sangs rgyas kyi lam sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par rnams kyis theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kyi lam sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par rnams kyis theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, the Great Vehicle is the distinction of the stages and perfections of the Buddha's path.

original: mdo sde rgya che pa nyan thos rnams kyis khong du ma chud pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa kha cig der 'jug pas na bshad du gsol /
analyzed: mdo sde rgya che pa nyan thos rnams kyis khong du ma chud pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa kha cig der 'jug pas na bshad du gsol /
translated: The S≈´tra is extensive, and the ≈örƒÅvakas do not understand it. Some have attained the liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, so please explain it.

original: gang gis sa yi rim par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis sa yi rim par 'gyur //
translated: What is the sequence of the stages?

original: snang med rgyu ba gang zhig lags //
analyzed: snang med rgyu ba gang zhig lags //
translated: What is the movement without appearance?

original: gang gis bdag med rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gang gis bdag med rnam pa gnyis //
translated: What is the twofold selflessness?üîΩ How is the object of knowledge purified?

original: shes bya ji ltar rnam par 'dag / ces bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa ni sa dang por rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya ji ltar rnam par 'dag / ces bya ba ni chos la bdag med pa ni sa dang por rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is realized on the first stage.

original: de ltar ni gnyis su mi snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i khyad par kyang ji ltar na 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar ni gnyis su mi snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i khyad par kyang ji ltar na 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how does the distinction of the stages of samƒÅdhi without the appearance of duality occur?

original: ra ba dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang / @41a * //
analyzed: ra ba dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang / @41a * //
translated: It occurs through the sequence of weak, medium, and strong,

original: g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i rim pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i rim pas 'gyur ro //
translated: and through the sequence of moving and unmoving.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par bdag med pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par bdag med pa gnyis te /
translated: The twofold selflessness is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyis 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du thos pa dang sems pa'i ye shes kyis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa so sor snang bas gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyis 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du thos pa dang sems pa'i ye shes kyis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa so sor snang bas gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the wisdom of hearing and reflection individually illuminates the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc., and the selflessness of persons.

original: ci shes bya ji ltar rnam par 'dag / ces bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci shes bya ji ltar rnam par 'dag / ces bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is the object of knowledge purified?

original: gang gi tshe shes par bya ba shes rab kyis cung zad mi dmigs pa de'i tshe shes bya 'dag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes par bya ba shes rab kyis cung zad mi dmigs pa de'i tshe shes bya 'dag go //
translated: When the object of knowledge is not perceived by wisdom, then the object of knowledge is purified.

original: shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa dang / snying rjes mi dmigs te ;
analyzed: shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa dang / snying rjes mi dmigs te ;
translated: It is not perceived by wisdom, and it is not perceived by compassion.

original: des na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel ba na /
analyzed: des na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel ba na /
translated: Therefore, when the accumulation of merit and wisdom increases through the concentration with appearance and without appearance, the stages, and the perfections,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gzhan gyi don 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gzhan gyi don 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the benefit of others through omniscience increases.

original: de ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhu ba gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhu ba gsol nas /
translated: Thus, having made the supramundane request,

original: gzhan gyi don du 'jig rten pa dang thun mong pa'ang gsol bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du 'jig rten pa dang thun mong pa'ang gsol bar byed do //
translated: He also recites the mundane and supramundane prayers for the benefit of others.üîΩThe Lord is born in the families of

original: mgon po ye shes rnam pa dang // tshul khrims sems can 'byung gnas du //
analyzed: mgon po ye shes rnam pa dang // tshul khrims sems can 'byung gnas du //
translated: knowledge, morality, beings,

original: nor bu mu tig gser 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: nor bu mu tig gser 'byung ba'i //
translated: gems, pearls, and gold,

original: rigs rnams su yis rab tu phyung //
analyzed: rigs rnams su yis rab tu phyung //
translated: and is endowed with the best of everything.üîΩHe is born in the families of knowledge, morality, beings, gems, pearls, and gold, and is endowed with the best of everything.

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa rnam par shes pa rnam pa du ma zhu bar byed pa ni shes rab dang / bzo dang / sgyu rtsal mtha' med pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa rnam par shes pa rnam pa du ma zhu bar byed pa ni shes rab dang / bzo dang / sgyu rtsal mtha' med pa rnams so //
translated: In the families of knowledge, he is born in the families of the most eminent of mathematicians, astronomers, physicians, and artists.

original: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems par byed pa grangs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems par byed pa grangs med pa rnams so //

original: sems can 'byung gnas ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las mu med pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can 'byung gnas ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las mu med pa rnams so //

original: de bzhin du rin po che'i 'byung gnas rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rin po che'i 'byung gnas rnams te /

original: sems can gyi las rnam pa sna tshogs las 'byung ba dang / de dag lta bar bya ba'i gtsug lag kyang dpag tu med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa so sor snang ba dbye ba phye ba na /

analyzed: mngon par brjod pa skye'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bstan du gsol /
translated: Please explain, O Omniscient One, how verbal expressions arise.üîΩThe world of sentient beings and the world of their physical environment are created by the power of the karma of sentient beings.üîΩThe world of sentient beings and the world of their physical environment are created by the power of the karma of sentient beings.

analyzed: rigs dang rigs ma yin pa shes rab kyis dang / blang ba sems can rnams kyi las kyis kun bskyed pa las 'ga' zhig mkhas pa'i rigs su 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas de skad sgrub tu gsol /
translated: Some are born into the family of the wise due to the karma of sentient beings to be guided.

original: tshigs bcad rkyang pa ji lta bu //
analyzed: tshigs bcad rkyang pa ji lta bu //

original: rig pa rnam pa du zhig @42b mchis //
analyzed: rig pa rnam pa du zhig @42b mchis //

original: bshad pa dag kyang ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad pa dag kyang ji ltar 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gug skyed du 'jug pa dang / yi ger 'jug ba tshigs su bcad par sbyor bar bzhag pa rnam pa gnyis te /

original: ya rabs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: ya rabs kyi tshig go //

original: de las gang yang 'phags pa ni ya rabs te /
analyzed: de las gang yang 'phags pa ni ya rabs te /

original: de de ni ma rabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de de ni ma rabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //

original: rig pa la rnam pa mang po yod de /
analyzed: rig pa la rnam pa mang po yod de /

original: gtsug lag dang rang bzo'i sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag dang rang bzo'i sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the treatises and one's own imagination.

original: sgra'i don du brtag pa ni /
analyzed: sgra'i don du brtag pa ni /

original: sgra'i don du ji ltar sbyor bar 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzo rnams kyis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don du ji ltar sbyor bar 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzo rnams kyis sbyar bar bya'o //

original: pho nya rjes su 'gro la sogs //
analyzed: pho nya rjes su 'gro la sogs //
translated: The messenger, the follower, and so forth,

original: gtso bo dar ba bzhin du ni //
analyzed: gtso bo dar ba bzhin du ni //
