original: lnga yi dus dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: lnga yi dus dang ldan pa ste //
translated: possessing the time of the five,

original: shin tu bshad med 'jug pa nyid //
analyzed: shin tu bshad med 'jug pa nyid //
translated: is itself the entry into the utterly inexpressible.

original: shes rab can spobs pa thob pa rnams kyis bshad pa 'di ni mtha' med pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes rab can spobs pa thob pa rnams kyis bshad pa 'di ni mtha' med pa nyid de /
translated: This explanation by the wise who have attained eloquence is limitless.

original: ji ltar smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar smras pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: brgya las dpa' bo gcig cig 'byung //
analyzed: brgya las dpa' bo gcig cig 'byung //
translated: From a hundred, a single hero arises;

original: stong rnams las kyang mkhas pa gcig / stong phrag brgya las smra bde gcig / sbyin stong bod pa 'byung ngam min //
analyzed: stong rnams las kyang mkhas pa gcig / stong phrag brgya las smra bde gcig / sbyin stong bod pa 'byung ngam min //
translated: from a thousand, a single scholar; from a hundred thousand, a single eloquent speaker; from a thousand givers, a single one arises or not.

original: skom dang kha zas sna tshogs dang // ji ltar 'khrig pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skom dang kha zas sna tshogs dang // ji ltar 'khrig pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: How will there be various kinds of drinks and food, and how will there be sexual intercourse?

original: rgyal po 'khor los sgyur ba dang // khams kyi bdag po ji ltar lags //
analyzed: rgyal po 'khor los sgyur ba dang // khams kyi bdag po ji ltar lags //
translated: How are the universal monarch and the lord of the realm?

original: zhes bya ba ni las rnam pa sna tshogs las sems can rnams kyi skom dang zas rjes su mthun pa bzhin du sna tshogs du mar dmigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las rnam pa sna tshogs las sems can rnams kyi skom dang zas rjes su mthun pa bzhin du sna tshogs du mar dmigs so //
translated: The various kinds of karma of sentient beings are observed to be various kinds of food and drink, in accordance with their karma.

original: 'khrig pa ni rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dang / g-yem bag gi kha zas la sogs pa las kyang kun tu brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrig pa ni rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dang / g-yem bag gi kha zas la sogs pa las kyang kun tu brtag pa'o //
translated: Sexual intercourse is imagined to be the opposite of impermanence, beauty, and purity, and from the food of sexual intercourse, and so on.üîΩThose who are free from attachment do not observe the three circles, because they meditate on impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and emptiness. Therefore, the King of SamƒÅdhi says:

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / stong par bsgoms pas dkyil 'khor gsum du mi dmigs pas na gang chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis chags par 'gyur ba des chos de mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / stong par bsgoms pas dkyil 'khor gsum du mi dmigs pas na gang chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis chags par 'gyur ba des chos de mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not see that dharma by which one would become attached, to whom one would become attached, or to whom one would become attached.‚Äù

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med ba yongs su shes par 'dod pa'i longs spyod la mos pa med kyang gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi dbang thob pas las ji bzhin pa dang mthun par sa thams cad kyi 'khor los sgyur ba gling bzhi'i bdag po'am /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med ba yongs su shes par 'dod pa'i longs spyod la mos pa med kyang gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi dbang thob pas las ji bzhin pa dang mthun par sa thams cad kyi 'khor los sgyur ba gling bzhi'i bdag po'am /
translated: Even though they have no interest in enjoyments, they have gained power over prayers of aspiration for the sake of others and so, in accordance with their past karma, they are cakravartins on all the levels, lords of the four continents.

original: @43a * // khams kyi bdag po'i rgyal po'i thabs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @43a * // khams kyi bdag po'i rgyal po'i thabs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Although they have no interest in enjoyments, they have obtained power over prayers for the sake of others and so they act in accordance with karma, as rulers of all levels, as cakravartins who rule the four continents or as kings who rule a single continent.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sar stobs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sar stobs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba mi 'byung zhing /
translated: On the level of Perfect Joy, bodhisattvas are not cakravartins with power,

original: phal cher gling bzhi'i dbang por 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phal cher gling bzhi'i dbang por 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: but for the most part they become cakravartins who rule the four continents.

original: sems can dge ba bcu'i lam du 'god par byed /
analyzed: sems can dge ba bcu'i lam du 'god par byed /
translated: They set beings on the path of the ten positive actions

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: and they help them to complete the transcendent perfection of generosity.

original: zas 'dod pa la zas /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa la zas /
translated: They give food to those who want foodüîΩand so on.

original: skom 'dod pa la skom dang / de bzhin du gos dang mal stan la sogs pa ci 'dod pa bzhin du kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad la thams cad sbyin no //
analyzed: skom 'dod pa la skom dang / de bzhin du gos dang mal stan la sogs pa ci 'dod pa bzhin du kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad la thams cad sbyin no //
translated: To those who desire drink, he gives drink; and likewise, he gives them all, without exception, whatever they desire, such as clothing, bedding, etc.

original: ji ltar rgyal srid bsrung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal srid bsrung bar 'gyur //
translated: How does he protect the kingdom?

original: lha yi ris la rnam pa du //
analyzed: lha yi ris la rnam pa du //
translated: In how many ways does he protect the gods?

original: sa dang skar tshogs ci las gyur //
analyzed: sa dang skar tshogs ci las gyur //
translated: How do the earth and the hosts of stars come to be?

original: nyi zla gnyis kyang ji lta bu //
analyzed: nyi zla gnyis kyang ji lta bu //
translated: And how are there two, the sun and moon?

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' thugs rjes gzhan gyi don mdzad pa rgyal srid ji ltar srung bar byed ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' thugs rjes gzhan gyi don mdzad pa rgyal srid ji ltar srung bar byed ce na /
translated: How does the Bodhisattva, out of compassion, accomplish the aims of others? He protects the kingdom.

original: gnod pa'i sems can skrod par byed de /
analyzed: gnod pa'i sems can skrod par byed de /
translated: He banishes those beings who are harmful.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Bodhisattva Collection:

original: sems can mang po la gnod cing /
analyzed: sems can mang po la gnod cing /
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of those beings who are harmful to many beings

original: dkon mchog gsum la mi dben pa de la phan pa'i phyir snying rje'i sems nye bar bzhag ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mi dben pa de la phan pa'i phyir snying rje'i sems nye bar bzhag ste /
translated: and who are not devoted to the Three Jewels, he generates the mind of compassion and,

original: chad pa'i gtsos bcad na yang ltung ba'ang med la bsod nams kyang cher 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa'i gtsos bcad na yang ltung ba'ang med la bsod nams kyang cher 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: even though he punishes them with the rod, he has no downfall and his merit increases greatly.‚Äù

original: bsod nams can rnams bsod nams ji bzhin pa de bzhin du rnam pa du ma'i yul gyi ris su 'byed par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams can rnams bsod nams ji bzhin pa de bzhin du rnam pa du ma'i yul gyi ris su 'byed par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have merit are born in accordance with their merit, in the various realms of the world.

original: lha'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i 'jig rten gyi mgon po de dag gang gis dmod mo dor ba dang / phan pa byed pa'i mthu can du 'gyur zhing sa dang skar tshogs 'byung ba so sor snang bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i 'jig rten gyi mgon po de dag gang gis dmod mo dor ba dang / phan pa byed pa'i mthu can du 'gyur zhing sa dang skar tshogs 'byung ba so sor snang bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is a concentration by which the world-protectors who are born in the world of the gods, by a mere wish, can create the power to curse and to bless, and can cause the earth and the hosts of stars to appear.

original: yang na nyi ma dang zla ba dag las rnam pa du mas thams cad du 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na nyi ma dang zla ba dag las rnam pa du mas thams cad du 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: Or else, like the sun and moon, they can create the power to pervade everywhere in many ways.

original: thar ba rnam pa du zhig mchis //
analyzed: thar ba rnam pa du zhig mchis //
translated: How many kinds of liberation are there?

original: rnal 'byor ldan pa rnam pa du //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ldan pa rnam pa du //
translated: How many kinds of yogis are there?

original: slob ma rnam pa du zhig mchis //
analyzed: slob ma rnam pa du zhig mchis //
translated: How many kinds of disciples are there?

original: slob dpon du yang ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: slob dpon du yang ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: And how many kinds of masters are there?

original: zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Liberation is twofold:

original: phung po'i lhag ma lus pa dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pas 'byed pas phye ba'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma lus pa dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pas 'byed pas phye ba'o //
translated: with remainder of the aggregates and without remainder.

original: mu stegs can rnams ni mi'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal dgrol ba'i mtshan nyid pas na lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thar ba yin no zhes kun tu @43b rtog go //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams ni mi'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal dgrol ba'i mtshan nyid pas na lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thar ba yin no zhes kun tu @43b rtog go //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas imagine that birth in the divine world is liberation, since it is characterized by the liberation from the suffering of the human world.

original: kha cig gis ni bdag 'ba' zhig zhi ba dang / ro gcig pa sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bdag 'ba' zhig zhi ba dang / ro gcig pa sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Some say that the yogi, who is the sole self, is peaceful and of one taste.

original: tshangs pa'i bdag nyid mi gnyis dang / sgra'i tshangs pa mi gnyis dang / yod pa mi gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa mi gnyis dang / bdag gi rang bzhin tshor ba dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / khyab pa dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bdag nyid mi gnyis dang / sgra'i tshangs pa mi gnyis dang / yod pa mi gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa mi gnyis dang / bdag gi rang bzhin tshor ba dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / khyab pa dang /
translated: Brahman is nondual, the sound of Brahman is nondual, existence is nondual, consciousness is nondual, the nature of the self is with or without feeling, and is all-pervading.

original: rdul tsam dang / rnam pa gcig pa dang / rnam pa du ma pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rdul tsam dang / rnam pa gcig pa dang / rnam pa du ma pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is atomic, of one aspect, and of many aspects.

original: rnal 'byor ldan pa la ni rnam pa mang po yod de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ldan pa la ni rnam pa mang po yod de /
translated: The yogi has many aspects.

original: thog ma pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi lam la gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor skyes pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi lam la gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor skyes pa'o //
translated: The beginner, the one abiding on the path of yoga, and the one who has generated yoga.

original: de gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor dbye bas 'byed cing sngags dang rgyud kyi ye shes kyi mchog thob pa /
analyzed: de gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor dbye bas 'byed cing sngags dang rgyud kyi ye shes kyi mchog thob pa /
translated: He is distinguished by the division of the yoga of non-duality into two, and he has attained the supreme knowledge of mantra and tantra.

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: He is the lord of yoga, omniscient,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par rtsa ba nas bton pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par rtsa ba nas bton pa /
translated: and has completely and totally uprooted the afflictive, karmic, and cognitive obscurations along with their habitual tendencies.

original: thugs rje dang shes rab kyis gzhan don spyod pas dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par rnams kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje dang shes rab kyis gzhan don spyod pas dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par rnams kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: He is the perfection of the accumulations of merit and wisdom through the conduct for the benefit of others with compassion and wisdom.

original: slob ma thog ma pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma thog ma pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: The first disciple is diligent in listening and reflection.

original: bar ma ni rig pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma ni rig pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The intermediate one is one who has perfected the view.

original: mkhas pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la rab tu zhugs pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad par bya ba la 'grus pa dang / snying rje dang shes rab kyis sems can thams cad la phan par dga' zhing gang rnal 'byor gyi dbang po yin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la rab tu zhugs pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad par bya ba la 'grus pa dang / snying rje dang shes rab kyis sems can thams cad la phan par dga' zhing gang rnal 'byor gyi dbang po yin pa'o //
translated: The wise one is one who has entered into right wisdom, who is diligent in exhausting the sufferings of cyclic existence, who delights in benefiting all sentient beings with compassion and wisdom, and who is a lord of yogins.

original: slob dpon yang dag pa'i gtsug lag gi man ngag ston pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi lam du gzud par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi khyad par skyes pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon zad pa dang /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag pa'i gtsug lag gi man ngag ston pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi lam du gzud par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi khyad par skyes pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon zad pa dang /
translated: The master is one who teaches the instructions of the true scriptures, who causes entry into the path of yoga, who produces the special wisdom, who is able to benefit self and other, who has exhausted the faults of afflictions such as attachment,

original: snying rje can dang shes rab kyi blang ba dang / dor ba'i dngos po shes pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje can dang shes rab kyi blang ba dang / dor ba'i dngos po shes pa'o //
translated: who is compassionate, who knows the objects to be adopted and rejected with wisdom, and who is skilled in the means of accomplishing the two goals.

original: sangs rgyas rnam ba du zhig lags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam ba du zhig lags //
translated: How many kinds of buddhas are there?

original: skyes pa'i rabs la rnam pa du //üîΩbdud la rnam pa du zhig mchis //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs la rnam pa du // bdud la rnam pa du zhig mchis //
translated: How many kinds of jƒÅtakas are there?üîΩHow many kinds of mƒÅras are there?

original: ya mtshan can yang rnam pa du //
analyzed: ya mtshan can yang rnam pa du //
translated: How many kinds of wonders are there?

original: zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum char gyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas na shes rab rab dang / 'bring @44a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum char gyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas na shes rab rab dang / 'bring @44a * //
translated: The word best is used because of the difference in the degree of wisdom, which is best, middling, and lowest, in the three vehicles, and because of the difference in the degree of enlightenment, which is best, middling, and lowest, in the three vehicles, and because of the difference in the degree of enlightenment, which is best, middling, and lowest, in the three vehicles.

original: dang ; tha ma'i bye brag gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab la brten te sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //üîΩmu stegs can tshangs par smra ba bo rnams kyis bya ba ni dag ba'i sangs rgyas ni grol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; tha ma'i bye brag gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab la brten te sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro // mu stegs can tshangs par smra ba bo rnams kyis bya ba ni dag ba'i sangs rgyas ni grol zhes pa'o //
translated: The word best is used because of the difference in the degree of wisdom, which is best, middling, and lowest, in the three vehicles, and because of the difference in the degree of enlightenment, which is best, middling, and lowest, in the three vehicles, and because of the difference in the degree of enlightenment, which is best, middling, and lowest, in the three vehicles.üîΩThe Brahmins, who are Tirthikas, say that the Buddha is liberated.

original: zhi ba pa rnams smra ba ni sangs rgyas ba sangs rgyas par byed pa ni sangs rgyas zhes so //
analyzed: zhi ba pa rnams smra ba ni sangs rgyas ba sangs rgyas par byed pa ni sangs rgyas zhes so //
translated: The Samkhyas say that the Buddha is enlightened.

original: sangs ma rgyas pa ni 'khor ba can no //
analyzed: sangs ma rgyas pa ni 'khor ba can no //
translated: The unenlightened are those who are in cyclic existence.

original: rig pa'i dbang po dang tshogs kyi dbang po la sogs pa lha chen po rnal 'byor gyi dbang po ni sangs rgyas par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i dbang po dang tshogs kyi dbang po la sogs pa lha chen po rnal 'byor gyi dbang po ni sangs rgyas par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The great gods, such as Indra and Prajapati, are called enlightened.

original: sangs rgyas ni zhi ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni zhi ba ste /
translated: The Buddha is peaceful.

original: des na smras pa /üîΩlus can cha bcas shes par bya //
analyzed: des na smras pa / lus can cha bcas shes par bya //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe embodied should be known as having parts.

original: rig pa cha dang cha med rnams //
analyzed: rig pa cha dang cha med rnams //
translated: The parts and partless are the knowers.

original: cha med zhi ba de kho na //
analyzed: cha med zhi ba de kho na //
translated: It is peace, partless, and the same

original: kun gyi steng du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun gyi steng du gnas pa'o //
translated: in all.üîΩThe JƒÅtakas are the infinite distinctions of the perfections of generosity,üîΩmorality, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom, skillful means, aspiration,

original: skyes pa'i rabs ni sbyin pa dang // tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par du mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs ni sbyin pa dang // tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par du mtha' med pa'o //
translated: power, and pristine awareness.

original: bdud la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bdud la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of mƒÅras:

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
translated: the mƒÅra of afflictions, the mƒÅra of the aggregates, the mƒÅra of the Lord of Death, and the mƒÅra of the divine son.

original: ya mtshan la rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: ya mtshan la rnam pa mang ste /
translated: There are many kinds of wonders:

original: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba rnams dang / dbang po dod pa dang / dbang po ma dod pa rnams dang / khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sar lus 'dor ba dang / bkra shis pa dang / bkra shis pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba rnams dang / dbang po dod pa dang / dbang po ma dod pa rnams dang / khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sar lus 'dor ba dang / bkra shis pa dang / bkra shis pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: theists and non-theists, the sharp-sensed and the dull-sensed, bathing, fire offerings, laughter, throwing oneself into ravines, and the concepts of auspicious and inauspicious.

original: 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / 'o ma dang / 'o ma ma yin pa dang / 'bras dang / chu dang / lo ma za ba dang / thal bas byug pa dang / skra 'bal ba dang / ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / 'o ma dang / 'o ma ma yin pa dang / 'bras dang / chu dang / lo ma za ba dang / thal bas byug pa dang / skra 'bal ba dang / ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa dang /
translated: the result, the root, milk, non-milk, rice, water, eating leaves, smearing with ashes, pulling out hair, adorning with a crown of matted hair,üîΩdancing, singing, the practice of cows, deer, and peacocks, various costumes, holding jewels, gold, and so on.

original: gar dang / glu dang / ba lang dang / ri dags dang / rma bya'i brtul zhugs dang / cha byad rnam pa du ma dang / rin po che dang / gser la sogs pa 'dzin pas bdag tu smra ba thams cad kyis rnam par thar bar smra bas na bdag tu chags pa yongs su ma spangs kyi bar thar bar mi rung ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par gsol /
analyzed: gar dang / glu dang / ba lang dang / ri dags dang / rma bya'i brtul zhugs dang / cha byad rnam pa du ma dang / rin po che dang / gser la sogs pa 'dzin pas bdag tu smra ba thams cad kyis rnam par thar bar smra bas na bdag tu chags pa yongs su ma spangs kyi bar thar bar mi rung ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par gsol /
translated: The Omniscient One has requested that you establish that as long as attachment to a self is not abandoned, liberation is not possible.‚Äù

original: khyod kyi rang bzhin rnam pa du //
analyzed: khyod kyi rang bzhin rnam pa du //
translated: How many natures do you have?

original: sems ni rnam pa du zhig mchis //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa du zhig mchis //
translated: How many types of mind do you have?

original: @44b btags pa tsam yang ji lta bu //
analyzed: @44b btags pa tsam yang ji lta bu //
translated: How is it mere imputation?

original: smra ba'i mchog gis bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: smra ba'i mchog gis bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please teach this to me, O Foremost of Speakers.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa la rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa la rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is the twofold nature of omniscience:

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du dbye bas 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du dbye bas 'byed pa'o //
translated: it is divided into the concentration with appearance and the concentration without appearance.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The mind is the fundamental consciousness.üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: de yang / lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: the body, enjoyments, and the appearance of the abode

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: are the arising of the fundamental consciousness.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, it is like

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: the ocean and its waves.

original: btags pa tsam ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: btags pa tsam ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The mere designation is the consciousness with the two aspects,

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos pos khams gsum rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos pos khams gsum rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the apprehending subject and the apprehended object, which establishes the three realms.

original: phyi'i don yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: External objects do not exist.

original: sbom po dang bra mo rnam par phye ba na /
analyzed: sbom po dang bra mo rnam par phye ba na /
translated: When the coarse and the fine are distinguished,üîΩhow can they be empty? The Omniscient One should teach this.

original: ji ltar stong bar 'gyur ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas bstan du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos gzhan gyi ched du bsam par rtag go //
analyzed: ji ltar stong bar 'gyur ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas bstan du gsol zhes blo gros chen pos gzhan gyi ched du bsam par rtag go //
translated: Thus, MahƒÅmati always thinks for the sake of others.

original: nam mkha'i sprin rlung ci las gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha'i sprin rlung ci las gyur //
translated: How do clouds in the sky come to be?

original: dran dang yid gzhungs ji ltar 'byung //
analyzed: dran dang yid gzhungs ji ltar 'byung //
translated: How do memory and intelligence arise?

original: shing gi 'khri shing ji ltar mchis //
analyzed: shing gi 'khri shing ji ltar mchis //
translated: How do vines on trees come to be?

original: srid gsum dbang pos bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: srid gsum dbang pos bdag la gsungs //
translated: Lord of the three worlds, please tell me.

original: zhes bya ba la sprin ni sprin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sprin ni sprin te /
translated: Here, a cloud is a cloud.

original: 'jig rten gyi lha la sogs pa'i mgon pos 'jig rten gyi dgos pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lha la sogs pa'i mgon pos 'jig rten gyi dgos pa byed pa'o //
translated: The protector of worldly gods and so forth performs the needs of the world.

original: yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa ni nad med pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa ni nad med pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Memory and so forth arise from health.

original: sems can rnams kyi thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi tshul stug po dang / shing gi lcug ma la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi tshul stug po dang / shing gi lcug ma la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes pa ste /
translated: The various kinds of common and uncommon karma of sentient beings is the dense way of vines on trees and so forth that arise.

original: gang gis sems can rnams la dug dang dug sman la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa na phan pa dang / gnod pa'i 'bras bu lags pas na /
analyzed: gang gis sems can rnams la dug dang dug sman la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa na phan pa dang / gnod pa'i 'bras bu lags pas na /
translated: When sentient beings are distinguished by the differences of poison and medicine and so forth, it is beneficial and harmful results.

original: de de ltar gzung bar so sor snang ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa srid pa gsum gyi dbang po las kyi khyad par du bstan du gsol /
analyzed: de de ltar gzung bar so sor snang ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa srid pa gsum gyi dbang po las kyi khyad par du bstan du gsol /
translated: Please teach the various dependent originations that appear as objects of apprehension, the special faculties and actions of the three existences.

original: sems can mtha' dag gi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs las lhag pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes byung ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: sems can mtha' dag gi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs las lhag pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes byung ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag pa /
translated: Please explain the omniscient wisdom that arises from the accumulation of merit and wisdom of all sentient beings, the supreme lord of yogis who is completely pure,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba mtha' med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud kyi rgyun chen po rangs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba mtha' med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud kyi rgyun chen po rangs par mdzad pa /
translated: who delights the great stream of the limitless minds of beings free from attachment,

original: phung po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pas las @45a * //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pas las @45a * //
translated: the omniscient one who knows all the faculties of form such as the aggregates.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: Please explain the various actions.

original: glang po ri dags rta blun rnams //
analyzed: glang po ri dags rta blun rnams //
translated: Elephants, deer, and foolish horses,

original: gzung du rung ba ci slad du //
analyzed: gzung du rung ba ci slad du //
translated: why are they suitable to be apprehended?

original: ngan pa'i mi rnams ci las gyur //
analyzed: ngan pa'i mi rnams ci las gyur //
translated: Why are bad people so?

original: bdag la sems lung bsgyur bas gsungs //
analyzed: bdag la sems lung bsgyur bas gsungs //
translated: Please explain to me the transformation of the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na gang gis ji ltar yongs su sbyangs pa bzhin du de de ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pas grub par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na gang gis ji ltar yongs su sbyangs pa bzhin du de de ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pas grub par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This mind is luminous by nature. It is established as virtuous or nonvirtuous in accordance with the way it is thoroughly refined.

original: shes rab dang blun pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa na lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang byol song du so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: shes rab dang blun pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa na lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang byol song du so sor snang ngo //
translated: When it is distinguished as having the differences of wisdom, folly, etc., it appears as gods, humans, hell-beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: ma rig pas mnyam par bzhag tu med pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis bye brag rnams kyi rta dang / glang po dang / ri dags rmongs pa rnams sdig pa'i rnam par smin pas zil gyis mnan pas ni blun pa rnams mi blun pa rnams kyis gzung bar btub po //
analyzed: ma rig pas mnyam par bzhag tu med pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis bye brag rnams kyi rta dang / glang po dang / ri dags rmongs pa rnams sdig pa'i rnam par smin pas zil gyis mnan pas ni blun pa rnams mi blun pa rnams kyis gzung bar btub po //
translated: By the power of karma and the maturation of karma, the differences of the continuum of self and others are like the illusions of horses, elephants, and deer. The foolish are overpowered by the maturation of evil. The wise are held by the foolish.

original: mi ma rabs tha shal ngan las la 'grus pa rnams des gzhan pa'i dbang phyug rnams kyis bkol bar byed do //
analyzed: mi ma rabs tha shal ngan las la 'grus pa rnams des gzhan pa'i dbang phyug rnams kyis bkol bar byed do //
translated: The wicked, who are addicted to evil deeds, are employed by the powerful.

original: kye de dag gi sems 'dul ba bo mchog tu yongs su drag cing 'dod chags dang bral bas bshad du gsol /
analyzed: kye de dag gi sems 'dul ba bo mchog tu yongs su drag cing 'dod chags dang bral bas bshad du gsol /
translated: Oh, please explain the supreme taming of their minds, which is very powerful and free from attachment.

original: khams drug 'dzin pa ci slad du //
analyzed: khams drug 'dzin pa ci slad du //
translated: Why are the six elements grasped?

original: 'dod chen par yang ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩskyes pa bud med ma ning rnams //
analyzed: 'dod chen par yang ji ltar 'gyur // skyes pa bud med ma ning rnams //
translated: How does one become a hedonist?

original: ji ltar skye 'gyur bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar skye 'gyur bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please tell me how men, women, and eunuchs are born.

original: zhes bya ba ni las kyi khams drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las kyi khams drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: The six elements are the six elements of action.

original: khams drug ni dus drag go //
analyzed: khams drug ni dus drag go //
translated: The six elements are the six times.

original: 'dod chen pa ni gti mug gi longs spyod rnams la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chen pa ni gti mug gi longs spyod rnams la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The hedonist engages in the enjoyments of delusion.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning rnams kyang las gang gis spyod pa dang / mi spyod par 'jug pa de las rnam pa sna tshogs su thams cad mkhyen pas bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning rnams kyang las gang gis spyod pa dang / mi spyod par 'jug pa de las rnam pa sna tshogs su thams cad mkhyen pas bstan du gsol //
translated: Please explain how men, women, and eunuchs engage in action and non-action due to various types of karma, O Omniscient One.

original: rnal 'byor las ni ji ltar bzlog / rnal 'byor la yang ji ltar 'jug //
analyzed: rnal 'byor las ni ji ltar bzlog / rnal 'byor la yang ji ltar 'jug //
translated: How does one enter into yoga?

original: ci 'dra'i skyes bu ji lta bur //
analyzed: ci 'dra'i skyes bu ji lta bur //
translated: What kind of person is it?

original: rnal 'byor gzhag pa bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gzhag pa bdag la gsungs //
translated: How is yoga to be settled?

original: zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par 'dus pa can kun tu skyo bar gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par 'dus pa can kun tu skyo bar gyur te /
translated: Thus, one who is completely weary of the mind's equalized concentration,

original: skad cig pa tsam gyis rnal 'byor las yul rnams su 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: skad cig pa tsam gyis rnal 'byor las yul rnams su 'jug par byed do //
translated: enters into the objects of yoga by means of an instant.

original: gang yang stong ba nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i @45b sgo rnams mi bsgom pa de ni phyi'i don mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes par dmigs pa'i tshul du rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gang yang stong ba nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i @45b sgo rnams mi bsgom pa de ni phyi'i don mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes par dmigs pa'i tshul du rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: One who does not cultivate the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, conceptualizes the external object in terms of the mode of the apprehension of the beautiful and the ugly.

original: gang yang shes rab kyis phyi'i don sbom pa dang phra ba nyid rnam par gzhig cing mi dmigs pa ni rnal 'byor la mi ldog cing de ltar mnyam par 'jog pa las rgyun tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang yang shes rab kyis phyi'i don sbom pa dang phra ba nyid rnam par gzhig cing mi dmigs pa ni rnal 'byor la mi ldog cing de ltar mnyam par 'jog pa las rgyun tu 'jug ste /
translated: One who, by means of wisdom, destroys the gross and subtle external object and does not apprehend it, does not turn away from yoga. Thus, one enters into a continuous state of equipoise.

original: yul rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees objects as impermanent, painful, ugly, and empty.

original: gang dag shes rab kyis sems mnyam par 'dus te /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyis sems mnyam par 'dus te /
translated: Those who, with wisdom, gather the mind

original: yul rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par mthong zhing skye ba can de rnam pa de lta bu dang ldan pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang pos gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de dag kyang bstan du gsol /
analyzed: yul rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par mthong zhing skye ba can de rnam pa de lta bu dang ldan pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang pos gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de dag kyang bstan du gsol /
translated: and see objects as impermanent, painful, ugly, and empty, and who are born with such a nature, may the lord of yoga teach them the selflessness of persons and phenomena.üîΩWhat are the characteristics of the signs

original: 'gro bar phyin pa'i sems can gyi //üîΩmtshan ma mtshan nyid ji lta bur //
analyzed: 'gro bar phyin pa'i sems can gyi // mtshan ma mtshan nyid ji lta bur //
translated: of beings who have gone to the realms?

original: gang gis ji ltar phyug por 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar phyug por 'gyur //
translated: By what and how do they become rich?üîΩMay the one like space tell me this.

original: mkha' 'dras bdag la bka' stsol cig / ces bya ba ni btsas ma thag la dga' ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan yang dag par snang bas na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: mkha' 'dras bdag la bka' stsol cig / ces bya ba ni btsas ma thag la dga' ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan yang dag par snang bas na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
translated: As soon as they are born, joy, destruction, and sorrow appear to them, and so the existence of prior habituation is inferred.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba bsgrub par gdon mi za bar sngar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba bsgrub par gdon mi za bar sngar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of suffering and happiness is beyond doubt.

original: spang ba dang / blang ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo can rnams kyi shes pa'i khyad par bla ma'i yang bla ma gang dang gang yin pa de dang de ni slob ma rnams mkhas pa'i phul du phyin pa'i khyad par bzhin du thog ma thog mar thos pa dang /üîΩsems pa la sogs par sbyong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: spang ba dang / blang ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo can rnams kyi shes pa'i khyad par bla ma'i yang bla ma gang dang gang yin pa de dang de ni slob ma rnams mkhas pa'i phul du phyin pa'i khyad par bzhin du thog ma thog mar thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs par sbyong ba'i phyir te /
translated: The difference in the knowledge of those who have the attitude of rejection, acceptance, and equanimity, which is the highest of the high, is due to the difference in the degree of their learning, reflection, etc.

original: de bas na btsal ma thag pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par yod do //
analyzed: de bas na btsal ma thag pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par yod do //
translated: Therefore, immediately after the search, there is a difference in the degree of wisdom, etc.

original: tshor ba med pa'i 'byung ba rnams las de dag ji ltar na yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa'i 'byung ba rnams las de dag ji ltar na yod par 'gyur /
translated: How can they exist in the primary elements, which are devoid of feeling?

original: de bas na 'gro bar phyin pa rnams kyis shes rab la sogs pa'i mtshan mas tshe gzhan bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'gro bar phyin pa rnams kyis shes rab la sogs pa'i mtshan mas tshe gzhan bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, those who have gone to the other shore establish the existence of wisdom, etc., in another life by means of the marks of wisdom, etc.

original: 'byung ba rnams la khyad par med pas na 'gro ba'i rnam pa du ma ji ltar na rung /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams la khyad par med pas na 'gro ba'i rnam pa du ma ji ltar na rung /
translated: How can the various kinds of life be possible, since there is no difference in the primary elements?

original: de dag tha dad pa'i phyir zhes de skad na ni 'byung ba rnams kyi tha dad pa'i khyad par du yang sus byed /
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa'i phyir zhes de skad na ni 'byung ba rnams kyi tha dad pa'i khyad par du yang sus byed /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause they are different,‚Äù then who makes the difference of the elements?

original: gal te rgyu gzhan gyi khyad par med na ni de dag gi che chung gi dngos po ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gzhan gyi khyad par med na ni de dag gi che chung gi dngos po ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no difference in the cause, how could there be a difference in their size?

original: des na 'gro ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gzhan du ma 'thad kyi @46a * //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gzhan du ma 'thad kyi @46a * //
translated: Therefore, the various aspects of the world are not tenable as other.

original: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpag go //
translated: The other cause is inferred.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas chos bsdu pa las gsungs pa /üîΩdud pas me ni shes par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas chos bsdu pa las gsungs pa / dud pas me ni shes par byed //
translated: As it is said in the Compendium of Dharma by the Omniscient One:üîΩSmoke is known to be fire.

original: bya bzhad kyis ni chur shes byed //
analyzed: bya bzhad kyis ni chur shes byed //
translated: A thirsty bird is known to be water.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes ldan gyi //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes ldan gyi //
translated: The wise bodhisattva

original: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams kyis shes //
translated: knows the signs of the family.

original: de bas na shes rab dang / nad med pa dang / longs spyod dang / bzhin byad dang / skad kyi nga ro la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams las skyes pa dang / dbul ba dang nad la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sdig pa las 'byung bar rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab dang / nad med pa dang / longs spyod dang / bzhin byad dang / skad kyi nga ro la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams las skyes pa dang / dbul ba dang nad la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sdig pa las 'byung bar rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, we infer that the effects of merit are wisdom, health, wealth, beauty, melodious voice, etc., and that the effects of demerit are poverty, sickness, etc.

original: rgyu du ma las 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skyes pa ni mtshon du mas ri mo bris pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyu du ma las 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skyes pa ni mtshon du mas ri mo bris pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The effect born of many causes is like a picture drawn by many artists.

original: 'jig rten gyi rnam pa sna tshogs phyug pa dang / dbul ba dang / gzugs legs pa dang / mi legs pa dang / nad dang / nad med pa mtshan ma las skyes par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rnam pa sna tshogs phyug pa dang / dbul ba dang / gzugs legs pa dang / mi legs pa dang / nad dang / nad med pa mtshan ma las skyes par rjes su dpag go //
translated: We infer that the various aspects of the world, such as wealth, poverty, good looks, ugliness, sickness, and health, are born from signs.

original: ji ltar ci zhig sh'akya'i rigs //
analyzed: ji ltar ci zhig sh'akya'i rigs //
translated: How is it that you are of the ≈öƒÅkya clan?

original: bu ram shing skyes ji ltar byung //
analyzed: bu ram shing skyes ji ltar byung //
translated: How did you come to be born from a sugarcane?

original: yun ring drang srong dka' thub gang //
analyzed: yun ring drang srong dka' thub gang //
translated: For how long have you been an ascetic?

original: khyod kyis de ni ji ltar bslabs //
analyzed: khyod kyis de ni ji ltar bslabs //
translated: How did you train in that?

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gros pa chen po'i rigs su klog pa sngon ser skya'i gnas su drang srong ser skya gnas pas ma sa dben gyi sring mo chung mar long shig par rgyal rigs gzhon nu rnams la des smras pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gros pa chen po'i rigs su klog pa sngon ser skya'i gnas su drang srong ser skya gnas pas ma sa dben gyi sring mo chung mar long shig par rgyal rigs gzhon nu rnams la des smras pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The young men of the Shakya clan said to him, ‚Äú

original: ci de ltar byed nus sam /
analyzed: ci de ltar byed nus sam /
translated: Can you do that?‚Äù

original: yang des smras pa /
analyzed: yang des smras pa /
translated: He said, ‚Äú

original: nus zhes so //
analyzed: nus zhes so //
translated: I can.‚Äù

original: de nas sh'akya zhes ming byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas sh'akya zhes ming byung ngo //
translated: Then they were called Shakya.

original: de dag las rgyal rigs gzhon nu zhig rab tu byung nas de'i gnas su rkun po zhig byung ba'i chag par de gsal shing gis phug pa dang / de'i mkhan po dka' thub can du yun ring dka' thub gling skyes zhes bya ba des de mthong nas /
analyzed: de dag las rgyal rigs gzhon nu zhig rab tu byung nas de'i gnas su rkun po zhig byung ba'i chag par de gsal shing gis phug pa dang / de'i mkhan po dka' thub can du yun ring dka' thub gling skyes zhes bya ba des de mthong nas /
translated: One young man of the Shakya clan went forth. In his place a thief came and was impaled on a stake. His preceptor, who had practiced austerities for a long time, was called Dhutaguna Dƒ´rghatapas. He saw this and asked, ‚ÄúSon, what is this?‚ÄùüîΩHe told his preceptor what had happened.

original: bu de ci zhes dris pa dang / ji lta bur gyur pa des mkhan po la smras pa'i 'og tu des kyang mu stegs can gyi lta bar smras pa /
analyzed: bu de ci zhes dris pa dang / ji lta bur gyur pa des mkhan po la smras pa'i 'og tu des kyang mu stegs can gyi lta bar smras pa /
translated: Then he said, ‚Äú

original: bud med la ni 'gro ba med //
analyzed: bud med la ni 'gro ba med //
translated: Women have no rebirth.

original: ces so // de bas na bu skye bar gyis /
analyzed: ces so // de bas na bu skye bar gyis /
translated: Thus, son, beget a son.

original: ji ltar zhes pa dang smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa dang smras pa /
translated: How?

original: sngon gyi longs spyod kyi rjes su dran par byas te /
analyzed: sngon gyi longs spyod kyi rjes su dran par byas te /
translated: By remembering the enjoyment of the past,üîΩand by emitting semen.

original: khu ba 'byin par gyis shig de'i khu ba'i tshigs pas bu gnyis su red pa bur ma shing gir bar zhugs pa dang / drang srong gis gsos @46b nas /
analyzed: khu ba 'byin par gyis shig de'i khu ba'i tshigs pas bu gnyis su red pa bur ma shing gir bar zhugs pa dang / drang srong gis gsos @46b nas /
translated: The two sons born from that semen entered the womb of a sugar cane plant, and were raised by the sage.

original: de'i tshe bu ram shing skyes zhes ming du gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bu ram shing skyes zhes ming du gyur to //
translated: At that time, the name ‚ÄúSugar Cane Born‚Äù came to be.

original: khyod nyid zhing rnams thams cad du //
analyzed: khyod nyid zhing rnams thams cad du //
translated: In all the fields,

original: mtshan dang de bzhin gzugs sna tshogs //
analyzed: mtshan dang de bzhin gzugs sna tshogs //
translated: with various signs and forms,

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyis bskor bar yang //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyis bskor bar yang //
translated: surrounded by the Victor‚Äôs sons,

original: ci yi skad du kun nas gda' //
analyzed: ci yi skad du kun nas gda' //
translated: why do you appear everywhere?üîΩLike the sun, alone, it appears in many vessels of water in the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bzhin du gcig pu nyid 'jig rten tha dad par chu'i snod du mar snang ba bzhin sprul pa mang po 'phros nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bzhin du gcig pu nyid 'jig rten tha dad par chu'i snod du mar snang ba bzhin sprul pa mang po 'phros nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag cing /
translated: Having emanated many emanations, the yogic lord is completely pure with various forms.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa ye shes kyi mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa ye shes kyi mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad pa /
translated: He delights the mind-streams of infinite sentient beings with the wisdom of omniscience.

original: skar ma'i bdag po skar ma'i tshogs kyis bskor ba bzhin du rnam pa mang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bzhugs shing 'gro ba ma lus par gang bar kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: skar ma'i bdag po skar ma'i tshogs kyis bskor ba bzhin du rnam pa mang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bzhugs shing 'gro ba ma lus par gang bar kun tu snang ngo //
translated: He is surrounded by a retinue of many bodhisattvas, like the moon surrounded by a multitude of stars.

original: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten nas gshegs pa dang / yum sgyu ma'i lhums su zhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol ba dang / dka' ba spyad pa dang / bdud bcom pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'da' bas /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten nas gshegs pa dang / yum sgyu ma'i lhums su zhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol ba dang / dka' ba spyad pa dang / bdud bcom pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'da' bas /
translated: He appears to all without exception, descending from the heavens, entering the womb of his mother Maya, being born, enjoying himself as a youth, practicing austerities, conquering Mara, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and passing into nirvana.

original: sems can skyo bar mdzad pa dang / sems can go 'dun gyi mdzad pas khyab pa gzugs rnam ba sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang pos sems can rnams mang po rab tu 'byed pa chud bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: sems can skyo bar mdzad pa dang / sems can go 'dun gyi mdzad pas khyab pa gzugs rnam ba sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang pos sems can rnams mang po rab tu 'byed pa chud bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: You who are skilled in the various forms of yoga, please explain to us the various types of beings, and how they are classified.

original: ji ltar sha rnams bzar mi rung //
analyzed: ji ltar sha rnams bzar mi rung //
translated: Why is it that some beings are not fit to eat meat?

original: ji ltar sha ni bkag pa lags //
analyzed: ji ltar sha ni bkag pa lags //
translated: Why is it that meat is prohibited?

original: sha za'i rigs su skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: sha za'i rigs su skyes pa rnams //
translated: Why is it that some beings are born in the class of carnivores,

original: sha 'tshal bar yang ji ltar gyur //
analyzed: sha 'tshal bar yang ji ltar gyur //
translated: and why is it that they come to crave meat?
